original: smon lam chen po mngon par sgrub bo //

translated: in order to manifest birth in all the paths of the childish, without being different from the single path of the childish,üîΩin order to manifest the seat of enlightenment, the turning of the wheel of Dharma, and the great parinirvƒÅ·πáa,

translated: and in order to manifest the appearance of buddhas in accordance with the aspirations of all beings in the realm of beings through the power and wisdom of the great domain of the buddhas,

analyzed: khams thams cad kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas 'byung ba dal ba la rtog par byed / zhi bar byed /

analyzed: las lnga pa ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po bstan nas yang spyod pa'i stobs rgyun mi 'chad pa yin par rig par bya'o //

translated: The sixth function should be understood as the teaching of the purity of all phenomena, such as the s≈´tras, on the stage of the Buddha's pristine awareness.

translated: O sons of the Victorious Ones, in this way, the bodhisattva who is on the bhumi Joyful because of these ten great vows, great efforts, and great accomplishments, and because of these ten great doors of aspiration and so forth, completely accomplishes a full hundred thousand countless aspirations.

original: de ltar bdag gi smon lam chen po 'di dag sems can mtha' gang du thug pa de'i mthar thug par gyur cig / bdag gi smon lam chen po 'di dag ye shes kyi rgyud kyi khams kyi bar @144b dag gi mtha' gang du thug pa de'i mthar thugüîΩpar gyur cig / ji ltar sems can gyi khams kyi mthar thug pa med pa de ltar bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di dag kyang mthar thug pa med par gyur cig / ye shes kyi rgyud kyi khams kyi bar dag gi mthar thug pa med pa ltar
analyzed: de ltar bdag gi smon lam chen po 'di dag sems can mtha' gang du thug pa de'i mthar thug par gyur cig / bdag gi smon lam chen po 'di dag ye shes kyi rgyud kyi khams kyi bar @144b dag gi mtha' gang du thug pa de'i mthar thug par gyur cig / ji ltar sems can gyi khams kyi mthar thug pa med pa de ltar bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di dag kyang mthar thug pa med par gyur cig / ye shes kyi rgyud kyi khams kyi bar dag gi mthar thug pa med pa ltar
translated: May my great aspirations reach the very limits of the realm of wisdom.üîΩJust as the realm of sentient beings has no limit, so too may my roots of virtue have no limit.

original: bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di dag kyang mthar thug pa med par gyur cig ces gsungs pa'o //üîΩde la sems can gyi khams kyi mthar thug pa ni yan lag go //

original: 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mthar thug pa nas /

analyzed: sems can gyi khams kyi mthar thug pa zhes bya ba dang / gang du gnas pa ste 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mthar thug pa zhes bya ba dang / ji snyed pa ste / nam mkha'i khams kyi mthar thug pa zhes bya ba dang / chos bstan pa gang gis gdul bar bya ba ste /
translated: the extent of sentient beings, the ultimate element of space,üîΩthe teaching of the Dharma by which they are trained,

analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i khams kyi mthar thug pa zhes bya ba dang / gdams ngag gang la brten nas te /
translated: the instruction on which they rely,üîΩthe ultimate element of the lineage of the Three Jewels,üîΩand the time when they are trained, the ultimate element of the future.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi khams kyi mthar thug pa zhes bya ba dang / dmigs pa gang gis te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi khams kyi mthar thug pa zhes bya ba dang / dmigs pa gang gis te /

translated: The engagement in the conduct of the past is from the time of taking up the Bodhisattva practicesüîΩup to the time of attaining the stage of joy.

translated: In this regard, one should have perfect confidence in the bodhisattva's conduct that is included in the beginning by means of two aspects:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa de gang yin pa dang / rim pa gang gis te ;
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa de gang yin pa dang / rim pa gang gis te ;

original: mu stegs can dang / bdud dang phyir rgol ba'i gnyen po'i khyad par gnyis kyis khyad par du 'phags pa ni gang gi phyir mi 'jigs pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / stobs dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa mi 'phrogs pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can dang / bdud dang phyir rgol ba'i gnyen po'i khyad par gnyis kyis khyad par du 'phags pa ni gang gi phyir mi 'jigs pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / stobs dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa mi 'phrogs pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is superior by the two special antidotes to the tirthikas, demons, and adversaries, because it is said that it is the complete perfection of fearlessness, the powers, and the unshared qualities of a Buddha.

original: mthu bsam gyis mi khyab par rgya che ba'i khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: mthu bsam gyis mi khyab par rgya che ba'i khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: It is superior by the special vastness of inconceivable power, because it is said that

original: sangs @145b rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs @145b rgyas kyi chos bsam gyis mi khyab ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: the qualities of a Buddha are inconceivable.

original: ye shes tha mi dad cing zab pa nyid kyi khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: ye shes tha mi dad cing zab pa nyid kyi khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: It is superior by the special profundity of the non-differentiation of pristine wisdom, because it is said that

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul mtha' dang dbung med pa mngon par sgrub pa zhes gsungs pa'o //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul tshad med pa dang ldan pa la 'jug pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod yul tshad med pa dang ldan pa la 'jug pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and the entrance into the immeasurable domain of the Tathagata.

original: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyes pa thams cad dang gtan du bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyes pa thams cad dang gtan du bral ba'i phyir /
translated: Because of the complete absence of all faults together with their instincts,

original: bral ba'i khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: bral ba'i khyad par gyis khyad par du 'phags pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: the special excellence of the separation is taught,

original: 'bras bu yongs su 'grub pa la yid ches pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu yongs su 'grub pa la yid ches pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and the certainty of the accomplishment of the result.

original: yang mdor bsdus na sngon gyi mtha'i spyod pa la 'jug pa de /
analyzed: yang mdor bsdus na sngon gyi mtha'i spyod pa la 'jug pa de /
translated: Moreover, in brief, the entrance into the former limit is taught

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i bar du nges par bstan pa dang / 'dzin pa la mngon par yid ches pa yin no zhes bya bas ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i bar du nges par bstan pa dang / 'dzin pa la mngon par yid ches pa yin no zhes bya bas ston to //
translated: by the certainty of the teaching of all the Bodhisattva practices up to the stage of the Tathagata, and by the certainty of the understanding of the retention.

original: de la nges pa bstan pa ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la nges pa bstan pa ni bstan pa'o //
translated: Here, the certainty of the teaching is the teaching.

original: 'dzin pa ni rtogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni rtogs pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: And the certainty of the understanding is the realization.

original: de rnam pa gsum gyi phyir /
analyzed: de rnam pa gsum gyi phyir /
translated: This is threefold,

original: sems can rnams la snying rje chen po 'jug par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams la snying rje chen po 'jug par rig par bya ste /
translated: and one should know that it is the entrance into great compassion for all beings.

original: don dam pa'i bde ba dang mi ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dang / de las bzlog pas so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bde ba dang mi ldan pa dang / sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dang / de las bzlog pas so //

original: 'di ltar gos pa med de 'di ltar tshad med cing /
analyzed: 'di ltar gos pa med de 'di ltar tshad med cing /
translated: so free from defilement, so immeasurable,

original: 'di ltar rgya che la sangs rgyas kyi chos 'di dag ni 'di ltar sgrub par dka' na zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgya che la sangs rgyas kyi chos 'di dag ni 'di ltar sgrub par dka' na zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: so vast, and so difficult to practice.

original: sdug bsngal dang ldan pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang ldan pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How are they endowed with suffering?

original: 'on kyang byis pa so so'i skye bo 'di dag lta ba ngan par ltung ba'i sems kyi rgyud dang / ma rig pa'i mun pas kun nas khebs pa'i yid dang / nga rgyal gyi rgyal mtshan shin tu rtog pa rnams dang ; sred pa'i dra bas mngon par 'dod pa'i yid la byed pa rnams dang /
analyzed: 'on kyang byis pa so so'i skye bo 'di dag lta ba ngan par ltung ba'i sems kyi rgyud dang / ma rig pa'i mun pas kun nas khebs pa'i yid dang / nga rgyal gyi rgyal mtshan shin tu rtog pa rnams dang ; sred pa'i dra bas mngon par 'dod pa'i yid la byed pa rnams dang /
translated: and mental engagements that are manifestly attached by the net of craving.üîΩThey have mental attitudes that follow the thicket of deceit and fraud,

original: sgyu dang g-yo'i thibs po'i rjes su rgyu ba'i sems kyi bsam pa rnams dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang mtshungs par ldan pas 'gro bar skyed par sbyor ba rnams dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la @146a * //
analyzed: sgyu dang g-yo'i thibs po'i rjes su rgyu ba'i sems kyi bsam pa rnams dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna dang mtshungs par ldan pas 'gro bar skyed par sbyor ba rnams dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug la @146a * //
translated: and they engage in the generation of going that is concomitant with jealousy and miserliness, as well as attachment, anger, and delusion.

original: 'dris pa'i las la sogs pa rnams dang / khro ba dang khon du 'dzin pas spangs pa'i sems kyi me lce 'bar ba rnams dang / phyin ci log dang mtshungs par ldan pas las bya ba mngon par bsgrubs pa rnams dang / 'dod pa dang srid pa dang /
analyzed: 'dris pa'i las la sogs pa rnams dang / khro ba dang khon du 'dzin pas spangs pa'i sems kyi me lce 'bar ba rnams dang / phyin ci log dang mtshungs par ldan pas las bya ba mngon par bsgrubs pa rnams dang / 'dod pa dang srid pa dang /
translated: the fire of anger and resentment,üîΩthe seeds of name-and-form that are associated with the defilements of desire, existence, and ignorance,

original: ma rig pa'i zag pa dang 'brel pa'i sems yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i sa bon rnams kyis gang 'di khams gsum du ming dang gzugs dang lhan cig mi 'byung ba mi 'bral ba yang srid ba'i myu gu mngon par 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i zag pa dang 'brel pa'i sems yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i sa bon rnams kyis gang 'di khams gsum du ming dang gzugs dang lhan cig mi 'byung ba mi 'bral ba yang srid ba'i myu gu mngon par 'grub par byed do //
translated: and the seeds of the mind, mentation, and consciousness.

original: ming dang gzugs de rnam par 'phel nas skye mched drug gi grong 'byung bar 'gyur ro//
analyzed: ming dang gzugs de rnam par 'phel nas skye mched drug gi grong 'byung bar 'gyur ro//
translated: Name-and-form increases and the city of the six sense sources arises.

original: skye mched rnams byung nas phan tshun reg ste phrad pas tshor ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye mched rnams byung nas phan tshun reg ste phrad pas tshor ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the sense sources arise, they mutually touch and contact, and feeling arises.

original: tshor ba de nyid la phyi phyir zhing mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa dang / len pa rnam par 'phel lo //
analyzed: tshor ba de nyid la phyi phyir zhing mngon par dga' ba'i sred pa dang / len pa rnam par 'phel lo //
translated: Craving, which is the delight in and attachment to that feeling, and grasping increase.

original: nye bar len pa rnam par 'phel nas srid pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nye bar len pa rnam par 'phel nas srid pa 'byung ngo //
translated: When grasping increases, becoming comes to be.

original: byung nas skye ba dang / rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: byung nas skye ba dang / rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: When there is becoming, birth, aging, death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, dejection, and anguish come to be.

original: de ltar sems can de dag gi sdug bsngal gyi phung po bdag dang bdag gi med pa /
analyzed: de ltar sems can de dag gi sdug bsngal gyi phung po bdag dang bdag gi med pa /
translated: Thus, this mass of suffering of beings comes to be, which is without self or anything pertaining to a self,

original: gsob / gsog / stong pa /üîΩg-yo ba med pa /
analyzed: gsob / gsog / stong pa / g-yo ba med pa /
translated: hollow, void, false, and deceptive.

original: byed pa med pa /
analyzed: byed pa med pa /
translated: It is without agent, without experiencer.üîΩIt is inanimate, like a wall or a clod of earth.

original: bems po // rtsva dang / shing dang ; rtsig pa dang / mig yor lta bu mngon par 'grub kyang zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: bems po // rtsva dang / shing dang ; rtsig pa dang / mig yor lta bu mngon par 'grub kyang zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: It is established as a mere mass of suffering, though it is not really so.

original: de ltar sdug bsngal dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal dang ldan pas so //
translated: Thus, it is because of being endowed with suffering.

original: ji ltar na de las bzlog pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de las bzlog pas she na /
translated: How is it the opposite of that?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: 'di ltar de khong du chud do zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar de khong du chud do zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: it is understood in this way.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zab pa nyid rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zab pa nyid rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
translated: The qualities of the Buddha should be known as ninefold profound.

original: dben pa zab pa nyid dang / zhi ba zab pa nyid dang / stong pa zab pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa zab pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa zab pa nyid dang / gos pa med pa zab pa nyid dang / tshad med pa zab pa nyid dang /
analyzed: dben pa zab pa nyid dang / zhi ba zab pa nyid dang / stong pa zab pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa zab pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa zab pa nyid dang / gos pa med pa zab pa nyid dang / tshad med pa zab pa nyid dang /
translated: They are profound in terms of isolation, peace, emptiness, signlessness, wishlessness, nondefilement, immeasurability,

original: rgya che ba zab pa nyid dang / bsgrub dka' ba zab pa nyid do ;
analyzed: rgya che ba zab pa nyid dang / bsgrub dka' ba zab pa nyid do ;
translated: vastness, and difficulty of realization.

original: / de la dben pa ni sgro 'dogs pa'i don dang / sgro btags pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: / de la dben pa ni sgro 'dogs pa'i don dang / sgro btags pa'i don gyis so //
translated: Isolation is due to the object of imputation and the imputed object.

original: zhi ba ni don gyi chos nyid kyis so //
analyzed: zhi ba ni don gyi chos nyid kyis so //
translated: Peace is due to the reality of the object.

original: stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la dmigs pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa gsum gyi gnyen po ste /
analyzed: stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la dmigs pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa gsum gyi gnyen po ste /
translated: Emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness are the three doors of liberation. They are the three kinds of antidotes to the three kinds of adverse elements.

original: mi mthun @146b pa'i phyogs rnam pa gsum ni rnam par rtog pa dang / mtshan ma dang ldan pa dang / bral ba la smon pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun @146b pa'i phyogs rnam pa gsum ni rnam par rtog pa dang / mtshan ma dang ldan pa dang / bral ba la smon pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of adverse elements are: discursive thought, the possession of signs, and the aspiration for freedom.

original: gos pa med pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi chos spong ba'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gos pa med pa ni nyon mongs pa can gyi chos spong ba'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of defilement is the objective of the abandonment of defiled things.

original: tshad med pa ni grangs med pa dang / brtag mi nus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skye ba'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad med pa ni grangs med pa dang / brtag mi nus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skye ba'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The immeasurables are the objective of the arising of innumerable and incalculable wholesome roots.

original: rgya che ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don byed par rtogs pa'i ye shes kyi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgya che ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don byed par rtogs pa'i ye shes kyi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The vast is the objective of the knowledge which understands the performance of benefit for oneself and others.

original: bsgrub dka' ba ni bskal ba grangs med pa gsum gyis thob par bya ba'i ye shes kyi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub dka' ba ni bskal ba grangs med pa gsum gyis thob par bya ba'i ye shes kyi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The difficult to fathom is the objective of the knowledge which is attained after three incalculable aeons.

original: 'on kyang sems can 'di dag ni lta ba ngan par ltung ba'i sems kyi rgyud ces bya ba ni lta ba ngan pa rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang sems can 'di dag ni lta ba ngan par ltung ba'i sems kyi rgyud ces bya ba ni lta ba ngan pa rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, these beings have a mental continuum which has fallen into bad views. The bad views should be understood as ninefold:

original: kun nas khebs pa'i yid kyi lta ba ngan pa ni gang gi phyir ma rig pa'i mun pas kun nas khebs pa'i yid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas khebs pa'i yid kyi lta ba ngan pa ni gang gi phyir ma rig pa'i mun pas kun nas khebs pa'i yid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The bad view of the mind that is completely covered is stated because the mind is completely covered by the darkness of ignorance.

original: yid kyi kun du rtog pa'i lta ba ngan pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: yid kyi kun du rtog pa'i lta ba ngan pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The bad view of the mind that is a conception is stated because

original: nga rgyal gyi rgyal mtshan shin tu bsgreng ba'i kun du rtog pa rnams zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi rgyal mtshan shin tu bsgreng ba'i kun du rtog pa rnams zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: the conceptions are the banner of pride that is completely raised.

original: srid pa'i yid la byed pa'i lta ba ngan pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: srid pa'i yid la byed pa'i lta ba ngan pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The bad view of the mind that is a mental activity is stated because

original: sred pa'i dra bas mngon par 'dod pa'i yid la byed pa rnams zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa'i dra bas mngon par 'dod pa'i yid la byed pa rnams zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: the mental activities are the mental activities that are manifestly desired by the net of craving.

original: sgyu dang g-yo'i bsam pa'i lta ba ngan pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: sgyu dang g-yo'i bsam pa'i lta ba ngan pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The bad view of the mind that is an intention is stated because

original: sgyu dang g-yo'i thibs po'i rjes su rgyu ba'i sems kyi bsam pa rnams zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu dang g-yo'i thibs po'i rjes su rgyu ba'i sems kyi bsam pa rnams zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: the intentions are the intentions of the mind that follow the thicket of deceit and fraud.üîΩThe bad view of the mind that is a practice is stated because

original: phrag dog dang ser sna'i sbyor ba'i lta ba ngan pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: phrag dog dang ser sna'i sbyor ba'i lta ba ngan pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: the practices are the practices of jealousy and stinginess.

original: phrag dog dang ser sna dang mtshungs par ldan pas 'gro bar skye ba sbyor ba rnams zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: phrag dog dang ser sna dang mtshungs par ldan pas 'gro bar skye ba sbyor ba rnams zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The connections to rebirth are those that are associated with envy and stinginess.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug la 'dris pa'i las la sogs pa'i lta ba ngan pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug la 'dris pa'i las la sogs pa'i lta ba ngan pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The bad views are those that are associated with attachment, hatred, and delusion.

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug la 'dris pa'i las la sogs pa rnams zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug la 'dris pa'i las la sogs pa rnams zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The actions are those that are associated with attachment, hatred, and delusion.

original: sbar ba'i sems kyi me lce 'bar ba'i sems kyi lta ba ngan pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: sbar ba'i sems kyi me lce 'bar ba'i sems kyi lta ba ngan pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The bad views are those that are associated with the blazing flames of the mind.

original: khro ba dang khon du 'dzin pas sbar ba'i sems kyi me lce 'bar ba rnams zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩlas bya ba mngon par bsgrub pa'i lta ba ngan pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: khro ba dang khon du 'dzin pas sbar ba'i sems kyi me lce 'bar ba rnams zhes gsungs pa'o // las bya ba mngon par bsgrub pa'i lta ba ngan pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The blazing flames of the mind are those that are associated with anger and resentment.üîΩThe bad views are those that are associated with the performance of actions.

original: phyin ci log dang mtshungs par ldan pas las bya ba mngon par sgrub pa rnams zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log dang mtshungs par ldan pas las bya ba mngon par sgrub pa rnams zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The performance of actions is associated with error.

original: sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i sa bon gyi lta ba ngan pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i sa bon gyi lta ba ngan pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The bad views of the seeds of mind, mentation, and consciousness are as follows.

original: 'dod pa dang / srid pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa dang 'brel pa'i sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i sa bon rnams kyis zhes gsungs @147a * //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / srid pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa dang 'brel pa'i sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i sa bon rnams kyis zhes gsungs @147a * //
translated: Because of the seeds of mind, mentation, and consciousness that are connected with the defilements of desire, becoming, and ignorance.

original: pa'o // de la kun nas khebs pa'i yid kyi lta ba ngan pa dang / yid kyi kun du rtog pa'i lta ba ngan pa dang / sred pa'i yid la byed pa'i lta ba ngan pa dang / lta ba ngan pa gsum ni don gyi chos nyid dang /
analyzed: pa'o // de la kun nas khebs pa'i yid kyi lta ba ngan pa dang / yid kyi kun du rtog pa'i lta ba ngan pa dang / sred pa'i yid la byed pa'i lta ba ngan pa dang / lta ba ngan pa gsum ni don gyi chos nyid dang /
translated: Among them, the bad views of the mind that is completely covered, the bad views of the mind that is discursive thought, and the bad views of the mind that is craving, these three bad views are, respectively, in regard to the reality of the object,

original: sgro 'dogs pa'i don dang / sgro btags pa las brtsams te go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa'i don dang / sgro btags pa las brtsams te go rims bzhin no //
translated: the object of superimposition, and the superimposition itself.

original: sgyu dang g-yo'i bsam pa'i lta ba ngan pa dang / phrag dog dang ser sna'i sbyor ba'i lta ba ngan pa gnyis ni yongs su tshol ba'i dus na bsam pa dang sbyor ba'i nyes pa ste /
analyzed: sgyu dang g-yo'i bsam pa'i lta ba ngan pa dang / phrag dog dang ser sna'i sbyor ba'i lta ba ngan pa gnyis ni yongs su tshol ba'i dus na bsam pa dang sbyor ba'i nyes pa ste /
translated: The bad views of the intention of deceit and pretense, and the bad views of the application of envy and stinginess, these two bad views are the faults of intention and application at the time of thorough searching.

original: de la phrag dog gi ni lus la sogs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la phrag dog gi ni lus la sogs par sbyar ro //
translated: The view of jealousy is applied to the body, etc.

original: ser snas ni longs spyod rnams la ste /
analyzed: ser snas ni longs spyod rnams la ste /
translated: The view of avarice is applied to enjoyments.

original: 'di ltar 'gro ba gzhan dag tu lus dang longs spyod ngan par skye ba yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'gro ba gzhan dag tu lus dang longs spyod ngan par skye ba yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: Thus, one grasps a bad body and enjoyments in other migrations.

original: drug pa ste 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug la 'dris pa'i las la sogs pa'i lta ba ngan pa ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dang / gnyi ga las bzlog pa'i yul la yongs su spyod pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: drug pa ste 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug la 'dris pa'i las la sogs pa'i lta ba ngan pa ni sdug pa dang mi sdug pa dang / gnyi ga las bzlog pa'i yul la yongs su spyod pa'i dus na'o //
translated: The sixth, the view of the karma of the habitual tendencies of passion, hatred, and folly, is at the time of enjoying objects that are attractive, unattractive, or both.

original: bdun pa ste sbar ba'i sems kyi me lce 'bar ba'i lta ba ngan pa ni phan tshun gnod pa byed pa dang mdud par 'dzin pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: bdun pa ste sbar ba'i sems kyi me lce 'bar ba'i lta ba ngan pa ni phan tshun gnod pa byed pa dang mdud par 'dzin pa'i dus na'o //
translated: The seventh, the view of the blazing fire of the mind, is at the time of mutual harm and grasping.

original: brgyad pa ste las bya ba mngon par sgrub pa'i lta ba ngan pa ni phan tshun gnod pa byed pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa ste las bya ba mngon par sgrub pa'i lta ba ngan pa ni phan tshun gnod pa byed pa'i dus na'o //
translated: The eighth, the view of the accomplishment of the karma to be done, is at the time of mutual harm.

original: dgu pa ste /
analyzed: dgu pa ste /
translated: The ninth,

original: sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i sa bon gyi lta ba ngan pa ni /
analyzed: sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i sa bon gyi lta ba ngan pa ni /
translated: the view of the seeds of mind, mentality, and consciousness,üîΩis at the time of the arising of the three realms.

original: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i dge ba'i las byed pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i dge ba'i las byed pa'i dus na'o //
translated: when one is engaged in virtuous actions that arise from generosity, morality, and meditation.

original: de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: In this regard, dependent origination should be understood in three ways:

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni srid pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni srid pa'i bar du'o //
translated: in terms of its own characteristic, up to the stage of becoming;

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni skye ba la sogs pa'i nyes dmigs rnams so //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni skye ba la sogs pa'i nyes dmigs rnams so //
translated: in terms of its general characteristic, the faults of birth, and so on;

original: phyin ci log gi mtshan nyid ni bdag dang bdag gi med pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi mtshan nyid ni bdag dang bdag gi med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: and in terms of its erroneous characteristic, the nonexistence of self and entities connected to the self.

original: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Here, the own characteristic is threefold:

original: rnam par smin pa'i mtshan nyid ni ming dang gzugs dang lhan cig 'byung ba kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i mtshan nyid ni ming dang gzugs dang lhan cig 'byung ba kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The characteristic of karmic maturation is the store consciousness that occurs simultaneously with name-and-form.

original: gang gi phyir gang 'di khams gsum du ming dang gzugs dang lhan cig 'byung ba mi 'bral ba yang sring pa'i myu gu mngon par grub par byed do zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang 'di khams gsum du ming dang gzugs dang lhan cig 'byung ba mi 'bral ba yang sring pa'i myu gu mngon par grub par byed do zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúThis is the seed of name-and-form in the three realms, which occurs simultaneously with name-and-form and is not separated from it, and it brings about the manifestation of the sprout of becoming.‚Äù

original: ming dang gzugs dang / de lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs dang / de lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because name-and-form is simultaneous with it.

original: da rgyu nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin pa ni ming dang gzugs dang de mi 'bral bar gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da rgyu nyid kyi mtshan nyid yin pa ni ming dang gzugs dang de mi 'bral bar gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: The characteristic of cause is that it is the cause of name-and-form, because it is not separate from name-and-form.

original: de la rag lus nas 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de la rag lus nas 'byung ba ste /
translated: It arises in dependence on that,

original: gang gi phyir mi 'bral ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi 'bral ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: because it is said to be not separate.

original: de'i 'bras bu'i @147b rim gyi mtshan nyid ni srid pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu'i @147b rim gyi mtshan nyid ni srid pa'i bar du ste /
translated: The characteristic of the order of the result is up to existence,

original: gang gi phyir ming dang gzugs de rnam par 'phel nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ming dang gzugs de rnam par 'phel nas /
translated: because name-and-form increases

original: skye mched drug gi grong 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye mched drug gi grong 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and the city of the six sense spheres arises.

original: skye mched rnams byung nas phan tshun reg ste /
analyzed: skye mched rnams byung nas phan tshun reg ste /
translated: When the sense spheres arise, they mutually contact

original: phrad pas tshor ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //

original: brtag pa la mkhas pa dang / 'thob pa la mkhas pa dang / 'phel ba la mkhas pa dang / yongs su mi nyams pa la mkhas pa dang / mthar thug par 'gro ba la mkhas pa'o //

translated: skill in investigation, skill in attainment, skill in increase, skill in non-degeneration, and skill in culmination.

original: de la dang po ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po dang / 'jigs pa dang / 'grub pa la mkhas pa ste /üîΩgang gi phyir des mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen po la mkhas pa sa'i 'jigs pa dang / @153a * //

translated: The first is skill in the unfavorable, the counteragent, fearlessness, and success.

original: 'grub pa la mkhas pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'grub pa la mkhas pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because of that, skill in the unfavorable and the counteragent is called fearlessness and success in the stages.

original: de la sa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa bcu'i gnyen por sa bcu ni sngar bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de la sa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa bcu'i gnyen por sa bcu ni sngar bstan pa yin te /
translated: Therein, the ten stages are taught as the counteragents to the ten kinds of unfavorable conditions.

original: de dag dang 'bral ba dang / yang dag par 'grub pa ni 'jigs pa dang 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: de dag dang 'bral ba dang / yang dag par 'grub pa ni 'jigs pa dang 'grub pa ste /

original: go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood respectively.

original: gnyis pa ni 'jug pa'i thabs dang / zhugs pa dang / de'i khyad par la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'jug pa'i thabs dang / zhugs pa dang / de'i khyad par la mkhas pa ste /
translated: The second is skill in the means of entry, in the one who has entered, and in the distinctions of the latter.

original: gang gi phyir sa'i rnam pa dang / rgyu mthun pa la mkhas pa dang / sa thob pa rnam par spyod pa la mkhas pa dang / sa'i yan lag yongs su sbyangs pa la mkhas par bya zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa'i rnam pa dang / rgyu mthun pa la mkhas pa dang / sa thob pa rnam par spyod pa la mkhas pa dang / sa'i yan lag yongs su sbyangs pa la mkhas par bya zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: because of the skill in the aspects of the stages, in the natural outcome, in the attainment of the stages, in the purification of the members of the stages, and in the transference from one stage to another.

original: gsum pa ni sa /
analyzed: gsum pa ni sa /
translated: The third is the stages.

original: gzhan du 'pho ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'phel ba la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan du 'pho ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'phel ba la mkhas pa ste /
translated: It is skill in abiding, in development, and in transference.

original: gang gi phyir sa nas sar 'phar ba la mkhas pa dang / sa dang sa la gnas pa la mkhas pa dang / sa dang sa'i khyad par shes pa la mkhas par bya zhes gsungs pa'o //

translated: because of the skill in the transference from stage to stage, in the abiding in the stages, and in the knowledge of the differences between the stages.

original: bzhi pa ni phyir mi ldog pa la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni phyir mi ldog pa la mkhas pa ste /
translated: The fourth is skill in the irreversible stage.

original: gang gi phyir sa thob nas phyir mi ldog pa la mkhas par bya zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩlnga pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i mthar phyin nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa thob nas phyir mi ldog pa la mkhas par bya zhes gsungs pa'o // lnga pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i mthar phyin nas /
translated: because of the skill in the attainment of the stages and the irreversibility from enlightenment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la 'jug pa la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la 'jug pa la mkhas pa ste /
translated: The fifth is skill in the entry into the stage of the TathƒÅgata after completing the Bodhisattva stages.

original: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sa thams cad yongs su sbyangs pas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sa thams cad yongs su sbyangs pas /
translated: Because he has completely purified all the bodhisattva stages,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la ye shes kyis sa gnon pa la mkhas par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la ye shes kyis sa gnon pa la mkhas par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: he should become skilled in the knowledge that conquers the stage of the Tathagata.

original: de la 'jug pa'i 'bras bu'i phan yon ni ded dpon chen por gyur pas sems can gyi 'dron pa phal po che thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi grong khyer chen por phyin par bya ba'i phyir yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i 'bras bu'i phan yon ni ded dpon chen por gyur pas sems can gyi 'dron pa phal po che thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi grong khyer chen por phyin par bya ba'i phyir yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
translated: The benefit of the result of engagement is that, having become a great caravan leader, he is correctly engaged in order to lead the great caravan of sentient beings to the great city of omniscience.

original: de la ded dpon mkhas pa ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la ded dpon mkhas pa ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: Therein, the skilled caravan leader should be understood in two ways:

original: mi nor bar mkhas pa dang / lam dang de'i gol ba dang / lam gyi bar gnas dang / de'i gol ba la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: mi nor bar mkhas pa dang / lam dang de'i gol ba dang / lam gyi bar gnas dang / de'i gol ba la mkhas pa ste /
translated: skilled in not erring, and skilled in the path, its deviations, the resting places on the path, and their deviations.

original: gang gi phyir lam gyi yon tan dang / lam gol ba'i nyes pa dang / lam gyi bar gnas kyi khyad par dang / lam gyi bar gnas kyi gol ba'i nyes pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir lam gyi yon tan dang / lam gol ba'i nyes pa dang / lam gyi bar gnas kyi khyad par dang / lam gyi bar gnas kyi gol ba'i nyes pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because it is said: the qualities of the path, the faults of the deviant path, the distinctions of the resting places on the path, and the faults of the deviations from the resting places on the path.

original: rton pa la mkhas pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: rton pa la mkhas pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: Skill in reliance is that by which one is not confused about the meaning of the scriptures.

original: lam rgyags dang / bya ba dang / bya ba ma yin pa rnams zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: lam rgyags dang / bya ba dang / bya ba ma yin pa rnams zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The scriptures are called provisions because they are the means of attaining nirvana.

original: de la rnam par smin pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi khyad par ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi khyad par ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therein, the special retention of evolutionary impetus and the special benefit of the result are twofold.

original: lus rgya che ba ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi dbang phyug nyid du 'gyur ba la @153b sogs pa ste gang gi phyir /
analyzed: lus rgya che ba ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi dbang phyug nyid du 'gyur ba la @153b sogs pa ste gang gi phyir /
translated: The extensive body is the sovereignty of Jambudvipa, etc.

original: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni phal cher 'dzam bu'i gling gi dbang por 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni phal cher 'dzam bu'i gling gi dbang por 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: For it is said, The Bodhisattva who is in that stage usually becomes the king of Jambudvipa.

original: rgyu mthun pa rgya che ba ni ser sna 'dul ba la mkhas pa la sogs pa ste /üîΩgang gi phyir sems can rnams kyi ser sna'i dri ma bzlog pa la mkhas pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa rgya che ba ni ser sna 'dul ba la mkhas pa la sogs pa ste / gang gi phyir sems can rnams kyi ser sna'i dri ma bzlog pa la mkhas pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: The extensive natural outcome is skill in subduing greed, etc.

original: ting nge 'dzin brgya rab tu thob ces bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin brgya rab tu thob ces bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa'o //
translated: For it is said, He is skilled in removing the stain of greed from sentient beings, and so on, up to he attains a hundred meditative concentrations.

original: de la gtong ba chen pos sems can rnams sdud pa'i gtso bor gyur zhes bya ba ni yang dag par 'ged pa dang / byed du 'jug pas bdag gis sbyin pa dang / sbyin du gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: de la gtong ba chen pos sems can rnams sdud pa'i gtso bor gyur zhes bya ba ni yang dag par 'ged pa dang / byed du 'jug pas bdag gis sbyin pa dang / sbyin du gzhug pa'o //
translated: In this regard, ‚Äúthe great giving is the chief means of gathering sentient beings‚Äù means that it is the chief means of gathering sentient beings through the giving of goods and the giving of the teaching.

original: sems can rnams kyi ser sna'i dri ma bzlog pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni thabs mkhas pas bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams kyis sems can gyi don byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi ser sna'i dri ma bzlog pa la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni thabs mkhas pas bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams kyis sems can gyi don byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSkill in removing the stain of stinginess from sentient beings‚Äù means that one benefits sentient beings through the means of attraction.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa yid la bya ba dag gis ni rang gi don dang mi 'bral te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa yid la bya ba dag gis ni rang gi don dang mi 'bral te /
translated: One does not separate from one‚Äôs own aim through the mental attentions to the Buddha, etc.

original: de'i yid la byed pa de dag ni las de la 'jug pa la dang ; rgya chen po byed pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa yongs su spong ba byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i yid la byed pa de dag ni las de la 'jug pa la dang ; rgya chen po byed pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa yongs su spong ba byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: For those mental attentions cause one to engage in that action, to act on a vast scale, and to abandon the afflictions.

original: de ni mdor bsdu na yid la bya ba rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni mdor bsdu na yid la bya ba rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, it should be understood as fourfold:

original: mchog yid la bya ba ni dkon mchog gsum yid la bya ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mchog yid la bya ba ni dkon mchog gsum yid la bya ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The highest mental attention is that which attends to the Three Jewels.

original: chos mthun pa yid la bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos mthun pa yid la bya ba ni /
translated: The consideration of the similarity of Dharma is

original: byang chub sems dpa' yid la bya ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yid la bya ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: that which is the consideration of the bodhisattva.

original: yon tan yid la bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i rim pa yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan yid la bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i rim pa yid la byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The consideration of virtue is that which considers the stages of the bodhisattva's practice together with its nature.

original: 'dod pa'i don yid la bya ba ni stobs la sogs pa yid la bya ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don yid la bya ba ni stobs la sogs pa yid la bya ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The consideration of the desired aim is that which considers the powers, etc.

original: sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i chos nyid yid la bya ba gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa yid la bya ba don dam pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i chos nyid yid la bya ba gang yin pa de ni sangs rgyas la sogs pa yid la bya ba don dam pa ste /
translated: The consideration of the reality of the Buddha, etc., is the ultimate consideration of the Buddha, etc.üîΩThere is no conceit, thinking, I give!

original: gang gi bdag gis sbyin no //üîΩde la sbyin no //
analyzed: gang gi bdag gis sbyin no // de la sbyin no //
translated: I give to him!üîΩI give this!

original: 'di la sbyin no //üîΩde'i phyir sbyin no snyam pa'i rlom sems med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la sbyin no // de'i phyir sbyin no snyam pa'i rlom sems med pa'o //
translated: I give for that reason!

original: de bzhin du las thams cad la byed pa po dang / gnas dang bya ba dang / bya ba'i 'bras bu la rlom sems med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du las thams cad la byed pa po dang / gnas dang bya ba dang / bya ba'i 'bras bu la rlom sems med pa'o //
translated: Similarly, there is no conceit about the agent, the object, the action, or the result of the action in all actions.

original: de thams cad kyang byang chub tu sngo bar byed do //
analyzed: de thams cad kyang byang chub tu sngo bar byed do //
translated: and he dedicates all of that to enlightenment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur zhes rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi mchog tu 'gyur zhes rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
translated: He becomes the best of all sentient beings.

original: de la mchog ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la mchog ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therein, the best is twofold:

original: yon tan sbyangs pas gtso bor 'gyur ba mchog dang / zla med pas phul du 'gyur ba mchog go //
analyzed: yon tan sbyangs pas gtso bor 'gyur ba mchog dang / zla med pas phul du 'gyur ba mchog go //
translated: the best as the chief, because of the excellence of his virtues, and the best as the foremost, because he is without a superior.

original: de la rnam pa gnyis @154a * //üîΩkyis gtso bor 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la rnam pa gnyis @154a * // kyis gtso bor 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
translated: Therein, he becomes the chief through two aspects:

original: ye shes phun sum tshogs pas dam par 'gyur ba dang / spobs pa phun sum tshogs pas rab mchog tu 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes phun sum tshogs pas dam par 'gyur ba dang / spobs pa phun sum tshogs pas rab mchog tu 'gyur ba'o //
translated: he becomes the highest, because of the excellence of his intuition, and he becomes the most excellent, because of the excellence of his eloquence.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyis phul du 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyis phul du 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
translated: He becomes the foremost through two aspects:

original: mtshungs pa med pas gong mar 'gyur ba dang / lhag ma med pas bla na med par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mtshungs pa med pas gong mar 'gyur ba dang / lhag ma med pas bla na med par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: he becomes the superior, because he is without an equal, and he becomes the unsurpassed, because he is without a superior.

original: de ltar rang bzhin gyi yon tan gyis sangs rgyas brjod nas las kyi yon tan gyis brjod de /
analyzed: de ltar rang bzhin gyi yon tan gyis sangs rgyas brjod nas las kyi yon tan gyis brjod de /
translated: Thus, after describing the Buddha through his natural virtues, he describes him through his virtues of action.

original: 'dren pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dren pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The one who is called the Leader, etc.

original: de la lung gi don du chos gzhag pa'i tshul ston pas 'dren pa'o //
analyzed: de la lung gi don du chos gzhag pa'i tshul ston pas 'dren pa'o //
translated: He is the Leader because he teaches the way of establishing the Dharma as the object of the scriptures.

original: thob pa'i don du nyon mongs pa 'dul ba dang / lam bzang po la 'jug pa'i gdams ngag sbyin pas rnam par 'dren pa dang / yongs su 'dren pa ste go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: thob pa'i don du nyon mongs pa 'dul ba dang / lam bzang po la 'jug pa'i gdams ngag sbyin pas rnam par 'dren pa dang / yongs su 'dren pa ste go rims bzhin no //
translated: He is the Guide and the Thorough Guide because he bestows the instructions for taming the passions and for entering the good path, respectively.

original: gang dag thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la rton pa'i bar du 'gyur snyam du sems so zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i lam ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang dag thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la rton pa'i bar du 'gyur snyam du sems so zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i lam ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the one who thinks, ‚ÄúMay all beings rely on the wisdom of omniscience,‚Äù because he teaches the path of the great bodhisattvas.

original: 'di ni re zhig byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa'i rnam par smin pa yongs su 'dzin pa 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa'i rnam par smin pa yongs su 'dzin pa 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi khyad par ro //
translated: This is the special result and benefit of the bodhisattva‚Äôs acceptance of the evolutionary development of beings, as a householder.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba ni bsam gtan gyi las gtso bo ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba ni bsam gtan gyi las gtso bo ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who has gone forth into the homeless life has meditation as his main activity.

original: rnam par smin pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang / 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi khyad par rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa yongs su 'dzin pa dang / 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi khyad par rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya'o //
translated: The action of concentration should be understood as twofold: the taking up of a special result and the special result itself.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The action of concentration is as follows:

original: ting nge 'dzin ni skad cig gcig la ting nge 'dzin brgya la dbang thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni skad cig gcig la ting nge 'dzin brgya la dbang thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In one moment, one hundred concentrations are attained.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi las ni sangs rgyas brgya mthong ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi las ni sangs rgyas brgya mthong ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The action of concentration is seeing one hundred Buddhas, and so on.

original: de sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams las ye shes tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: de sangs rgyas rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams las ye shes tshol bar byed do //
translated: From those Buddhas and from the bodhisattvas blessed by the Buddhas, he seeks knowledge.

original: g-yo bar byed pa nyid kyis ni gdul bya rnams 'dun par byed do //
analyzed: g-yo bar byed pa nyid kyis ni gdul bya rnams 'dun par byed do //
translated: By shaking, he inspires the faith of those to be trained.

original: 'gro ba dang snang bar byed pa gnyis kyis song ste mthong nas yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang snang bar byed pa gnyis kyis song ste mthong nas yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: By going and by shining, he goes and sees those to be trained, and then matures them.

original: skye ba'i khyad par yongs su 'dzin pas ni bskal pa brgyar gnas par byed do //
analyzed: skye ba'i khyad par yongs su 'dzin pas ni bskal pa brgyar gnas par byed do //
translated: By taking up a special rebirth, he remains for one hundred eons.

original: sems can rnams kyi sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' la sdig pa dang bral ba'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' la sdig pa dang bral ba'i dbang du byas te /
translated: In terms of the freedom from sin of sentient beings in the past and future,üîΩ

original: las kyi rgyud ston to //
analyzed: las kyi rgyud ston to //
translated: The continuity of action is taught in terms of the freedom from sin of sentient beings in the past and future.

original: rang gi blo yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir chos kyi rnam grangs dag gi don sems so //
analyzed: rang gi blo yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir chos kyi rnam grangs dag gi don sems so //
translated: The meaning of the Dharma is reflected upon in order to mature one's own mind.

original: lus brgya kun du ston pa dang // lus re re yang 'khor byang chub sems dpa' brgya brgya dang ldan par ston pas ni de'i don mang du byed par sbyor ba dang / don myur bar byed par sbyor bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lus brgya kun du ston pa dang // lus re re yang 'khor byang chub sems dpa' brgya brgya dang ldan par ston pas ni de'i don mang du byed par sbyor ba dang / don myur bar byed par sbyor bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The application to the performance of many benefits and the application to the performance of quick benefits should be understood as the display of many bodies and the display of each body as endowed with a retinue of a hundred bodhisattvas.

original: @154b de yan chad ni smon lam shes pa'i 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi khyad par du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: @154b de yan chad ni smon lam shes pa'i 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi khyad par du rig par bya'o //
translated: From here on the distinctive results and benefits of the knowledge of prayers should be understood.

original: de la lus ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad kyi gnas te /
analyzed: de la lus ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad kyi gnas te /
translated: In this regard, the body is the basis of all the bodhisattva practices.

original: de las 'od dang rdzu 'phrul lo //
analyzed: de las 'od dang rdzu 'phrul lo //
translated: From it, light and miracles arise.

original: 'di la brten nas lha'i mig dang de'i yul te /
analyzed: 'di la brten nas lha'i mig dang de'i yul te /
translated: On the basis of this, the divine eye and its object

original: spyan lnga po thams cad yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: spyan lnga po thams cad yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: should be understood as all five eyes.

original: rdzu 'phrul la brten nas dbyangs dang / spyod pa dang / bkod pa dang / byin gyi rlabs so //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul la brten nas dbyangs dang / spyod pa dang / bkod pa dang / byin gyi rlabs so //
translated: The power of magical emanation is based on the superknowledges. It has four varieties: magical emanation of form, magical emanation of speech, magical emanation of thought, and magical emanation of transformation.üîΩThe magical emanation of form is the magical creation of forms.

original: de la dbyangs ni sprul pa'i ngag go //üîΩspyod pa ni 'gro ba'o //üîΩbkod pa ni sprul pa'o //
analyzed: de la dbyangs ni sprul pa'i ngag go // spyod pa ni 'gro ba'o // bkod pa ni sprul pa'o //
translated: The magical emanation of speech is the magical creation of sounds.üîΩThe magical emanation of thought is the magical creation of various kinds of mental states.

original: byin gyi rlabs ni gang gis gzhan byin gyis rlob pa'o //
analyzed: byin gyi rlabs ni gang gis gzhan byin gyis rlob pa'o //
translated: The magical emanation of transformation is the transformation of one thing into another.

original: de'i 'og tu ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo la brten nas mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthu'i bya ba'i don sgrub bo //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo la brten nas mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthu'i bya ba'i don sgrub bo //
translated: After that, based on the door of concentration, one accomplishes the aims of the activities of power according to one‚Äôs aspiration.

original: shes rab kyi spyan gyis bsdus pa'i gzungs kyi sgo la brten nas chos ston par 'du byed do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi spyan gyis bsdus pa'i gzungs kyi sgo la brten nas chos ston par 'du byed do //
translated: Based on the door of retention, which is included in the eye of wisdom, one creates the teaching of the Dharma.

original: mdor bsdu nas thams cad ni rgyu'i lus dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdu nas thams cad ni rgyu'i lus dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: In brief, all of this should be understood as having the nature of a cause and result.

original: 'phags pa sa bcu pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu pa las /
translated: The Ten Stages says,

original: sa dang po'i rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /üîΩ// / bam po lnga pa /
analyzed: sa dang po'i rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /üîΩ// / bam po lnga pa /
translated: The explanation of the first stage is finished.

original: mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam la gnas te tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas nas sa gnyis pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam la gnas te tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas nas sa gnyis pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is endowed with realization, abiding in the supramundane path, should be known as having established the second stage from the point of view of the purity of morality.

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa de yang rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ba ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa de yang rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ba ste /
translated: That purity of morality should be known as twofold:

original: 'byung bar byed pa rnam par dag pa dang / rang bzhin rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar byed pa rnam par dag pa dang / rang bzhin rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: purity of origination and purity of nature.

original: de la 'byung bar byed pa rnam par dag pa ni sems kyi bsam pa bcus yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: de la 'byung bar byed pa rnam par dag pa ni sems kyi bsam pa bcus yongs su bstan te /
translated: Purity of origination is taught by ten mental contemplations.

original: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po legs par yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa gnyis pa la mngon par 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po legs par yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa gnyis pa la mngon par 'dod pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúO sons of the conqueror, the bodhisattva who has well purified the first stage, the bodhisattva who aspires to the second stage,

original: de'i sems kyi bsam pa bcu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i sems kyi bsam pa bcu 'byung ngo //
translated: has ten mental contemplations.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: drang po'i bsam pa dang / 'jam pa'i bsam pa dang / las su rung ba'i bsam pa dang / dul ba'i bsam pa dang / zhi ba'i bsam pa dang / dge ba'i bsam pa dang / ma 'dres pa'i bsam pa dang / mi lta ba'i bsam pa dang /
analyzed: drang po'i bsam pa dang / 'jam pa'i bsam pa dang / las su rung ba'i bsam pa dang / dul ba'i bsam pa dang / zhi ba'i bsam pa dang / dge ba'i bsam pa dang / ma 'dres pa'i bsam pa dang / mi lta ba'i bsam pa dang /
translated: the intention of uprightness, the intention of gentleness, the intention of serviceability, the intention of self-control, the intention of peace, the intention of virtue, the intention of non-mixture, the intention of non-regard,

original: rlabs po che'i bsam pa dang / che ba nyid kyi bsam pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rlabs po che'i bsam pa dang / che ba nyid kyi bsam pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: the intention of greatness, and the intention of magnanimity.

original: rang bzhin rnam par dag pa ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa gsum ste /üîΩldog pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul @155a * //
analyzed: rang bzhin rnam par dag pa ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa gsum ste / ldog pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul @155a * //
translated: Purity of nature is threefold: purity of morality,

original: khrims dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: khrims dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims so //
translated: purity of the virtues of goodness, and purity of the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de la ldog pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par lta ba'i mthar thug pa rnams kyis yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: de la ldog pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par lta ba'i mthar thug pa rnams kyis yongs su bstan te /
translated: Purity of morality is shown by the tenfold path of good conduct, which culminates in right view.üîΩFor it is said: ‚ÄúHe is one who has renounced killing, and so on up to...

original: gang gi phyir srog gcod pa spangs pa yang yin te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir srog gcod pa spangs pa yang yin te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Because he has abandoned taking life up to...üîΩ

original: gang gi phyir log par lta ba spangs pa yang yin te zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir log par lta ba spangs pa yang yin te zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because he has also abandoned wrong views, up to:

original: ldog pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa de ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag par yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ldog pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa de ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag par yang rig par bya'o //
translated: This purity of the morality of restraint should be understood as the purity of the morality of restraint.

original: dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa ni de'i 'og nas /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa ni de'i 'og nas /
translated: The purity of the morality of gathering virtuous factors is taught below,

original: de lta bas na bdag gis mngon par sgrub tu 'dra ba la rnam pa thams cad yongs su sbyang zhing mngon par bsgrub pa nyid la brtson par bya'o snyam nas zhes bya ba'i bar 'dis yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag gis mngon par sgrub tu 'dra ba la rnam pa thams cad yongs su sbyang zhing mngon par bsgrub pa nyid la brtson par bya'o snyam nas zhes bya ba'i bar 'dis yongs su bstan to //
translated: from: Therefore, I will strive to accomplish all aspects of the training in what is similar to the practice.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa ni de'i 'og nas /
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa ni de'i 'og nas /
translated: The purity of the morality of working for the benefit of sentient beings is taught below,

original: de sems can rnams la de bas shas cher phan pa'i sems bskyed ces bya ba'i bcu pa'i bar gyis yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: de sems can rnams la de bas shas cher phan pa'i sems bskyed ces bya ba'i bcu pa'i bar gyis yongs su bstan to //
translated: from: Therefore, he generates a thought of even greater benefit for sentient beings, up to:

original: de la bsam pa bcu po dag las drang ba'i bsam pa ni so sor brtags pa'i bya ba med pas tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bsam pa bcu po dag las drang ba'i bsam pa ni so sor brtags pa'i bya ba med pas tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas par rig par bya ste /
translated: Among these ten kinds of attitudes, the attitude of uprightness should be understood as being based on the purity of morality, because it is free from the activity of hypocrisy.

original: ji ltar 'gro bar bya ba de bzhin du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'gro bar bya ba de bzhin du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is upright because it acts in the same way as it appears to act.

original: de yang rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, it should be understood as having nine aspects:

original: 'jam pa drang ba'i bsam pa ni bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang ldan pas tshul khrims la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //üîΩlas su rung ba drang ba'i bsam pa ni rang dbang du rang gi ngang gis 'jug pas tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyon mongs pa dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jam pa drang ba'i bsam pa ni bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang ldan pas tshul khrims la 'jug pa'i phyir ro // las su rung ba drang ba'i bsam pa ni rang dbang du rang gi ngang gis 'jug pas tshul khrims kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyon mongs pa dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The attitude of uprightness as gentleness is the entrance into morality through the possession of happiness and mental pleasure.üîΩThe attitude of uprightness as serviceability is the entrance into morality through the absence of the passions that are the enemies of morality, because one enters into morality with a natural ease.

original: dul ba drang ba'i bsam pa ni brjed kyang nyes par 'khrul pa med pa ste /
analyzed: dul ba drang ba'i bsam pa ni brjed kyang nyes par 'khrul pa med pa ste /
translated: The attitude of uprightness as self-control is the entrance into morality through the absence of error in regard to transgressions, even when one is distracted.

original: rta shin tu dul ba mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rta shin tu dul ba mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like a well-trained horse that does not need to be constantly corrected.

original: zhi ba drang ba'i bsam pa ni nga rgyal med pas des khengs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba drang ba'i bsam pa ni nga rgyal med pas des khengs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The intention of uprightness of peace is not to be puffed up by the absence of pride.

original: dge ba drang ba'i bsam pa ni 'khrug pa la ji mi snyam pas gser bzang po bzhin no //
analyzed: dge ba drang ba'i bsam pa ni 'khrug pa la ji mi snyam pas gser bzang po bzhin no //
translated: The intention of uprightness of virtue is to be like good gold, not to be upset by agitation.

original: ma 'dres pa las drang ba'i bsam pa ni de tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa las drang ba'i bsam pa ni de tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The intention of uprightness of non-mixture is not to be satisfied with just that much,

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la gnas nas sems rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir rab tu dben pa 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la gnas nas sems rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir rab tu dben pa 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one who abides in pure morality desires solitude in order to purify the mind.

original: mi lta ba drang ba'i bsam pa ni srid pa dang longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa la mi smon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi lta ba drang ba'i bsam pa ni srid pa dang longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa la mi smon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The intention of uprightness of non-regard is not to wish for abundant existence and enjoyments.

original: rlabs po che'i drang ba'i bsam pa ni sems @155b can gyi don du srid pa rgyun mi 'chad par smon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlabs po che'i drang ba'i bsam pa ni sems @155b can gyi don du srid pa rgyun mi 'chad par smon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The intention of uprightness of greatness is to wish for the continuity of existence for the sake of sentient beings.

original: che ba nyid drang ba'i bsam pa ni de'i 'bras bu 'byung ba kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: che ba nyid drang ba'i bsam pa ni de'i 'bras bu 'byung ba kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The intention of uprightness of superiority is to be free from afflictions in the arising of its fruits.

original: de la las kyi lam bshad pa ni srog gcod pa spangs pa yang yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la las kyi lam bshad pa ni srog gcod pa spangs pa yang yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the path of action is: ‚ÄúHe is one who has given up killing living beings.‚Äù

original: yang smos pa ni spong ba khyad par can yang 'thob par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang smos pa ni spong ba khyad par can yang 'thob par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that he obtains a special abandonment.

original: de la srog gcod pa spong ba'i dbang du byas nas spong ba rnam pa gsum yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: de la srog gcod pa spong ba'i dbang du byas nas spong ba rnam pa gsum yongs su bstan te /
translated: With regard to that, in terms of giving up killing living beings, three kinds of abandonment are taught.

original: rgyu spong ba ni gang gi phyir /üîΩdbyig pa spang /
analyzed: rgyu spong ba ni gang gi phyir / dbyig pa spang /
translated: Abandonment of the cause is indicated by the passage:

original: mtshon cha spang /
analyzed: mtshon cha spang /
translated: ‚ÄúHe has given up sticks and weapons,

original: khon du 'dzin pa spangs nas 'dzem pa dang ldan zhing snying rje la zhugs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: khon du 'dzin pa spangs nas 'dzem pa dang ldan zhing snying rje la zhugs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and has given up enmity, and is endowed with shame and embarassment, and is full of compassion.‚Äù

original: gnyen pos spong ba ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gnyen pos spong ba ni gang gi phyir /
translated: Abandonment by means of the antidote is indicated by the passage:

original: srog chags 'byung po thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba dang / snying brtse ba dang / byams pa'i sems dang ldan te zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: srog chags 'byung po thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba dang / snying brtse ba dang / byams pa'i sems dang ldan te zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHe is endowed with a mind of benefit, happiness, love, and compassion for all living beings.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu spong ba ni gang gi phyir dang / de kun du rtog pa tsam gyis kyang srog chags rnams la rnam par 'tshe bar mi byed na /
analyzed: 'bras bu spong ba ni gang gi phyir dang / de kun du rtog pa tsam gyis kyang srog chags rnams la rnam par 'tshe bar mi byed na /
translated: The result of abandoning is that, because of that, one does not even harm living beings by mere imagination.

original: sems can gzhan la sems can du 'du shes shing ched du bsams te /
analyzed: sems can gzhan la sems can du 'du shes shing ched du bsams te /
translated: How much less would one, perceiving a sentient being as a sentient being, intentionally

original: lus kyis rnam par tho 'tshams pa chen po bya ba lta ci smos zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyis rnam par tho 'tshams pa chen po bya ba lta ci smos zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and with a body commit a great harm?

original: de la srog gcod pa'i rgyu ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la srog gcod pa'i rgyu ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therein, the cause of killing is twofold:

original: nye bar len pa'i rgyu dang / 'byung bar byed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i rgyu dang / 'byung bar byed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: the cause of appropriation and the cause of occurrence.

original: de la nye bar len pa'i rgyu ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la nye bar len pa'i rgyu ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therein, the cause of appropriation is twofold:

original: gnod par byed pa'i dngos po dbyig pa dang / gcod pa'i dngos po mtshon cha'o //üîΩde gnyis spong ba ni dbyig pa spangs /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i dngos po dbyig pa dang / gcod pa'i dngos po mtshon cha'o // de gnyis spong ba ni dbyig pa spangs /
translated: the means of harming, such as a club, and the means of cutting, such as a weapon.

original: mtshon cha spangs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshon cha spangs zhes bya'o //
translated: The abandonment of those two is called the abandonment of the club and the abandonment of the weapon.

original: sngags dang / sman dang / khams mi mnyam par byed pa'i gnod pa'i bar dag kyang gnod par byed pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags dang / sman dang / khams mi mnyam par byed pa'i gnod pa'i bar dag kyang gnod par byed pa nyid du shes par bya'o //
translated: The harm of spells, medicine, and the imbalance of the elements should be understood as the means of harming.

original: 'byung bar byed pa'i rgyu yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'byung bar byed pa'i rgyu yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The cause of their occurrence is also twofold:

original: zhe sdang dang 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang 'dod pa'o //
translated: hatred and desire.

original: 'dod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Desire is also twofold:

original: longs spyod 'dod pa ni des na longs spyod kyi phyir phyi ma la bdag yongs su 'dor bas mi 'dzem pa ste /
analyzed: longs spyod 'dod pa ni des na longs spyod kyi phyir phyi ma la bdag yongs su 'dor bas mi 'dzem pa ste /
translated: the desire for wealth, because of which one does not avoid harming another for the sake of wealth in the future;

original: de'i gnyen por gang gi phyir 'dzem pa dang ldan zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩsrog chags kyi yan lag dang de gsad par mngon par dga' ba'i 'dod pa de'i gnyen por gang gi phyir /
analyzed: de'i gnyen por gang gi phyir 'dzem pa dang ldan zhes gsungs pa'o // srog chags kyi yan lag dang de gsad par mngon par dga' ba'i 'dod pa de'i gnyen por gang gi phyir /
translated: the antidote to that is stated in the verse: ‚Äúbecause of his conscientiousness.

original: snying rje la zhugs pas zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: snying rje la zhugs pas zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: The desire for the limbs of living beings and for their destruction; the antidote to that is stated in the verse: ‚Äúbecause he is engaged in compassion.

original: de las ldog pa ni rgyu spong ba'o //
analyzed: de las ldog pa ni rgyu spong ba'o //
translated: The opposite of that is the abandonment of the cause.

original: de la gnyen po ni rnam pa gnyis te /üîΩbde 'gro dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu dge ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pas sems can thams cad la phan @156a * //
analyzed: de la gnyen po ni rnam pa gnyis te / bde 'gro dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyu dge ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pas sems can thams cad la phan @156a * //
translated: The antidote to that is twofold:

original: pa dang / snying brtse ba dang / de dag 'bras bu de thob par smon pas byams pa'i sems te /
analyzed: pa dang / snying brtse ba dang / de dag 'bras bu de thob par smon pas byams pa'i sems te /
translated: the mind of loving kindness, because it causes the acquisition of virtue, which is the cause of happy rebirth and of nirvana, because it benefits all beings, because it is compassion, and because it is the aspiration for the attainment of that result by those beings;

original: gang gi phyir srog chags 'byung po thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba dang / snying brtse ba dang / byams pa'i sems dang ldan te zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir srog chags 'byung po thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba dang / snying brtse ba dang / byams pa'i sems dang ldan te zhes gsungs pa'o //

original: len pa dang / brjod pa ni las so //üîΩdbye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bsam pa ste gang gi phyir des de dag dbye ba'i phyir tshu bi las thos nas pha bir snyod pa ma yin /
analyzed: len pa dang / brjod pa ni las so // dbye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bsam pa ste gang gi phyir des de dag dbye ba'i phyir tshu bi las thos nas pha bir snyod pa ma yin /
translated: The action is taking up and speaking.

original: de dag dbye ba'i phyir pha bi las thos nas tshu bi la snyod pa ma yin te zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag dbye ba'i phyir pha bi las thos nas tshu bi la snyod pa ma yin te zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The attitude is for the sake of division, because one does not speak to the father after hearing from the son, nor does one speak to the son after hearing from the father, for the sake of dividing them.

original: rab tu dbye ba ni 'byed pa dang / bsam pa dang las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba ni 'byed pa dang / bsam pa dang las su rig par bya'o //
translated: The classification should be understood as division, attitude, and action.

original: 'byed pa ni rnam pa gnyis te ;
analyzed: 'byed pa ni rnam pa gnyis te ;
translated: Division is twofold:

original: sngon ma bye ba dang / sngon bye ba la'o //
analyzed: sngon ma bye ba dang / sngon bye ba la'o //
translated: that which has not been divided before and that which has been divided before.

original: de'i gnyen por 'dus pa rnams mi 'byed cing bye ba rnams la yang mi snon te zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por 'dus pa rnams mi 'byed cing bye ba rnams la yang mi snon te zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The antidote to that is stated: ‚ÄúOne does not divide those who are united, and one does not add to those who are divided.‚Äù

original: bsam pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bsam pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The attitude is also of two types:

original: 'dum pa la mi dga' ba dang / mi 'dum pa la mngon par dga' ba ste /
analyzed: 'dum pa la mi dga' ba dang / mi 'dum pa la mngon par dga' ba ste /
translated: not delighting in reconciliation and delighting in disharmony.

original: de'i gnyen por mi 'dum pa la mi dga' zhing 'dum pa la mos pa yin pas zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por mi 'dum pa la mi dga' zhing 'dum pa la mos pa yin pas zhes gsungs so //
translated: The antidote to that is stated: ‚ÄúOne does not delight in disharmony and one is devoted to reconciliation.‚Äù

original: las kyang bden pa dang / brdzun pa'i don tha dad pa'i tshig gis rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: las kyang bden pa dang / brdzun pa'i don tha dad pa'i tshig gis rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The action is also of two types:

original: chung ba dang che ba'o //
analyzed: chung ba dang che ba'o //
translated: the small and the great.

original: de'i gnyen por bden nam brdzun yang rung mi 'dum par bya ba'i tshig mi smra'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por bden nam brdzun yang rung mi 'dum par bya ba'i tshig mi smra'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The antidote to that is stated: ‚ÄúOne does not speak words that cause disharmony, whether true or false.‚Äù

original: tshig rtsub po spang ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: tshig rtsub po spang ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: In terms of abandoning harsh speech,

original: spong ba rnam pa gnyis yongs su bstan te /üîΩ'bras bu spong ba dang / gnyen po spong ba'o //
analyzed: spong ba rnam pa gnyis yongs su bstan te / 'bras bu spong ba dang / gnyen po spong ba'o //
translated: two types of abandonment are taught:üîΩabandonment of the effect and abandonment of the antidote.

original: de la 'bras bu ni kun du spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'bras bu ni kun du spyod pa ste /
translated: The effect is the practice.

original: zher 'debs pa dang / brlang ba dang / gzhan la gnod pa dang / gzhan gyi mtshang 'dru ba ste /üîΩgzhan gyi mtshang 'dru ba ni gang gis pha rol 'khrug par @158a * //üîΩbyed pa'o // 'di dag ni brjod pa'i mtshams sbyar ba yin par rig pa ste /
analyzed: zher 'debs pa dang / brlang ba dang / gzhan la gnod pa dang / gzhan gyi mtshang 'dru ba ste / gzhan gyi mtshang 'dru ba ni gang gis pha rol 'khrug par @158a * // byed pa'o // 'di dag ni brjod pa'i mtshams sbyar ba yin par rig pa ste /
translated: 1. to be offensive, 2. to be harsh, 3. to be harmful, 4. to be a gossip.üîΩTo be a gossip is to be one who causes others to be disturbed.üîΩThese are the four kinds of verbal non-virtuous actions.üîΩüîΩ

original: snga phyi rnam grangs su gtogs pa'i tshig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩde yang tshogs par mi 'byung ba mngon sum dang / lkog na rgyun du sbyor ba ni gang gi phyir /üîΩgrong mi'i tshig dang / ma rabs kyi tshig ngor brjod pa dang / tshig mi brjod pa zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩde la mngon sum dang / rgyun du 'byung ba ni che ba'o //üîΩlkog na brjod pa rgyun du mi 'byung ba ni chung ba'o //üîΩde brjod na tshul khrims dang 'gal ba dang / gzhan dag la sdug bsngal bskyod par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: snga phyi rnam grangs su gtogs pa'i tshig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩde yang tshogs par mi 'byung ba mngon sum dang / lkog na rgyun du sbyor ba ni gang gi phyir /üîΩgrong mi'i tshig dang / ma rabs kyi tshig ngor brjod pa dang / tshig mi brjod pa zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩde la mngon sum dang / rgyun du 'byung ba ni che ba'o //üîΩlkog na brjod pa rgyun du mi 'byung ba ni chung ba'o //üîΩde brjod na tshul khrims dang 'gal ba dang / gzhan dag la sdug bsngal bskyod par 'gyur zhing /

original: des gzhan 'khrug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des gzhan 'khrug par 'gyur te /
translated: It causes others to be disturbed.

original: gang gi tshe brdzun dang rnar mi snyan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe brdzun dang rnar mi snyan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is said to be false and unpleasant.
