original: gnod par byed pa'i rgyu dang / phrag dog las byung ba'i phyir tshul khrims dang 'gal te /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i rgyu dang / phrag dog las byung ba'i phyir tshul khrims dang 'gal te /
translated: It is contrary to morality because it is the cause of harm and it arises from jealousy.

original: gang gi phyir khro zhing rngam pa las byung ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir khro zhing rngam pa las byung ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is said to arise from anger and rage.

original: gzhan gyi mtshang 'dru bar byed pa na gnod pa rnam pa gnyis byed de /üîΩde dag dang kho na ma byung ba 'byin pas thos pa dang / dran pa'i dus na mi snyan pa dang / yid la mi 'thad pa gnyis kyi snying dang / sems mi dga' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi mtshang 'dru bar byed pa na gnod pa rnam pa gnyis byed de / de dag dang kho na ma byung ba 'byin pas thos pa dang / dran pa'i dus na mi snyan pa dang / yid la mi 'thad pa gnyis kyi snying dang / sems mi dga' bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When one exposes the faults of others, one causes two kinds of harm:üîΩone causes mental pain and unhappiness to the one who is being criticized, and one causes the one who is criticizing to be disliked and distrusted by others.

original: dga' ba bskyed pa med par byed pa ni bdag mi phyogs pa dang / gzhan dag kyang mi phyogs par byed pa de /
analyzed: dga' ba bskyed pa med par byed pa ni bdag mi phyogs pa dang / gzhan dag kyang mi phyogs par byed pa de /
translated: One causes the loss of joy when one causes oneself and others to be disliked and distrusted.

original: gang gi phyir mi snyan pa dang / yid la mi 'thad pas snying na bar byed pa dang / yid gdung bar byed pa dang / rang gi sems kyi rgyud dang / gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud ma rung bar byed pa'i tshig ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi snyan pa dang / yid la mi 'thad pas snying na bar byed pa dang / yid gdung bar byed pa dang / rang gi sems kyi rgyud dang / gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud ma rung bar byed pa'i tshig ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because it is unpleasant, disagreeable, and painful to the heart, it torments the mind, and it makes one's own mind-stream and the mind-streams of others unworkable.

original: de las ldog pa ni 'bras bu spong ba'o //
analyzed: de las ldog pa ni 'bras bu spong ba'o //
translated: The opposite of that is the result of abandoning.

original: gnyen pos spong ba ni 'jam por smra ba nyid do //
analyzed: gnyen pos spong ba ni 'jam por smra ba nyid do //
translated: The antidote to abandoning is speaking gently.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That is also of two kinds:

original: gya tshom ma yin pa dang / mngon par 'dod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: gya tshom ma yin pa dang / mngon par 'dod par bya ba ste /
translated: not being fickle and being agreeable.

original: gang gi phyir mnyen pa dang yid la 'thad pa dang zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mnyen pa dang yid la 'thad pa dang zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because it is gentle and agreeable.

original: de la gya tshom ma yin pa ni tshul khrims kyi yan lag tu gtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la gya tshom ma yin pa ni tshul khrims kyi yan lag tu gtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Among them, not being fickle is included in the branch of morality,

original: brdzun ma yin pas sngom pa'i rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brdzun ma yin pas sngom pa'i rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not false, the continuity of restraint is unbroken.

original: mngon par 'dod par bya ba de ni mngon par mtho ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer dang mthun pas bde ba yid du 'ong ba dang / phan pa yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du 'ong ba gnyis kyi phyir te /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod par bya ba de ni mngon par mtho ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer dang mthun pas bde ba yid du 'ong ba dang / phan pa yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du 'ong ba gnyis kyi phyir te /
translated: It is pleasant and agreeable because it is both agreeable to the mind and beneficial, and it is agreeable to the mind because it is the means to attain the city of nirvana.

original: gang gi phyir brdzun ma yin pa dang / rnar snyan pa dang / snying la 'bab pa dang / grong khyer pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir brdzun ma yin pa dang / rnar snyan pa dang / snying la 'bab pa dang / grong khyer pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is not false, it is pleasing to the ear, it is agreeable to the heart, and it is the means to attain the city.

original: de yang mdza' ba @158b dang ; mi mdza' ba dang / skye bo tha mal pas thos pa dang / dran pa'i dus na 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: de yang mdza' ba @158b dang ; mi mdza' ba dang / skye bo tha mal pas thos pa dang / dran pa'i dus na 'dod pa ste /
translated: It is desired when it is heard and remembered by friends, foes, and neutral persons.

original: gang gi phyir skye bo mang po dga' ba dang / skye bo mang po yid la 'bab pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skye bo mang po dga' ba dang / skye bo mang po yid la 'bab pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is pleasing to many people and agreeable to many people.

original: de ltar gyur pa de don rnam pa gnyis byed de /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa de don rnam pa gnyis byed de /
translated: Such speech performs two functions.

original: ting nge 'dzin 'grub pas mchog tu dga' ba'i bde ba skyed pa'i phyir gzhan dag la kho na ma byung ba mi 'byin pa dang / bdag kyang mngon du phyogs la gzhan yang mngon du phyogs par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin 'grub pas mchog tu dga' ba'i bde ba skyed pa'i phyir gzhan dag la kho na ma byung ba mi 'byin pa dang / bdag kyang mngon du phyogs la gzhan yang mngon du phyogs par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Since one generates the supreme bliss of meditative concentration, one does not take away the hope of others.

original: dga' ba ma skyes pa bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: dga' ba ma skyes pa bskyed pa ste /
translated: Since one causes oneself to be inclined toward and causes others to be inclined toward the Dharma, one generates joy in those who are not joyful.

original: gang gi phyir yid dga' bar byed pa dang / yid tshim par byed pas rang gi sems kyi rgyud dang / gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud dang bar byed pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yid dga' bar byed pa dang / yid tshim par byed pas rang gi sems kyi rgyud dang / gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud dang bar byed pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Since one gladdens the mind and satisfies the mind, one causes one's own mental continuum and the mental continuum of others to be at ease.

original: tshig 'khyal pa spong ba'i dbang du byas nas gnyen pos spong ba dang / 'bras bu spong ba yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: tshig 'khyal pa spong ba'i dbang du byas nas gnyen pos spong ba dang / 'bras bu spong ba yongs su bstan to //
translated: In terms of abandoning idle chatter, the abandonment by means of the antidote and the abandonment by means of the result are taught.

original: gnyen po ni phan tshun smra bar bya ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: gnyen po ni phan tshun smra bar bya ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: The antidote is in terms of mutual conversation.

original: gleng bar sbyor ba'i tshe lan 'debs par glon pa'i tshig dang / gang gi tshe mi dge ba'i gnas las bslang ste /
analyzed: gleng bar sbyor ba'i tshe lan 'debs par glon pa'i tshig dang / gang gi tshe mi dge ba'i gnas las bslang ste /
translated: When one is engaged in conversation, one should speak words that are responsive, and when one is engaged in debate, one should speak words that are decisive.

original: dge ba'i gnas la 'jog nus par mthong ba de'i tshe smra ba ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i gnas la 'jog nus par mthong ba de'i tshe smra ba ste /
translated: When one sees that one is able to establish them in virtue, then one speaks.

original: gang gi phyir lan legs par glon pa'i tshig dang / dus su smra ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir lan legs par glon pa'i tshig dang / dus su smra ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because of that, it is said that one speaks the words of a good reply and speaks at the right time.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i tshig ni gang gi phyir yang dag par smra ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i tshig ni gang gi phyir yang dag par smra ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Correct speech is because of that, it is said that one speaks correctly.

original: phan tshun gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas gdams ngag la sbyor ba'i tshe /
analyzed: phan tshun gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas gdams ngag la sbyor ba'i tshe /
translated: With regard to mutual instruction and teaching, when one applies instruction,

original: don gyi tshig dang / chos kyi tshig ni gang gi phyir don smra ba dang chos smra ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: don gyi tshig dang / chos kyi tshig ni gang gi phyir don smra ba dang chos smra ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: the words of meaning and the words of Dharma are because of that, it is said that one speaks with meaning and speaks the Dharma.

original: phan tshun ltung ba las 'byin pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: phan tshun ltung ba las 'byin pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to mutual emergence from downfalls,üîΩwhen one applies the pacification of disputes,

original: rtsod pa zhi bar byed par sbyor ba'i tshe rigs par smra ba dang / lung smra ba ni gang gi phyir 'dul bar smra ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa zhi bar byed par sbyor ba'i tshe rigs par smra ba dang / lung smra ba ni gang gi phyir 'dul bar smra ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: the words of logic and the words of scripture are because of that, it is said that one speaks the Vinaya.

original: sdud par 'gyur ba'i tshig gis chos ston pas sdud par sbyor ba dang / mnyan par 'os pa'i spyod lam gyis gnas pa rnams la smra ba dang / gleng bslang ba dang bcas par smra ba ni gang gi phyir bzod pa dang ldan pa dang /üîΩdus dang rmang dang bcas pa'i tshig smra ba yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sdud par 'gyur ba'i tshig gis chos ston pas sdud par sbyor ba dang / mnyan par 'os pa'i spyod lam gyis gnas pa rnams la smra ba dang / gleng bslang ba dang bcas par smra ba ni gang gi phyir bzod pa dang ldan pa dang / dus dang rmang dang bcas pa'i tshig smra ba yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: He is engaged in gathering, because he teaches the Dharma with words that gather. He speaks to those who abide with a conduct worthy of being heard. He speaks with introduction, because he speaks with patience.üîΩHe speaks with words that are timely and appropriate.üîΩüîΩ

original: 'bras bu ni kun du spyod pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni kun du spyod pa ste /
translated: The result is the practice of patience,

original: chung ba dang che ba'o //
analyzed: chung ba dang che ba'o //
translated: which is lesser and greater.

original: de las ldog pa ni 'bras bu spong ba ste /
analyzed: de las ldog pa ni 'bras bu spong ba ste /
translated: The opposite of that is the result of abandoning patience,üîΩwhich is lesser and greater.üîΩThe lesser is stated in the sutra:

original: chung ba dang che ba nyid ni gang gi phyir de tha na bzhad gang du bya ba'i tshig yongs su spang bar bya ba yang yongs su spong na tshig gis rnam par g-yengs pa lta ci smos zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩbrnab sems med pa ni dngos po @159a * //
analyzed: chung ba dang che ba nyid ni gang gi phyir de tha na bzhad gang du bya ba'i tshig yongs su spang bar bya ba yang yongs su spong na tshig gis rnam par g-yengs pa lta ci smos zhes gsungs pa'o // brnab sems med pa ni dngos po @159a * //
translated: ‚ÄúIf you do not even utter words that are the basis for laughter, what need is there to mention words that are distracted?‚ÄùüîΩNon-covetousness is taught through three topics:

original: dang ; rang bzhin dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / rnam pa gsum gyis yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: dang ; rang bzhin dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / rnam pa gsum gyis yongs su bstan to //
translated: its basis, its nature, and its divisions.

original: dngos po yang yongs su gzung ba dang rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po yang yongs su gzung ba dang rang bzhin no //
translated: and the nature of things.

original: yongs su gzung ba'ang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba'ang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of things that are held:

original: bdag gir byas pas yongs su bzung ba dang spyod pas yongs su bzung ba ste gang gi phyir de gzhan gyi nor dang gzhan gyi 'dod pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gir byas pas yongs su bzung ba dang spyod pas yongs su bzung ba ste gang gi phyir de gzhan gyi nor dang gzhan gyi 'dod pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: those held by ownership and those held by use, because it is said that they are the wealth and possessions of others.

original: rang bzhin yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rang bzhin yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of natures:

original: zong gi dngos po 'gron bu dang / gser la sogs pa dang / yongs su spyad pa ste gang gi phyir gzhan gyi rdzas dang yo byad ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zong gi dngos po 'gron bu dang / gser la sogs pa dang / yongs su spyad pa ste gang gi phyir gzhan gyi rdzas dang yo byad ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: the nature of goods, such as coins, gold, etc., and the nature of use, because it is said that they are the wealth and possessions of others.

original: brnab sems med pa'i rang bzhin ni gnyen po gang gis brnab sems mi bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: brnab sems med pa'i rang bzhin ni gnyen po gang gis brnab sems mi bskyed pa ste /
translated: The nature of non-covetousness is the antidote by which one does not generate covetousness.

original: gang gi phyir brnab sems mi skyed ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir brnab sems mi skyed ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because it is said that one does not generate covetousness.

original: de'i rab tu dbye ba ni brnab sems rnam pa gsum gyi gnyen por rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i rab tu dbye ba ni brnab sems rnam pa gsum gyi gnyen por rig par bya ste /
translated: Its classification should be understood as the antidote to the three kinds of covetousness.

original: brnab sems rnam pa gsum ni bslang ba'i sgo dang / thob par smon pa'i sgo dang / rku ba'i sgo nas 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: brnab sems rnam pa gsum ni bslang ba'i sgo dang / thob par smon pa'i sgo dang / rku ba'i sgo nas 'byung ba ste /
translated: The three kinds of covetousness arise from the door of instigation, from the door of hoping for gain, and from the door of stealing.

original: de'i gnyen por 'dod par mi byed cing mi smon chags pa'i sems mi bskyed do zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por 'dod par mi byed cing mi smon chags pa'i sems mi bskyed do zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
translated: The antidote to that is stated: ‚ÄúOne does not covet, does not hope for, does not generate a desirous mind.‚Äù

original: de ltar gong ma gnyis ni chung ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar gong ma gnyis ni chung ba'o //
translated: Thus, the first two are lesser.

original: gsum pa ni che ba'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni che ba'o //
translated: The third is greater.

original: gnod sems med pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen por sems can rnam pa lnga la yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: gnod sems med pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen por sems can rnam pa lnga la yongs su bstan te /
translated: Non-ill will is taught as the antidote to the adverse factors with regard to five kinds of sentient beings.

original: gnod par byed pa rnams la ni gang gi phyir byams pa'i sems zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa rnams la ni gang gi phyir byams pa'i sems zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: With regard to those who harm, it is stated: ‚ÄúBecause of a mind of love.‚Äù

original: nyes par spyad pa spyod pa rnams la ni gang gi phyir phan pa'i sems zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nyes par spyad pa spyod pa rnams la ni gang gi phyir phan pa'i sems zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: With regard to those who engage in bad conduct, it is stated: ‚ÄúBecause of a mind of benefit.‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal zhing slong ba rnams la ni gang gi phyir snying rje'i sems dang bde ba'i sems zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhing slong ba rnams la ni gang gi phyir snying rje'i sems dang bde ba'i sems zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: With regard to those who are suffering and who beg, it is stated: ‚ÄúBecause of a mind of compassion and a mind of happiness.‚Äù

original: bde ba'i phrag dog byed pa rnams la ni gang gi phyir 'jam pa'i sems zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i phrag dog byed pa rnams la ni gang gi phyir 'jam pa'i sems zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: For those who are jealous of the happiness of others, it is said, ‚ÄúBecause of the thought of gentleness.‚Äù

original: byang chub kyi sems yongs su bzung ba rtsol ba shin tu mang pos sgyid lug pa'i dngos po rnams la ni gang gi phyir skye bo thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i sems dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems yongs su bzung ba rtsol ba shin tu mang pos sgyid lug pa'i dngos po rnams la ni gang gi phyir skye bo thams cad la phan 'dogs pa'i sems dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: For those who are discouraged by the many efforts required to take up the thought of enlightenment, it is said, ‚ÄúBecause of the thought to benefit all beings.‚Äù

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni rnam pa drug go //
translated: The resistances are sixfold.

original: de ni byams pa la sogs pa'i sems la bye brag med par shes par bya'i /
analyzed: de ni byams pa la sogs pa'i sems la bye brag med par shes par bya'i /
translated: It should be understood that the thought of enlightenment is not differentiated in the thoughts of love, etc.

original: re re la ni ma yin par bstan te /
analyzed: re re la ni ma yin par bstan te /
translated: But it is taught that each of them has a special function.üîΩIt is the thought of love that brings forth what has not yet come to pass.

original: gang gi kho na ma byung ba 'byin pa dang / gang gis byung ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'am /
analyzed: gang gi kho na ma byung ba 'byin pa dang / gang gis byung ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'am /
translated: It is the thought of compassion that follows what has come to pass.

original: 'phel bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: 'phel bar byed pa'am /
translated: It is the thought of joy that increases.

original: gang gis rang gi sems kyi rgyud la dge ba'i lo rtog ma skyes pa mi skyed cing skyes pa yang yongs su 'grib @159b par byed pa dang / gang gis mi dge ba ma skyes pa skyed cing /
analyzed: gang gis rang gi sems kyi rgyud la dge ba'i lo rtog ma skyes pa mi skyed cing skyes pa yang yongs su 'grib @159b par byed pa dang / gang gis mi dge ba ma skyes pa skyed cing /
translated: It is that which does not cause the arising of virtuous qualities that have not arisen in one‚Äôs mindstream, and causes the decline of those that have arisen.üîΩIt is that which causes the arising of nonvirtuous qualities that have not arisen, and causes the increase of those that have arisen.üîΩIt is that which causes the arising of unpleasant qualities in the mindstreams of others that have not arisen, and causes the increase of those that have arisen.

original: skyes pa yang 'phel bar byed pa dang / gang gis gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la mi sdug pa ma skyes pa skyed cing skyes pa yang 'phel bar byed pa dang / gang gis sdug pa ma skyes pa mi skyed cing skyes pa la yang rjes su mi sems ba ste /
analyzed: skyes pa yang 'phel bar byed pa dang / gang gis gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la mi sdug pa ma skyes pa skyed cing skyes pa yang 'phel bar byed pa dang / gang gis sdug pa ma skyes pa mi skyed cing skyes pa la yang rjes su mi sems ba ste /
translated: It is that which does not cause the arising of pleasant qualities that have not arisen, and does not cause the recollection of those that have arisen.üîΩIt is that which is preceded by anger, resentment, hostility, defilement, malice, and rage.

original: de ni khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / tha ba dang / dri ma dang / gnod sems dang / khong khro ba sngon du 'gro ba gang dag yin pa de dag spangs te zhes bya ba'i tshig de dag dang go rims bzhin du bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / tha ba dang / dri ma dang / gnod sems dang / khong khro ba sngon du 'gro ba gang dag yin pa de dag spangs te zhes bya ba'i tshig de dag dang go rims bzhin du bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: It is the abandonment of those.

original: khro ba la sogs pa de dag ni nyes par spyod pa gzhan gyi sngon du 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: khro ba la sogs pa de dag ni nyes par spyod pa gzhan gyi sngon du 'gro ba yin te /
translated: Anger, etc., are the precursors of other misdeeds.

original: de bas na sngon du 'gro ba dag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na sngon du 'gro ba dag ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called precursors.

original: de dag spangs na gzhan gyi sems kyang de ni byams pa dang ldan pa nyid sems de gang gi phyir byams pa dang ldan pa gang dag yin pa de dag la rtogs pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩyang dag pa'i lta ba ni lta ba rnam pa bdun gyi gnyen por yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: de dag spangs na gzhan gyi sems kyang de ni byams pa dang ldan pa nyid sems de gang gi phyir byams pa dang ldan pa gang dag yin pa de dag la rtogs pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'o // yang dag pa'i lta ba ni lta ba rnam pa bdun gyi gnyen por yongs su bstan te /
translated: When they are abandoned, the mind is endowed with love.üîΩThe right view is taught as the antidote to the seven kinds of views.

original: lta ba rnam pa bdun ni theg pa gzhan la lta ba de'i gnyen por yang dag pa'i lam la gnas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: lta ba rnam pa bdun ni theg pa gzhan la lta ba de'i gnyen por yang dag pa'i lam la gnas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The seven kinds of views are the views of other vehicles.üîΩThe antidote to those is the right view.

original: yongs su rtogs pa bzang po ma yin pa'i lta ba dang / tshul khrims tsam gyis rnam par dag par lta ba de'i gnyen por dge mtshan dang / bkra shis rnam pa sna tshogs dang / tshul khrims ngan pa'i lta ba dang bral ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su rtogs pa bzang po ma yin pa'i lta ba dang / tshul khrims tsam gyis rnam par dag par lta ba de'i gnyen por dge mtshan dang / bkra shis rnam pa sna tshogs dang / tshul khrims ngan pa'i lta ba dang bral ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The antidote to the view that there is no good understanding of the doctrine and the view that there is purification by mere morality is stated as: ‚Äúthe auspicious signs and marks, and the absence of the view of bad morality.‚Äù

original: de la tshul khrims tsam gyis rnam par dag pa lta ba ni bdag tu lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'i tshul khrims yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la tshul khrims tsam gyis rnam par dag pa lta ba ni bdag tu lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa'i tshul khrims yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The view that there is purification by mere morality should be understood as the morality of the one who holds the view of the supremacy of the self.

original: bdag gi mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba de'i gnyen por lta ba drang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag gi mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba de'i gnyen por lta ba drang zhes gsungs so //
translated: The antidote to that view of the supremacy of the self is stated as: ‚Äúthe straight view.‚Äù

original: 'chang ba'i lta ba dang / brdzun du brjod pa'i lta ba de'i gnyen por g-yo med la sgyu med pas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'chang ba'i lta ba dang / brdzun du brjod pa'i lta ba de'i gnyen por g-yo med la sgyu med pas zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The antidote to the view of holding and the view of lying is stated as: ‚Äúwithout deceit, without pretense.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten pa'i ma dag pa'i lta ba de'i gnyen por sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la bsam pa nges pa yin no zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i ma dag pa'i lta ba de'i gnyen por sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la bsam pa nges pa yin no zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The antidote to the impure mundane view is stated as: ‚Äúthe ascertainment of the thought of the Buddha, Dharma, and Sa·πÖgha.‚Äù

original: de ltar rnam pa thams cad spangs pa'i tshul khrims yongs su bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa thams cad spangs pa'i tshul khrims yongs su bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught morality that is the abandonment of all aspects,

original: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par rjes su srung bas de nyid kyi skyon med pa yongs su ston te /
analyzed: rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par rjes su srung bas de nyid kyi skyon med pa yongs su ston te /
translated: he teaches the absence of fault in that very [morality] through constant, uninterrupted protection.

original: gang gi phyir de dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par srung zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par srung zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: For what reason does he say, He always, uninterruptedly protects these paths of the ten wholesome actions?

original: 'di lta ste rnam pa thams cad dang / skyon med pas ni de ltar rang bzhin gyi tshul @160a * //üîΩkhrims nyid yongs su bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste rnam pa thams cad dang / skyon med pas ni de ltar rang bzhin gyi tshul @160a * // khrims nyid yongs su bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, through all aspects and through the absence of fault, he teaches the very nature of morality.

original: de'i 'og tu dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa yongs su bstan pa'i phyir sems kyi bsam pa mngon par sgrub pa la sogs pa'i rim pa ston te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa yongs su bstan pa'i phyir sems kyi bsam pa mngon par sgrub pa la sogs pa'i rim pa ston te /
translated: After that, in order to teach the purity of the morality of gathering virtuous dharmas, he teaches the stages of accomplishing the mental attitude and so forth.

original: 'di ltar sems can gyi bsam pa mngon par bsgrub ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can gyi bsam pa mngon par bsgrub ste /
translated: Thus, he accomplishes the attitudes of sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams kyi ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang / rnam par ltung ba yod pa gang yang rung ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang / rnam par ltung ba yod pa gang yang rung ste /
translated: Whatever the bad migrations, bad destinies, and falls of sentient beings,üîΩall of them arise from the cause of taking up the ten unwholesome courses of action.

original: de dag thams cad mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyu las byung gi / bdag gis ni 'di ltar bdag nyid yang dag par sgrub pa la gnas te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyu las byung gi / bdag gis ni 'di ltar bdag nyid yang dag par sgrub pa la gnas te /
translated: But I, having thus established myself in right practice,

original: gzhan dag kyang yang dag par sgrub pa la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang yang dag par sgrub pa la dgod par bya'o //
translated: should cause others to enter into right practice.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ni gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med de /
analyzed: 'di ni gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med de /
translated: It is not possible, it cannot be,

original: gang bdag log par sgrub pa la gnas shing /
analyzed: gang bdag log par sgrub pa la gnas shing /
translated: that I, having established myself in wrong practice,üîΩshould cause others to enter into right practice.

original: gzhan dag yang dag par sgrub pa la dgod par bya ba 'di ni gnas med do snyam nas zhes bya ba de la ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang / log par ltung ba gdags pa ni don rnam pa gsum gyis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag yang dag par sgrub pa la dgod par bya ba 'di ni gnas med do snyam nas zhes bya ba de la ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang / log par ltung ba gdags pa ni don rnam pa gsum gyis rig par bya ste /
translated: There, the designation of bad migrations, bad destinies, and falls should be understood in three ways:

original: nyes par spyod pas 'gro ba'i don dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnas lus mngon par 'grub pa'i don dang / gnod pa sna tshogs su rtag tu ltung ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyes par spyod pas 'gro ba'i don dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnas lus mngon par 'grub pa'i don dang / gnod pa sna tshogs su rtag tu ltung ba'i don to //
translated: 1) the meaning of going to bad destinies; 2) the meaning of establishing a body and place of suffering; 3) the meaning of constantly falling into various harms.

original: kha na ma tho ba dang / grangs dang / 'bras bu thob par byed pas bsdus pa'i phyir mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi tshig tu rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba dang / grangs dang / 'bras bu thob par byed pas bsdus pa'i phyir mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi tshig tu rig par bya'o //
translated: The words of the ten unwholesome courses of action should be understood as being included in the meaning of blameworthiness, number, and obtaining results.

original: de la kha na ma tho ba dang / grangs dang / 'bras bu thob par byed pas bsdus pa'i phyir mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lan du bstan par rig par bya zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la kha na ma tho ba dang / grangs dang / 'bras bu thob par byed pas bsdus pa'i phyir mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lan du bstan par rig par bya zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, the words of the ten unwholesome courses of action should be understood as being taught in terms of being included in the meaning of blameworthiness, number, and obtaining results.

original: kha na ma tho bas bsdus pa'i phyir mi dge ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: kha na ma tho bas bsdus pa'i phyir mi dge ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Among them, unwholesome is included in the meaning of blameworthiness.

original: kha na ma tho ba ni 'bras bu ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang / rnam par ltung ba rnams smad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba ni 'bras bu ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang / rnam par ltung ba rnams smad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Blameworthiness means the bad destinies, bad rebirths, and falling into various bad rebirths are to be despised.

original: grangs kyis bsdus pa'i phyir bcu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: grangs kyis bsdus pa'i phyir bcu zhes bya'o //
translated: Ten is included in the meaning of number.

original: 'bras bu thob par byed pas bsdus pa'i phyir las kyi lam rnams shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob par byed pas bsdus pa'i phyir las kyi lam rnams shes par bya'o //
translated: The paths of action should be understood as being included in the cause of obtaining the result.

original: yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus zhes bya ba la /
translated: By the cause of proper undertaking.

original: yang dag par blangs pa ni kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par blangs pa ni kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: Proper undertaking is practice.

original: de ltar rgyu med pa dang mi 'dra ba'i rgyu bsal te /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu med pa dang mi 'dra ba'i rgyu bsal te /
translated: Thus, the cause of nonexistence and the cause of nonsimilarity are excluded.

original: las bdag gir bya ba nyid yin par rtogs nas sems can log par sgrub pa la gnas pa rnams bdag nyid de 'dra bas ni de dang 'bral mi nus par rig nas de dag yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir bdag mngon par spro'o //
analyzed: las bdag gir bya ba nyid yin par rtogs nas sems can log par sgrub pa la gnas pa rnams bdag nyid de 'dra bas ni de dang 'bral mi nus par rig nas de dag yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir bdag mngon par spro'o //
translated: Having understood that action is one‚Äôs own, one should be enthusiastic about protecting those sentient beings who are engaged in wrong practice, knowing that one is unable to separate from them because of being like that.

original: de'i 'og tu mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen por gyur pa 'bras bu dang @160b bcas pa'i las kyi lam rnams dang / dge ba'i las kyi lam gong nas gong du rnam par dag pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa la rab tu brtags nas /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen por gyur pa 'bras bu dang @160b bcas pa'i las kyi lam rnams dang / dge ba'i las kyi lam gong nas gong du rnam par dag pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa la rab tu brtags nas /
translated: After that, having thoroughly examined the paths of action with their results that are adverse and remedial, and the pure paths of virtuous action with their results,

original: mchog mngon par sgrub par sbyor bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: mchog mngon par sgrub par sbyor bar 'dod pas /
translated: one who wishes to apply oneself to accomplishing the supreme

original: dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pas sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pas sgrub par byed de /
translated: One accomplishes it by means of the pure morality of gathering virtuous natures.

original: gang gi phyir de 'di ltar rnam par spyod de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de 'di ltar rnam par spyod de /
translated: For what reason does one practice in this way?

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba rnams yod par gyur to //
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba rnams yod par gyur to //
translated: Because of the cause of taking up the ten unwholesome actions, the destinies of sentient beings in the hells, animal wombs, and the world of Yama come to be.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus ni lha dang mir skye ba la sogs pa srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du skye ba yod par gyur to //
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus ni lha dang mir skye ba la sogs pa srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du skye ba yod par gyur to //
translated: Because of the cause of taking up the ten wholesome actions, birth as a god or human up to the peak of existence comes to be.

original: de'i gong du dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag nyi tshe ba'i sems dang / khams gsum pas skrag pa'i yid dang / snying rje chen po med pa dang / gzhan las thos pa'i rjes su 'gro ste /
analyzed: de'i gong du dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag nyi tshe ba'i sems dang / khams gsum pas skrag pa'i yid dang / snying rje chen po med pa dang / gzhan las thos pa'i rjes su 'gro ste /
translated: Above that, these ten wholesome actions are practiced with a limited mind, with a mind afraid of the three realms, without great compassion, and following what is heard from others.

original: sgra'i rjes su 'brang bas shes rab kyi rnam pas yongs su bsgoms na nyan thos kyi theg pa 'grub par byed do zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: sgra'i rjes su 'brang bas shes rab kyi rnam pas yongs su bsgoms na nyan thos kyi theg pa 'grub par byed do zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: If one cultivates the aspects of wisdom by following the words, one accomplishes the vehicle of the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: shes rab kyi rnam pa ni 'dir bden pa'i rnam pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi rnam pa ni 'dir bden pa'i rnam pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Here, the aspects of wisdom should be understood as the aspects of the truths.

original: ngan 'gro rnams ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: ngan 'gro rnams ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The miserable realms are suffering.

original: mi dge ba'i las kyi lam rnams ni kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las kyi lam rnams ni kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: The paths of nonvirtuous actions are the origin.

original: de spangs pa ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: de spangs pa ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: The abandonment of those is cessation.

original: de'i gnyen po ni lam mo ;
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni lam mo ;
translated: The antidote to those is the path.

original: / bde 'gro ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: / bde 'gro ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: The happy realms are suffering.

original: dge ba'i las kyi lam rnams ni kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i las kyi lam rnams ni kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: The paths of virtuous actions are the origin.

original: bag la nyal spangs pa ni 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: bag la nyal spangs pa ni 'gog pa'o //
translated: The abandonment of the latent afflictions is cessation.

original: de'i gnyen po ni lam mo //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po ni lam mo //
translated: The antidote to those is the path.

original: shes rab kyi rnam par yongs su bsgom par 'dra ba la nyan thos rnams kyi theg pa ni rgyu bsags pa dang / 'jig pa dang / mi lta ba dang / rten dang / dmigs pa dang / rnam pa lngas tha dad par bstan to //
analyzed: shes rab kyi rnam par yongs su bsgom par 'dra ba la nyan thos rnams kyi theg pa ni rgyu bsags pa dang / 'jig pa dang / mi lta ba dang / rten dang / dmigs pa dang / rnam pa lngas tha dad par bstan to //
translated: The vehicle of the ≈õrƒÅvakas is taught to be different from the cultivation of the aspects of wisdom in five ways: cause, collection, destruction, non-view, support, and object.

original: de dag las nyi tshe ba nyan thos kyi theg pa'i sems can ni rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de dag las nyi tshe ba nyan thos kyi theg pa'i sems can ni rgyu yin te /
translated: The beings of the Disciple Vehicle are the cause of the limited thought of enlightenment,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba dpag tu yod pa mngon par sgrub pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir dang / bdag gi don 'ba' zhig byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba dpag tu yod pa mngon par sgrub pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir dang / bdag gi don 'ba' zhig byed pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are in the stage of establishing roots of virtue that are limited, and because they work only for their own benefit.

original: gang gi phyir nyi tshe ba'i sems zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir nyi tshe ba'i sems zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is why the limited thought of enlightenment is mentioned.

original: sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa ni gang gi phyir khams gsum pas skrag pa'i yid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa ni gang gi phyir khams gsum pas skrag pa'i yid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The fear of suffering is the frightened mind about the three realms.

original: sems can rnams la mi lta ba ni gang gi phyir snying rje chen po med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la mi lta ba ni gang gi phyir snying rje chen po med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The lack of regard for beings is the absence of great compassion.

original: slob dpon gyi man ngag ni rten to //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi man ngag ni rten to //
translated: The instruction of the master is the support.

original: sgra ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: sgra ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: Sound is the objective reference.

original: sgra ni gang zhe na /üîΩbdag dang sems @161a * //
analyzed: sgra ni gang zhe na / bdag dang sems @161a * //
translated: What is sound?

original: can la sogs par 'dogs pa ste /
analyzed: can la sogs par 'dogs pa ste /
translated: The designations of self, beings, and so on.

original: de ltar de dag sgra tsam du rtogs nas gang zag la bdag med pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: de ltar de dag sgra tsam du rtogs nas gang zag la bdag med pa la 'jug ste /
translated: Thus, having understood that they are mere sound, one enters into the selflessness of the person.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan las thos pa'i rjes su 'gro ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan las thos pa'i rjes su 'gro ste /
translated: Because one follows what is heard from another.

original: sgra'i rjes su 'brang ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sgra'i rjes su 'brang ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The term following sound is used.

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / bshad pa la mi phyogs pa dang / gnas pa dang rnam pa gsum gyis bstan to //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba dang / bshad pa la mi phyogs pa dang / gnas pa dang rnam pa gsum gyis bstan to //
translated: The pratyekabuddhas are taught to be enlightened, not to teach, and to live alone.

original: de dag ni ston pa'am /üîΩrjes su ston pa la ma brten par mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
analyzed: de dag ni ston pa'am / rjes su ston pa la ma brten par mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ste /
translated: They are not dependent on a teacherüîΩor on instruction, for they are enlightened by themselves.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa dang / rang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa dang / rang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: They are called self-enlightened because they do not depend on others.

original: chos ston par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: chos ston par mi 'dod de /
translated: They do not want to teach the Dharma,

original: mi ston pa ni gang gi phyir snying rje chen po dang thabs la mkhas pa med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩrten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la gnas pa shin tu cha phra bas mang du gnas pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: mi ston pa ni gang gi phyir snying rje chen po dang thabs la mkhas pa med pa zhes gsungs pa'o // rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la gnas pa shin tu cha phra bas mang du gnas pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: because they lack great compassion and skill in means.üîΩThey live alone, dwelling in the profound dependent origination,

original: rkyen 'di nyid pa zab mo khong du chud pas /
analyzed: rkyen 'di nyid pa zab mo khong du chud pas /
translated: because they have realized the profound reality of conditions.

original: yongs su sbyangs na rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa 'grub par byed do zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su sbyangs na rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa 'grub par byed do zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: When fully trained, it causes the accomplishment of the vehicle of the Solitary Buddhas.

original: rgyu chung du bsags pa dang / sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa dang / sems can la mi lta ba yang de dag la yod do //
analyzed: rgyu chung du bsags pa dang / sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs pa dang / sems can la mi lta ba yang de dag la yod do //
translated: The causes of the Solitary Buddha vehicle are small, and the fear of suffering and lack of regard for sentient beings are also present in them.

original: bye brag gang yin pa de ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: bye brag gang yin pa de ni bshad zin to //
translated: The difference between them and the Disciples has been explained.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni rgyu bsags pa dang / dgos pa dang / des nus pa dang / sa dang rnam pa bzhis bstan te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni rgyu bsags pa dang / dgos pa dang / des nus pa dang / sa dang rnam pa bzhis bstan te /
translated: The causes of the Bodhisattvas are the accumulation of causes, the purpose, the ability, and the stage.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad mngon par sgrub pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir dang / sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir theg pa chen po'i sems shin tu rgyas shing tshad med pa ni rgyu yin par rig par bya ste /üîΩgang gi phyir de'i gong du shin tu rgya che zhing /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad mngon par sgrub pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir dang / sems can thams cad kyi don byed pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir theg pa chen po'i sems shin tu rgyas shing tshad med pa ni rgyu yin par rig par bya ste / gang gi phyir de'i gong du shin tu rgya che zhing /
translated: The cause of the Great Vehicle mind should be known as the accumulation of causes, because it is the occasion for accomplishing all the roots of virtue and because it is the occasion for acting for the benefit of all sentient beings.üîΩBecause it is said that,üîΩhaving fully trained with a mind that is very vast and immeasurable,

original: tshad med pa'i sems kyis yongs su sbyangs nas zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa'i sems kyis yongs su sbyangs nas zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: one should go beyond it.üîΩThe purpose of the Great Vehicle mind is to be understood as the purpose of the Great Vehicle, because it is the occasion for the accomplishment of the two goals of self and other.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dang / sdug bsngal bar gyur ba'i sems can rnams la ni snying brtse ba dang / snying rje bar rig par bya ste /üîΩde dang ldan pas sems can gyi don ni byang chub sems dpa'i dgos pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dang / sdug bsngal bar gyur ba'i sems can rnams la ni snying brtse ba dang / snying rje bar rig par bya ste / de dang ldan pas sems can gyi don ni byang chub sems dpa'i dgos pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that compassion is the cause of suffering and that loving kindness is the cause of happiness.

original: gang gi phyir snying brtse ba dang snying rje dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir snying brtse ba dang snying rje dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: One should understand that the benefit of sentient beings is the purpose of the bodhisattva, because of the statement, ‚Äúendowed with compassion and loving kindness.‚Äù

original: de nus pa ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po dag ste /
analyzed: de nus pa ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po dag ste /
translated: The power of the bodhisattva is the four means of unification.

original: gang gi phyir thabs la mkhas pas bsdus pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir thabs la mkhas pas bsdus pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: One should understand that the power of the bodhisattva is the four means of unification, because of the statement, ‚Äúunification through skill in means.‚Äù

original: sa ni rnam pa gsum ste /üîΩlhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa ni smon lam chen po bcus @161b rab tu phye ba yin te /
analyzed: sa ni rnam pa gsum ste / lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i sa ni smon lam chen po bcus @161b rab tu phye ba yin te /
translated: The stages are threefold:üîΩThe stage of pure universal responsibility is distinguished by the ten great vows.

original: gang gi phyir smon lam chen po shin tu btab pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir smon lam chen po shin tu btab pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: One should understand that the stage of pure universal responsibility is distinguished by the ten great vows, because of the statement, ‚Äúhaving made great vows.‚Äù

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa ni gang thob nas /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa ni gang thob nas /
translated: The stage of nonregression is that stage on which,

original: zhi bar gnas kyang sems can rnams yongs su mi gtong ba ste /
analyzed: zhi bar gnas kyang sems can rnams yongs su mi gtong ba ste /
translated: having attained it, one does not abandon sentient beings, although one remains in a state of peace.

original: gang gi phyir sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because he does not abandon any sentient beings.

original: dbang bskur ba chen po'i sa ni gang la sangs rgyas kyi ye shes shin tu rgyas pa rtogs pa chen po 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba chen po'i sa ni gang la sangs rgyas kyi ye shes shin tu rgyas pa rtogs pa chen po 'dod pa ste /
translated: The stage of great consecration is the one on which the bodhisattva realizes the great enlightenment of the buddhas.

original: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi ye shes shin tu rgyas pa la dmigs pas zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi ye shes shin tu rgyas pa la dmigs pas zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because he focuses on the great enlightenment of the buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa yongs su dag pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'i spyod pa rgya chen po 'grub par byed do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa yongs su dag pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'i spyod pa rgya chen po 'grub par byed do zhes bya ba la /
translated: The bodhisattva perfects the conduct of the pure stages and the pure perfections.

original: 'dir byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa shin tu rgyas pa sgrub bo zhes brjod pas chog pa 'dras kyang sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'i tshig gis gong nas gong du rnam par dag pa'i phyir dang / chos kyi mchog rnam par dag pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa de shin tu rgyas par yongs su ston te /
analyzed: 'dir byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa shin tu rgyas pa sgrub bo zhes brjod pas chog pa 'dras kyang sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa'i tshig gis gong nas gong du rnam par dag pa'i phyir dang / chos kyi mchog rnam par dag pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa de shin tu rgyas par yongs su ston te /
translated: Here, the bodhisattva practice is taught in great detail, although it would suffice to say, ‚ÄúI will practice the vast bodhisattva practice.‚Äù

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i don ni mchog gi don to //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i don ni mchog gi don to //
translated: The meaning of perfection is the meaning of supreme.

original: de'i gong du zhes bya ba ni spong ba dang / dbang byed pa dang / yongs su spong zhing mkhas pa dang / chog mi shes pa dang / rnam pa bzhis gong nyid yin par rig par bya ste mi dge ba'i las kyi lam rnams bag chags dang bcas par spong ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: de'i gong du zhes bya ba ni spong ba dang / dbang byed pa dang / yongs su spong zhing mkhas pa dang / chog mi shes pa dang / rnam pa bzhis gong nyid yin par rig par bya ste mi dge ba'i las kyi lam rnams bag chags dang bcas par spong ba'i phyir dang /
translated: The meaning of higher is to be understood as fourfold: abandonment, mastery, complete relinquishment, and expertise.

original: dge ba thams cad la dbang byed pa'i phyir dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa yongs su spong zhing /
analyzed: dge ba thams cad la dbang byed pa'i phyir dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa yongs su spong zhing /
translated: because it abandons the vehicles of the disciples and the solitary sages,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la mkhas pa'i phyir dang / lhag ma dang bcas pas chog mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa la mkhas pa'i phyir dang / lhag ma dang bcas pas chog mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and because it is not satisfied with the limited.

original: shes bya thams cad shes pa la dbang bas rnam pa thams cad yongs su sbyang bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: shes bya thams cad shes pa la dbang bas rnam pa thams cad yongs su sbyang bar rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that the purification of all aspects is due to the control of knowledge of all objects of knowledge,

original: gang gi phyir de'i gong du rnam pa thams cad ces yongs su sbyangs pas stobs bcu'i stobs dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par 'grub pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i gong du rnam pa thams cad ces yongs su sbyangs pas stobs bcu'i stobs dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par 'grub pa'i bar du'o //
translated: because it is said that ‚Äúabove that, the purification of all aspects is due to the control of knowledge of all objects of knowledge, up to the complete accomplishment of the ten powers and all the qualities of a Buddha.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na bdag gis mngon par bsgrub tu 'dra ba la rnam pa thams cad yongs su spyod zhing mngon par sgrub pa nyid la brtson par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag gis mngon par bsgrub tu 'dra ba la rnam pa thams cad yongs su spyod zhing mngon par sgrub pa nyid la brtson par bya'o zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, I should strive for the accomplishment of the purification of all aspects, which is similar to the accomplishment of others.

original: bdud phyir rgol ba dang / theg pa dman pa dag sel bar byed pa'i skabs yin pas stobs dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos smos par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bdud phyir rgol ba dang / theg pa dman pa dag sel bar byed pa'i skabs yin pas stobs dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos smos par rig par bya ste /
translated: The power of the Buddha is to be known as the elimination of the obstacles of Mara and the Hinayana.

original: de'i 'og tu snying rje la gnas te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu snying rje la gnas te /
translated: After that, one should abide in compassion.

original: sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul @162a * //
analyzed: sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul @162a * //
translated: The method of benefiting sentient beings is taught in the next verse.

original: khrims kyi dbang du byas nas don lnga yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: khrims kyi dbang du byas nas don lnga yongs su bstan te /
translated: The five topics are taught in terms of morality:

original: yongs su shes pa dang / smon lam dang / sgrub pa dang / rgyu mthun pa dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa dang / smon lam dang / sgrub pa dang / rgyu mthun pa dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: complete understanding, aspiration, practice, natural outcome, and the result of the natural outcome.

original: de la yongs su shes pa ni gnas skabs kyi bye brag dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'i bye brag dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'i bye brag dang / rnam pa gsum gyis yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: de la yongs su shes pa ni gnas skabs kyi bye brag dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'i bye brag dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'i bye brag dang / rnam pa gsum gyis yongs su bstan to //
translated: Complete understanding is taught in three ways: the distinctions of the different situations, the distinctions of the different results of maturation, and the distinctions of the different natural outcomes.

original: gnas skabs kyi bye brag ni mi dge ba'i las kyi lam rnams las brtsams nas rgyu dang 'bras bu chen po dang / 'bring dang / chung du'i bye brag ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi bye brag ni mi dge ba'i las kyi lam rnams las brtsams nas rgyu dang 'bras bu chen po dang / 'bring dang / chung du'i bye brag ste /
translated: The distinctions of the different situations are the distinctions of the great, middling, and small results of cause and effect, beginning with the nonvirtuous paths of action.

original: gang gi phyir de 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
translated: Because he trains in this way:

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag la brten pa dang / bsgoms pa dang / mang du byas pa'i shas che bas ni sems can dmyal ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag la brten pa dang / bsgoms pa dang / mang du byas pa'i shas che bas ni sems can dmyal ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThese ten unwholesome courses of action, when practiced, cultivated, and repeated much, lead to rebirth as a hell being,

original: 'bring gis ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas kyi rgyur 'gyur ro /
analyzed: 'bring gis ni dud 'gro'i skye gnas kyi rgyur 'gyur ro /
translated: when practiced, cultivated, and repeated to a medium degree, they lead to rebirth as an animal,

original: chung dus ni gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi rgyur 'gyur te zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: chung dus ni gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi rgyur 'gyur te zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: and when practiced, cultivated, and repeated to a lesser degree, they lead to rebirth in the world of Yama.‚Äù

original: gong du ni ngan song gi rgyu tha dad pa med par rnam par spyad kyi da ni tha dad par spyad do //
analyzed: gong du ni ngan song gi rgyu tha dad pa med par rnam par spyad kyi da ni tha dad par spyad do //
translated: Previously, the causes of the lower realms were explained without distinction. Now, they are explained in a distinguished way.

original: rna par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni thams cad kyang ngan song rnams te /üîΩgang gi phyir srog gcod pa nas /
analyzed: rna par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni thams cad kyang ngan song rnams te / gang gi phyir srog gcod pa nas /
translated: The fully ripened result is rebirth in the lower realms.

original: log par lta ba'i bar gyis sems can dmyal ba'i bar du khrid do //
analyzed: log par lta ba'i bar gyis sems can dmyal ba'i bar du khrid do //
translated: Because killing leads to rebirth as a hell being,

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su khrid do //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su khrid do //
translated: leads to rebirth as an animal,

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du khrid do zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten du khrid do zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and leads to rebirth in the world of Yama.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni mi rnams kyi nang du skyes na yang /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni mi rnams kyi nang du skyes na yang /
translated: The corresponding result is that even if you are born among humans,

original: so so'i rnam pa gnyis gnyis te /
analyzed: so so'i rnam pa gnyis gnyis te /
translated: you will have two kinds of physical appearance.

original: de nas gal te mi rnams kyi nang du skyes na yang rnam par smin pa gnyis mngon par sgrub ste /
analyzed: de nas gal te mi rnams kyi nang du skyes na yang rnam par smin pa gnyis mngon par sgrub ste /
translated: Then, if you are born among humans, you will experience two kinds of results that are consequences of your actions:

original: tshe thung ba dang / nad mang bar 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa'i'o //
analyzed: tshe thung ba dang / nad mang bar 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa'i'o //
translated: a short life and many illnesses.

original: longs spyod chung ba dang / thun mong gi longs spyod du 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni ma byin par len pa'i 'o //
analyzed: longs spyod chung ba dang / thun mong gi longs spyod du 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni ma byin par len pa'i 'o //
translated: You will have few resources and the resources you have will be shared with others.

original: g-yog 'khor yid brtan du mi rung ba dang / 'gran zla dang bcas pa'i chung mar 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa log par g-yem pa'i'o //
analyzed: g-yog 'khor yid brtan du mi rung ba dang / 'gran zla dang bcas pa'i chung mar 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa log par g-yem pa'i'o //
translated: You will have untrustworthy attendants and your spouse will compete with you.

original: skur pa mang ba dang / gzhan gyis bslu bar 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni brdzun du smra ba'i'o //
analyzed: skur pa mang ba dang / gzhan gyis bslu bar 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni brdzun du smra ba'i'o //
translated: You will be much criticized and you will be deceived by others.

original: g-yog 'khor mi 'dum pa dang / g-yog 'khor ngan par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni phra ma zer ba'i 'o //üîΩyid du mi 'ong ba thos pa dang / 'thab mo'i tshig tu 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni tshig rtsub po'i'o //
analyzed: g-yog 'khor mi 'dum pa dang / g-yog 'khor ngan par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni phra ma zer ba'i 'o // yid du mi 'ong ba thos pa dang / 'thab mo'i tshig tu 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni tshig rtsub po'i'o //
translated: discord among one‚Äôs retinue and having a bad retinue.üîΩhearing what is unpleasant and being a contentious speaker.

original: gzung bar 'os pa'i tshig ma yin pa dang / ma nges pa'i spobs par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni tshig @162b 'khyal pa'i'o //
analyzed: gzung bar 'os pa'i tshig ma yin pa dang / ma nges pa'i spobs par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni tshig @162b 'khyal pa'i'o //
translated: not being a speaker who is worth listening to and having uncertain eloquence.

original: chog mi shes pa dang / 'dod pa che bar 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni brnab sems kyi'o //
analyzed: chog mi shes pa dang / 'dod pa che bar 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni brnab sems kyi'o //
translated: insatiability and great desires.

original: phan pa mi 'tshol ba dang zhan gyis gnod pa bya bar 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni gnod sems kyi'o //
analyzed: phan pa mi 'tshol ba dang zhan gyis gnod pa bya bar 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni gnod sems kyi'o //
translated: not seeking what is beneficial and being a person who injures others.

original: lta ba ngan par ltung ba dang / g-yo sgyu can du 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni log par lta ba'i'o //
analyzed: lta ba ngan par ltung ba dang / g-yo sgyu can du 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ni log par lta ba'i'o //
translated: falling into bad views and being deceitful.

original: de la gnas skabs dang / rnam par smin pa tha dad pa gnyis kyis ni sdug bsngal mi bzad pa nyid yongs su ston to //
analyzed: de la gnas skabs dang / rnam par smin pa tha dad pa gnyis kyis ni sdug bsngal mi bzad pa nyid yongs su ston to //
translated: The two, the temporary and the evolutionary, reveal the unbearable suffering.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: chung du rnams kyis ni gshin rje'i 'jig rten mi bzad pa'o //
analyzed: chung du rnams kyis ni gshin rje'i 'jig rten mi bzad pa'o //
translated: The small ones are the unbearable world of Yama.

original: 'bring rnams kyis ni rab tu mi bzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'bring rnams kyis ni rab tu mi bzad pa'o //
translated: The medium ones are the very unbearable.

original: chen po rnams kyi ni mchog tu mi bzad pa'o //
analyzed: chen po rnams kyi ni mchog tu mi bzad pa'o //
translated: The great ones are the most unbearable.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'dras bu'i bye brag ni bde 'gro'i bar du yang rjes su 'brel pas khyab pa nyid do //üîΩre re dang mtha' dag gi ni ngan song rnams su sdug bsngal che ba dang / tshad med par 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'dras bu'i bye brag ni bde 'gro'i bar du yang rjes su 'brel pas khyab pa nyid do // re re dang mtha' dag gi ni ngan song rnams su sdug bsngal che ba dang / tshad med par 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
translated: The specific result of the natural outcome is the pervasion by the connection even in the happy realms.üîΩThe specific result of the evolutionary action should be understood as the great suffering in the miserable realms, and the immeasurable.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar na mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po tshad med pa sdud par 'gyur gyis zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar na mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po tshad med pa sdud par 'gyur gyis zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, these ten unwholesome actions accumulate the immeasurable great mass of suffering.

original: smon lam ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i don du dge ba'i chos bsdu ba'i phyir theg pa chen po'i chos la mngon par dga' ba nyid kyi bsam pa ste /
analyzed: smon lam ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i don du dge ba'i chos bsdu ba'i phyir theg pa chen po'i chos la mngon par dga' ba nyid kyi bsam pa ste /
translated: Aspiration is the thought of delighting in the Mahayana teachings in order to gather virtuous dharmas for the sake of working for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: gang gi phyir mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag bdag gis spangs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag bdag gis spangs te /
translated: For the sake of which one thinks, ‚ÄúI will abandon these paths of the ten nonvirtuous actions

original: chos kyi kun dga' la dga' bas dga' bar gnas par bya'o snyam nas zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi kun dga' la dga' bas dga' bar gnas par bya'o snyam nas zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and abide in delight through delight in the Dharma.‚Äù

original: sgrub pa ni dge ba'i las kyi lam la gnas par byed cing /
analyzed: sgrub pa ni dge ba'i las kyi lam la gnas par byed cing /
translated: Accomplishment is the application of abiding in the paths of virtuous actions

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong bar sbyor la /
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong bar sbyor la /
translated: and abandoning their discordant factors,

original: gzhan dag kyang de la gzhog pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang de la gzhog pa ste /
translated: and also establishing others in those.

original: gang gi phyir de mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag spangs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag spangs te /
translated: For the sake of which one thinks, ‚ÄúI will abandon these paths of the ten nonvirtuous actions

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la gnas shing /
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la gnas shing /
translated: and abide in the paths of the ten virtuous actions,

original: gzhan rnams kyang de dag nyid la 'god do zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams kyang de dag nyid la 'god do zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and I will also establish others in those.‚Äù

original: rgyu mthun pa ni snying rje skyes pa la brten nas /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa ni snying rje skyes pa la brten nas /
translated: Natural outflow is, based on the arising of compassion,

original: sems can rnams la de bas kyang shas cher sems rnam pa bcu bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la de bas kyang shas cher sems rnam pa bcu bskyed pa'o //
translated: He generates even more of these ten kinds of thoughts for sentient beings.

original: de ni sems can rnam pa brgyad la rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni sems can rnam pa brgyad la rig par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood as being for eight kinds of sentient beings.

original: nyes par spyod pa la zhugs pa rnams la ni legs par spyad pa la 'jug par smon pa ste /
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa la zhugs pa rnams la ni legs par spyad pa la 'jug par smon pa ste /
translated: For those who are engaged in evil deeds, he wishes that they engage in good deeds.

original: gang gi phyir de sems can rnams la de bas kyang shas cher phan pa'i sems nyid bskyed ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de sems can rnams la de bas kyang shas cher phan pa'i sems nyid bskyed ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: For this reason, he generates even more of the thought of benefit for sentient beings.

original: legs par spyad pa la zhugs pa rnams la ni de'i 'bras bu thob par smon pa ste /
analyzed: legs par spyad pa la zhugs pa rnams la ni de'i 'bras bu thob par smon pa ste /
translated: For those who are engaged in good deeds, he wishes that they obtain the results of those deeds.

original: gang gi phyir bde ba'i sems nyid ces gsungs pa'o //üîΩphan tshun rigs pa'i 'phrod pa rnams la ni @163a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bde ba'i sems nyid ces gsungs pa'o // phan tshun rigs pa'i 'phrod pa rnams la ni @163a * //
translated: For this reason, he generates the thought of happiness.

original: 'dum par smon pa ste /
analyzed: 'dum par smon pa ste /
translated: For those who are in conflict with each other, he wishes that they be reconciled.

original: gang gi phyir byams pa'i sems nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir byams pa'i sems nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: For this reason, he generates the thought of love.

original: sdug bsngal ba rnams la ni de dang 'brel bar smon pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba rnams la ni de dang 'brel bar smon pa ste /
translated: For those who are suffering, he wishes that they be freed from that suffering.

original: gang gi phyir snying brtse ba'i sems nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir snying brtse ba'i sems nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: For this reason, he generates the thought of compassion.

original: bde ba rnams la ni bag yod par smon pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba rnams la ni bag yod par smon pa ste /
translated: He wishes for happiness for those who are heedless.

original: gang gi phyir snying rje'i sems nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir snying rje'i sems nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because he has a compassionate mind.

original: mu stegs can la ni 'jug par phan gdags par bya ba la mngon par phyogs pa ste /
analyzed: mu stegs can la ni 'jug par phan gdags par bya ba la mngon par phyogs pa ste /
translated: He wishes to benefit those who are non-Buddhists.

original: gang gi phyir phan gdags pa'i sems nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phan gdags pa'i sems nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because he has a helpful mind.

original: chos 'di ba rnams la ni //
analyzed: chos 'di ba rnams la ni //
translated: He wishes for the Dharma for those who are Buddhists.

original: yongs su mi nyams par smon pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su mi nyams par smon pa ste /
translated: He wishes for them not to degenerate.

original: gang gi phyir kun du bsrung ba'i sems nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir kun du bsrung ba'i sems nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because he has a mind to protect them.

original: byang chub tu smon pa yongs su bzung ba'i sems can thams cad la ni bdag gi lus nyid du 'dzin pas sems can de dag ni bdag gi lus so snyam pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub tu smon pa yongs su bzung ba'i sems can thams cad la ni bdag gi lus nyid du 'dzin pas sems can de dag ni bdag gi lus so snyam pa ste /
translated: He wishes for the body for all beings who have taken up the vow of enlightenment. He thinks, ‚ÄúThose beings are my body.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir mnyam pa'i sems nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mnyam pa'i sems nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because he has an attitude of equality.

original: sems bskyed pa tha ma gnyis ni de dag nyid ltos pas theg pa chen po'i lam du zhugs pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs sogs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa tha ma gnyis ni de dag nyid ltos pas theg pa chen po'i lam du zhugs pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs sogs par rig par bya ste /
translated: The last two kinds of generating the Thought are to be known as the entry into the Great Vehicle path and the accumulation of the collections of merit and knowledge, respectively.

original: gang gi phyir slob dpon gyi sems nyid dang / ston pa'i sems nyid bskyed ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir slob dpon gyi sems nyid dang / ston pa'i sems nyid bskyed ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is because the Master himself has said, ‚ÄúThe Thought of the Master himself is the generating of the Thought.‚Äù

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni snying rje'i khyad par gyis yongs su zin pa'i 'dun pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni snying rje'i khyad par gyis yongs su zin pa'i 'dun pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The result corresponding to the cause is the special aspiration which is taken hold of by the special compassion.

original: de ni phyin ci log gi dbang du byas nas 'dod pa dang / srid pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa tshol bar gyur pa'i sems can rnams la blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni phyin ci log gi dbang du byas nas 'dod pa dang / srid pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa tshol bar gyur pa'i sems can rnams la blta bar bya ste /
translated: This is to be seen in sentient beings who are under the influence of error, who are seeking for desire, existence, and the Brahma-conduct.

original: 'dod pa tshol bar gyur pa'i sems can dag ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dod pa tshol bar gyur pa'i sems can dag ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Sentient beings who are seeking for desire are of two kinds:

original: yongs su spyod pa'i gnas skabs dang / kun du tshol ba'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: yongs su spyod pa'i gnas skabs dang / kun du tshol ba'i gnas skabs so //
translated: those in the situation of enjoyment and those in the situation of seeking.

original: yongs su spyod pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yongs su spyod pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The enjoyment is of three kinds:

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i yongs su spyod pa dang / chog mi shes par yongs su spyod pa dang / sogs 'jog byed pa'i yongs su spyod pa'o //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i yongs su spyod pa dang / chog mi shes par yongs su spyod pa dang / sogs 'jog byed pa'i yongs su spyod pa'o //
translated: enjoyment of the uncommon, enjoyment of the insatiable, and enjoyment of the accumulation of the stores.

original: kun du tshol ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: kun du tshol ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of search:

original: nyes par spyad pa la sbyor bas tshe 'di kun du tshol ba dang / legs par spyad pa la sbyor bas tshe rabs gzhan kun du tshol ba'o //
analyzed: nyes par spyad pa la sbyor bas tshe 'di kun du tshol ba dang / legs par spyad pa la sbyor bas tshe rabs gzhan kun du tshol ba'o //
translated: search for this life, which is connected with bad conduct, and search for other lives, which is connected with good conduct.

original: srid pa tshol ba yang 'gro ba dang / khams kyi bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: srid pa tshol ba yang 'gro ba dang / khams kyi bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: There are two kinds of search for existence: by way of the different realms and by way of the different destinies.

original: tshangs par spyod pa tshol ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa tshol ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of search for pure conduct:

original: gzhan mu stegs can rnams kyi log pa dang chos 'di pa rnams kyi theg pa dman pas yang @163b dag pa nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can rnams kyi log pa dang chos 'di pa rnams kyi theg pa dman pas yang @163b dag pa nyid de /
translated: the pure conduct of the heterodox, and the pure conduct of the inferior vehicle of the Buddhists.

original: de la gnas pa'i sems can de dag dang mthun pa'i gnyen po la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i sems can de dag dang mthun pa'i gnyen po la dgod par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva should establish beings in the antidote that is appropriate for them.

original: de la lta ba ngan pa ni phyin ci log bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la lta ba ngan pa ni phyin ci log bzhi ste /
translated: Bad views are the four errors.

original: de dag las gnyis ni nges par sems pa las byung ba'i phyir blo gros mi nyams pas rab tu phye ba'o //
analyzed: de dag las gnyis ni nges par sems pa las byung ba'i phyir blo gros mi nyams pas rab tu phye ba'o //
translated: Two of them are distinguished by the absence of mental attention, because they are not necessarily derived from mental attention.

original: bdag dang gtsang bar 'du shes pa gnyis ni nges par sems pa med par yang 'byung ba'i phyir bsam pa mi mnyam pas rab tu phye ba ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gtsang bar 'du shes pa gnyis ni nges par sems pa med par yang 'byung ba'i phyir bsam pa mi mnyam pas rab tu phye ba ste /
translated: Two of them are distinguished by the absence of mental attention, because they occur even in the absence of mental attention.

original: de dag gi rgyu ni lam gol ba thibs por rgyu ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu ni lam gol ba thibs por rgyu ba nyid yin no //
translated: Their cause is the movement in the thicket of the wrong path.

original: lam gol ba ni nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: lam gol ba ni nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The wrong path is the defilements.

original: thibs po ni nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal yin te /
analyzed: thibs po ni nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal yin te /
translated: The thicket is the latent tendency of the defilements.

original: gang gi phyir 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: For this reason, it is said:

original: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni lta ba ngan par ltung ba blo gros mi mnyam zhing /
analyzed: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni lta ba ngan par ltung ba blo gros mi mnyam zhing /
translated: ‚ÄúAlas, these beings have fallen into bad views, their minds are not equal,

original: bsam pa mi mnyam pa /
analyzed: bsam pa mi mnyam pa /
translated: their thoughts are not equal,

original: lam gol ba'i thibs por rgyu ba yin gyis zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: lam gol ba'i thibs por rgyu ba yin gyis zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: they move in the thicket of the wrong path.‚Äù

original: de dag dang mthun pa'i gnyen po dam pa'i chos dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: de dag dang mthun pa'i gnyen po dam pa'i chos dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
translated: The antidote to those is the holy Dharma, proper mental attention, and the supramundane right view.

original: gang gi phyir de dag bdag gis ma nor ba'i lam dang / yang dag pa'i lam dang / ji lta ba na de bzhin nyid la dgod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag bdag gis ma nor ba'i lam dang / yang dag pa'i lam dang / ji lta ba na de bzhin nyid la dgod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, I should establish them in the unerring path, the right path, and suchness, just as it is.

original: thun mong ma yin pa yongs su spyod pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa yongs su spyod pa las brtsams te /
translated: The uncommon conduct is explained in the next two verses.

original: phan tshun regs mi 'phrod pa rnams kyi mi mthun pa ni dgrar byed pa'i sems dang / 'thab pa'i tshig dang gnyis kyis rab tu phye ba'o //
analyzed: phan tshun regs mi 'phrod pa rnams kyi mi mthun pa ni dgrar byed pa'i sems dang / 'thab pa'i tshig dang gnyis kyis rab tu phye ba'o //
translated: The discord of those who do not get along is distinguished by two things: the attitude of hostility and the words of conflict.

original: de ltar regs mi 'phrod pa ni gnod par bya ba mngon par 'du byed pas 'bar bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar regs mi 'phrod pa ni gnod par bya ba mngon par 'du byed pas 'bar bar byed pa ste /
translated: Thus, those who do not get along are inflamed by the performance of harm.

original: gang gi phyir kye ma sems can 'di ni regs mi 'phrod pa mi mthun par 'dzin cing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye ma sems can 'di ni regs mi 'phrod pa mi mthun par 'dzin cing /
translated: Therefore, Alas! This sentient being holds discord,

original: rtsod pa la zhugs pa rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pas 'bar bar gyur pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa la zhugs pa rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pas 'bar bar gyur pa yin zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: He is always and continuously burning with anger and resentment, because he is engaged in disputes.

original: dgrar byed pa nyid ni sems kyis byed de /
analyzed: dgrar byed pa nyid ni sems kyis byed de /
translated: The enemy is created by the mind.

original: mi mthun par 'dzin zhes bya ba'i tshig gis byed par ston to //
analyzed: mi mthun par 'dzin zhes bya ba'i tshig gis byed par ston to //
translated: The word ‚Äúhostility‚Äù shows that it is created.

original: 'thab pa ni rtsod pa la zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ston to //
analyzed: 'thab pa ni rtsod pa la zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ston to //
translated: The word ‚Äúengaged in disputes‚Äù shows that it is a quarrel.

original: gnod pa bya ba mngon par 'du byed pa ni khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ston to //
analyzed: gnod pa bya ba mngon par 'du byed pa ni khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ston to //
translated: The words ‚Äúanger and resentment‚Äù show that it is the creation of harm.

original: de dag dang mthun pa'i gnyen po ni byams pa chen po nye bar sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: de dag dang mthun pa'i gnyen po ni byams pa chen po nye bar sgrub pa ste /
translated: The antidote to that is the practice of great love.

original: gang gi phyir de dag bdag gis bla na med pa'i byams pa chen po nye bar sgrub pa la dgod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag bdag gis bla na med pa'i byams pa chen po nye bar sgrub pa la dgod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, I should establish them in the practice of unexcelled great love.

original: chog mi shes par yongs su spyod pa las brtsams te ngoms mi myong ba ni brnab sems te /
analyzed: chog mi shes par yongs su spyod pa las brtsams te ngoms mi myong ba ni brnab sems te /
translated: Covetousness is insatiable enjoyment, beginning with dissatisfaction.

original: sems kyis dang / @164a * //
analyzed: sems kyis dang / @164a * //
