translated: and by body, speech and mind.

original: rku ba dang / gzhal lugs la g-yo byed pa dang / brdzun smra ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: rku ba dang / gzhal lugs la g-yo byed pa dang / brdzun smra ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba ste /
translated: The preparation is the act of stealing, cheating on the scale, lying, etc.

original: lus dang ngag dang gnyis kyis rab tu phye ba yin te /üîΩgang gi phyir kye ma sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang gnyis kyis rab tu phye ba yin te / gang gi phyir kye ma sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: It is classified as being done by body, speech, or both.

original: ngoms mi myong zhing gzhan gyi nor la mngon par 'dod pa can yang ba'i 'tsho bas rjes su spyod pa yin gyis zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩde dag dang mthun pa'i gnyen po ni /
analyzed: ngoms mi myong zhing gzhan gyi nor la mngon par 'dod pa can yang ba'i 'tsho bas rjes su spyod pa yin gyis zhes gsungs pa'o // de dag dang mthun pa'i gnyen po ni /
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúAlas! These sentient beings are insatiable, and they live by the livelihood of desire for the wealth of others.‚Äù

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi mtha' yongs su dag pas 'tsho ba ste /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi mtha' yongs su dag pas 'tsho ba ste /
translated: The antidote that is in harmony with that is livelihood that is pure in terms of the actions of body, speech and mind.

original: gang gi phyir de dag bdag gis lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi mtha' yongs su dag pas 'tsho ba la dgod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag bdag gis lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi mtha' yongs su dag pas 'tsho ba la dgod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúI will establish them in the livelihood that is pure in terms of the actions of body, speech and mind.‚Äù

original: sogs 'jog byed pas yongs su spyod pa las brtsams te sogs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sogs 'jog byed pas yongs su spyod pa las brtsams te sogs pa'i tshe /
translated: The term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúthe actions of body, speech and mind‚Äù refers to the following.

original: de la mngon par chags pa dang / de'i dgra bo la zhe sdang ba dang / de la yon tan du 'dzin pas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gzhi'i nyes pa dang yongs su spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de la mngon par chags pa dang / de'i dgra bo la zhe sdang ba dang / de la yon tan du 'dzin pas 'dod chags la sogs pa'i gzhi'i nyes pa dang yongs su spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: Attachment to that, hostility toward its enemy, and grasping its qualities as good, are the faults of the basis of attachment, etc.üîΩWhen one indulges in them, the faults of being tormented by the afflictions through many avenues in regard to the object, and not seeking liberation because one does not see their disadvantages,

original: yul la nyon mongs pa'i sgo mang po nas rgyun mi 'chad par yongs su gdud pa'i nyes pa dang / de'i nyes dmigs ma mthong ba rnams nges par 'byung ba mi tshol ba'i nyes pa ste /
analyzed: yul la nyon mongs pa'i sgo mang po nas rgyun mi 'chad par yongs su gdud pa'i nyes pa dang / de'i nyes dmigs ma mthong ba rnams nges par 'byung ba mi tshol ba'i nyes pa ste /
translated: are the faults of not seeking liberation.

original: gang gi phyir kye ma sems can 'di dag ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi gzhi dang ldan pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye ma sems can 'di dag ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi gzhi dang ldan pa /
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúAlas! These sentient beings are the basis of attachment, hostility, and delusion,

original: nyon mongs pa sna tshogs kyi me lce rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par kun du 'bar bar gyur kyang de las nges par 'byung ba'i thabs yongs su mi tshol ba yin gyis zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa sna tshogs kyi me lce rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par kun du 'bar bar gyur kyang de las nges par 'byung ba'i thabs yongs su mi tshol ba yin gyis zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and although the flames of various afflictions are always blazing without interruption, they do not seek the means of liberation from them.‚Äù

original: de dag dang mthun pa'i gnyen po ni nyon mongs pa thams cad shin tu zhi ba la dgod pa ste /üîΩgang gi phyir de dag bdag gis nyon mongs pa thams cad rab tu zhi ba /
analyzed: de dag dang mthun pa'i gnyen po ni nyon mongs pa thams cad shin tu zhi ba la dgod pa ste / gang gi phyir de dag bdag gis nyon mongs pa thams cad rab tu zhi ba /
translated: The antidote that is in accordance with them is the establishment of all afflictions in complete peace.

original: 'tshe ba med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la dgod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'tshe ba med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la dgod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because of that, one should establish them in the nirvana that is the complete peace of all afflictions and the absence of harm.

original: tshe 'di la kun du tshol ba'i nyes par spyad pa la zhugs pa rnams kyi nyes pa ni /
analyzed: tshe 'di la kun du tshol ba'i nyes par spyad pa la zhugs pa rnams kyi nyes pa ni /
translated: The fault of those who engage in the misdeed of searching for this life is that

original: log pa la bde bar mthong ba dang / tshe rabs gzhan gyi nyes dmigs yod yang dag pa mi mthong ba dang / tshe 'di'i nyes dmigs yod yang dag pa shin tu mi mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: log pa la bde bar mthong ba dang / tshe rabs gzhan gyi nyes dmigs yod yang dag pa mi mthong ba dang / tshe 'di'i nyes dmigs yod yang dag pa shin tu mi mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: they see what is wrong as happiness, they do not see the faults of other lives, and they do not see the faults of this life.

original: gti mug gi mun pa'i rab rib dang / ling tog dang mun nag tu gyur pas bsgribs pa ste /
analyzed: gti mug gi mun pa'i rab rib dang / ling tog dang mun nag tu gyur pas bsgribs pa ste /
translated: They are obscured by the darkness of delusion, the cataracts and darkness of delusion.

original: gang gi phyir kye ma sems can 'di dag ni gti mug gi mun pa'i rab rib dang / ling tog dang mun nag gis bsgribs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye ma sems can 'di dag ni gti mug gi mun pa'i rab rib dang / ling tog dang mun nag gis bsgribs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: For what reason? Alas! These sentient beings are obscured by the cataract of the darkness of delusion, by the film of delusion, by the darkness of delusion.

original: de la log pa la bde bar @164b mthong bas gang gi phyir gti mug gi mun pa'i rab rib ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la log pa la bde bar @164b mthong bas gang gi phyir gti mug gi mun pa'i rab rib ces bya'o //
translated: There, it is called the cataract of the darkness of delusion because of seeing what is not happiness as happiness.

original: tshe rabs gzhan gyi nyes dmigs yod yang dag pa mi mthong bas ling tog ces bya'o //
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan gyi nyes dmigs yod yang dag pa mi mthong bas ling tog ces bya'o //
translated: It is called the film of delusion because of not seeing the faults of other lives.

original: tshe 'di'i nyes dmigs yod yang dag pa shin tu mi mthong bas mun nag ces bya'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di'i nyes dmigs yod yang dag pa shin tu mi mthong bas mun nag ces bya'o //
translated: It is called the darkness of delusion because of not seeing the faults of this life.

original: gti mug de'i rgyu bag la nyal brtas par gyur pa dang / de'i tshogs legs par spyad pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la zhugs pas zag pa med pa'i shes rab las ring du gyur pa yang nyes pa ste /
analyzed: gti mug de'i rgyu bag la nyal brtas par gyur pa dang / de'i tshogs legs par spyad pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la zhugs pas zag pa med pa'i shes rab las ring du gyur pa yang nyes pa ste /
translated: The fault of the increase of the latent states that are the cause of that delusion and the distance from uncontaminated wisdom through engaging in the accumulation of that which is incompatible with the practice of virtue is also a fault.

original: gang gi phyir mun nag gi thibs po chen por zhugs pa shes rab kyi snang ba dang ring du gyur pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mun nag gi thibs po chen por zhugs pa shes rab kyi snang ba dang ring du gyur pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: For what reason? They have entered the great darkness and are far from the light of wisdom.

original: thibs po zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gti mug gi rgyu bag la nyal la bya'o //
analyzed: thibs po zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gti mug gi rgyu bag la nyal la bya'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúthicket‚Äù should be understood as the latent cause of delusion.

original: de'i brtas pa ni chen po zhes bya ba'i sgras yongs su ston to //
analyzed: de'i brtas pa ni chen po zhes bya ba'i sgras yongs su ston to //
translated: Its growth is indicated by the term ‚Äúgreat.

original: gnod pa chen po'i gnas ngan song du 'gro ba yang nyes pa ste /
analyzed: gnod pa chen po'i gnas ngan song du 'gro ba yang nyes pa ste /
translated: ‚Äù The great harm is the going to the miserable realms.

original: gang gi phyir mun pa nag po'i nang na 'thoms pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mun pa nag po'i nang na 'thoms pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is indicated by the phrase ‚Äúin the darkness of night.

original: de la gnod pa ni mun nag gi sgras yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: de la gnod pa ni mun nag gi sgras yongs su bstan te /
translated: ‚Äù The harm is indicated by the word ‚Äúdarkness.

original: mun nag gi nang na gang du rgyu ba der gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mun nag gi nang na gang du rgyu ba der gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: ‚Äù Wherever one goes in the darkness, there is harm.

original: de dang chos mthun pas ngan song rnams ni gnod pa chen po'i gnas su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de dang chos mthun pas ngan song rnams ni gnod pa chen po'i gnas su gyur pa'o //
translated: The miserable realms are like that, because they are the place of great harm.

original: der 'gro ba ni 'thoms pa zhes bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: der 'gro ba ni 'thoms pa zhes bya ba bstan to //
translated: The going there is indicated by the phrase ‚Äúin the darkness of night.üîΩ‚Äù The harm of remorse is indicated by the phrase ‚Äúhaving done evil.

original: sdig pa byas pa'i mtshan ma mthong bas /
analyzed: sdig pa byas pa'i mtshan ma mthong bas /
translated: ‚Äù Having seen the signs of evil deeds,

original: 'gyod pa dang bcas pa'i mthong bas 'chi ba yang nyes pa ste /
analyzed: 'gyod pa dang bcas pa'i mthong bas 'chi ba yang nyes pa ste /
translated: one dies with remorse.

original: gang gi phyir yang ba mthong bar zhugs pa yin gyis zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang ba mthong bar zhugs pa yin gyis zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is indicated by the phrase ‚Äúhaving seen the light.üîΩ‚Äù

original: sngon sdig pa byas pa'i mtshan ma mthong ba dang / gnyen po yang dag par ma bsgrubs pa'i phyir 'gyod pa'i lta ba ni yang ba mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: sngon sdig pa byas pa'i mtshan ma mthong ba dang / gnyen po yang dag par ma bsgrubs pa'i phyir 'gyod pa'i lta ba ni yang ba mthong ba yin no //
translated: The view of regret is the view of the light of those who have seen the signs of former sins and have not fully accomplished the antidote.

original: zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i dus na'o //
analyzed: zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni 'chi ba'i dus na'o //
translated: The entrance is the time of death.

original: de dag dang mthun pa po ni sgrib pa med pa'i shes rab kyi mig yongs su sbyang ba ste /
analyzed: de dag dang mthun pa po ni sgrib pa med pa'i shes rab kyi mig yongs su sbyang ba ste /
translated: The similar is the purification of the eye of unobstructed wisdom.

original: de dag bdag gis ci nas kyang chos thams cad kyi ji lta ba de bzhin nyid gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa thob par 'gyur bar shes rab kyi mig sgrib pa med pa rnam par sbyang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag bdag gis ci nas kyang chos thams cad kyi ji lta ba de bzhin nyid gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa thob par 'gyur bar shes rab kyi mig sgrib pa med pa rnam par sbyang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: One should purify the eye of wisdom free from obstruction, thinking, In whatever way I may attain the suchness of all dharmas without depending on others.

original: tshe rabs gzhan kun du tshol ba na legs par spyad pa la zhugs pa rnams kyi nyes pa ni lam ya nga bar zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan kun du tshol ba na legs par spyad pa la zhugs pa rnams kyi nyes pa ni lam ya nga bar zhugs pa yin te /
translated: When seeking in other lives, the fault of those who have entered good conduct is entering the dangerous path.

original: gang gi phyir kye ma sems can 'di dag ni 'khor ba'i lam yang bar zhugs pa zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye ma sems can 'di dag ni 'khor ba'i lam yang bar zhugs pa zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: For it is said, Alas, these beings have entered the dangerous path of cyclic existence.

original: lam ya nga ba de ni rang bzhin dang / gegs dang / chud za bar bstan par rig par bya'o //üîΩrang bzhin ni phongs pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: lam ya nga ba de ni rang bzhin dang / gegs dang / chud za bar bstan par rig par bya'o // rang bzhin ni phongs pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i phyir 'khor ba'o //
translated: The path should be understood as being taught in terms of its nature, its obstacles, and its waste.

original: de la nges @165a * //
analyzed: de la nges @165a * //
translated: The nature of cyclic existence is samsara, because it is the basis of misfortune.

original: par 'byung ba'i gegs ni rnam pa brgyad do //
analyzed: par 'byung ba'i gegs ni rnam pa brgyad do //
translated: The obstacles to liberation are of eight kinds.

original: ngan song dang mthun pa'i phyir g-yang sa la mngon du phyogs pa ste /
analyzed: ngan song dang mthun pa'i phyir g-yang sa la mngon du phyogs pa ste /
translated: It is like a precipice, because it is consistent with the lower realms.

original: gang gi phyir sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi g-yang sa la mngon du phyogs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩ'bras bu sdug bsngal ba bde bar lta ba la gnas pas rgya'i nang du zhugs pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi g-yang sa la mngon du phyogs pa zhes gsungs pa'o // 'bras bu sdug bsngal ba bde bar lta ba la gnas pas rgya'i nang du zhugs pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: It is like a precipice of the hells, the animal world, and the world of Yama.

original: lta ba ngan pa'i rgya nyam nga bar zhugs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba ngan pa'i rgya nyam nga bar zhugs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is like being caught in a trap, because one is caught in the trap of bad views, since one is caught in the trap of bad views.

original: de'i rgyu gti mug gi bag la nyal gyis khebs pa'i phyir thibs po'i kun nas yogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu gti mug gi bag la nyal gyis khebs pa'i phyir thibs po'i kun nas yogs pa'o //
translated: It is like a thicket, because it is covered by the latent tendencies of delusion, which are the cause of that.

original: des na brjod du zin kyang sdug bsngal de khong du mi chud pa ste /
analyzed: des na brjod du zin kyang sdug bsngal de khong du mi chud pa ste /
translated: Therefore, even though they have heard it, they do not understand that suffering.

original: gang gi phyir gti mug thibs pos kun nas yogs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gti mug thibs pos kun nas yogs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because they are completely covered by the darkness of delusion.

original: don dam pa'i bde ba la lam log par zhugs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bde ba la lam log par zhugs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they have entered the wrong path to ultimate happiness.

original: log pa'i lam du zhugs pa ni gang gi phyir lam log par gol ba'i lam du zhugs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: log pa'i lam du zhugs pa ni gang gi phyir lam log par gol ba'i lam du zhugs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: They have entered the wrong path because they have entered a path that is a deviation from the right path.

original: thob pa'i 'bras bu yongs su spyod pa la 'dod chags kyis ldongs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thob pa'i 'bras bu yongs su spyod pa la 'dod chags kyis ldongs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are blinded by attachment to the enjoyment of the results they have obtained.

original: ldongs par gyur pa ni gang gi phyir ldongs par gyur pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ldongs par gyur pa ni gang gi phyir ldongs par gyur pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: They are blinded because they are blinded by attachment to the enjoyment of the results they have obtained.

original: mi khom par skyes pa dang / bag med pa'i nyes pa gnyis kyis sangs rgyas 'byung ba mnyes par mi byed pas ston pa dang bral ba ni gang gi phyir yongs su 'dren pa med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mi khom par skyes pa dang / bag med pa'i nyes pa gnyis kyis sangs rgyas 'byung ba mnyes par mi byed pas ston pa dang bral ba ni gang gi phyir yongs su 'dren pa med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because they do not please the appearance of the Buddha by being born in a place without opportunity and by the fault of heedlessness, they are without a teacher.

original: bram ze la sogs pa tshangs pa'i 'jig rten la sogs pa la nges par 'byung bar lta bas /
analyzed: bram ze la sogs pa tshangs pa'i 'jig rten la sogs pa la nges par 'byung bar lta bas /
translated: The Brahmins, etc., view the world of Brahma, etc., as a refuge.

original: gang du 'gro bar bsams pa de las de'i blo gzhan du gyur pa ni nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa la /
analyzed: gang du 'gro bar bsams pa de las de'i blo gzhan du gyur pa ni nges par 'byung ba ma yin pa la /
translated: But the mind of one who has gone elsewhere than the place he intended to go to is not a refuge.

original: nges par 'byung bar lta ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung bar lta ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is what is meant by the statement: ‚Äúviewing what is not a refuge as a refuge.‚Äù

original: bdud kyi yul 'dod pa la kun du chags pa ni bsod nams zad pa dang / mi sogs pa gnyis kyis bcom pa'i phyir chom pos zin pa ni gang gi phyir bdud kyi lam gyi chom pos zin pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi yul 'dod pa la kun du chags pa ni bsod nams zad pa dang / mi sogs pa gnyis kyis bcom pa'i phyir chom pos zin pa ni gang gi phyir bdud kyi lam gyi chom pos zin pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The realm of Mara is the attachment to sense-objects. It is said that one is seized by the thief of Mara because one is destroyed by the two: the exhaustion of merit and the non-acquisition of merit.

original: chud za ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /üîΩsa ngan pa la gnas pa'i phyir ston pa mkhas pa med pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: chud za ba ni rnam pa gsum ste / sa ngan pa la gnas pa'i phyir ston pa mkhas pa med pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: There are three kinds of loss:

original: yongs su 'dren pa mkhas pa dang bral ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'dren pa mkhas pa dang bral ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The loss of a good teacher is because one remains in a bad place. This is what is meant by the statement: ‚Äúdeprived of a wise guide.‚Äù

original: dgra'i sa na gnas pa ni gang gi phyir bdud kyi bsam pa'i thibs por zhugs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dgra'i sa na gnas pa ni gang gi phyir bdud kyi bsam pa'i thibs por zhugs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The loss of a good friend is because one remains in the realm of enemies. This is what is meant by the statement: ‚Äúentering the thickets of Mara‚Äôs thoughts.‚Äù

original: zun gyi sa las ring du gyur pa ni gang gi phyir sangs rgyas la bsams pa las ring du gyur ba yin gyis zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zun gyi sa las ring du gyur pa ni gang gi phyir sangs rgyas la bsams pa las ring du gyur ba yin gyis zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The far shore of the ocean of samsara is the state of buddhahood, and the bodhisattva is far from that, as he says, I am far from the thought of buddhahood.üîΩ The antidote that is in accord with that is the deliverance from samsara and the establishment in omniscience.

original: de dag dang mthun pa'i gnyen po ni 'khor ba las bsgral ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid @165b la dgod pa ste gang gi phyir de dag bdag gis rnam pa de lta bu'i 'khor ba'i nags khung ya nga ba bgrod par dka' ba las bsgral bar bya /
analyzed: de dag dang mthun pa'i gnyen po ni 'khor ba las bsgral ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid @165b la dgod pa ste gang gi phyir de dag bdag gis rnam pa de lta bu'i 'khor ba'i nags khung ya nga ba bgrod par dka' ba las bsgral bar bya /
translated: He says, Therefore, I must deliver them from the jungle of samsara, which is so terrifying and difficult to traverse.

original: 'jigs pa med pa'i gnas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi grong khyer chen por dgod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa med pa'i gnas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi grong khyer chen por dgod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: And, I must establish them in the city of omniscience, which is a place of fearlessness.

original: 'gro ba'i sgo nas srid pa tshol ba ni klung chen por bying ba nyid kyi nyes pa ste gang gi phyir kye ma sems can 'di dag ni klung rlabs chen po'i nang du bying ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i sgo nas srid pa tshol ba ni klung chen por bying ba nyid kyi nyes pa ste gang gi phyir kye ma sems can 'di dag ni klung rlabs chen po'i nang du bying ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The fault of being submerged in the great river is the seeking of existence through rebirth, as he says, Alas, these beings are submerged in the great river.

original: de ni rang bzhin dang / gnod pa 'byung bar byed pa dang / chud za bas bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin dang / gnod pa 'byung bar byed pa dang / chud za bas bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: It is taught by way of its nature, its harmfulness, and its loss.

original: de la rnam pa lngas rang bzhin bstan te /
analyzed: de la rnam pa lngas rang bzhin bstan te /
translated: Its nature is taught in five ways:

original: chu bo'i klung che ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chu bo'i klung che ba'i phyir /
translated: It is a great river,

original: zab pa ni gang gi phyir 'dod pa dang / srid pa dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba'i chu bor zhugs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩ'khor ba'i rgyun gyis rjes su bdas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zab pa ni gang gi phyir 'dod pa dang / srid pa dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba'i chu bor zhugs pa zhes gsungs pa'o // 'khor ba'i rgyun gyis rjes su bdas pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is said to be ‚Äúengrossed in the rivers of desire, becoming, ignorance, and views.‚ÄùüîΩIt is a flood,

original: bdas pa ni gang gi phyir 'khor ba'i rgyun gyis bdas pa zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩsred pa zhes bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bdas pa ni gang gi phyir 'khor ba'i rgyun gyis bdas pa zhes gsungs pa'o // sred pa zhes bya ba'i phyir /
translated: because it is said to be ‚Äúswept away by the current of cyclic existence.‚ÄùüîΩIt is a name,

original: ming ni gang gi phyir sred pa'i chu klung du zhugs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩskad cig tsam yang mi sdod pa dang / 'gram blta bar mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ming ni gang gi phyir sred pa'i chu klung du zhugs pa zhes gsungs pa'o // skad cig tsam yang mi sdod pa dang / 'gram blta bar mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is said to be ‚Äúengrossed in the river of craving.‚ÄùüîΩIt is a strong current,üîΩbecause it is said to be ‚Äúswept away by a strong current and powerless to view the near shore.‚ÄùüîΩIt is a swift current,

original: shugs drag pa ni gang gi phyir shugs drag pos bdas te lta ba'i mthu med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: shugs drag pa ni gang gi phyir shugs drag pos bdas te lta ba'i mthu med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: because it is said to be ‚Äúswift and unable to remain even for a moment.‚Äù

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa mang po'i rjes su 'gro bas rgyas pa nyid ni gang gi phyir 'dod pa dang / gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa mang po'i rjes su rgyu ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa mang po'i rjes su 'gro bas rgyas pa nyid ni gang gi phyir 'dod pa dang / gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa mang po'i rjes su rgyu ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is expanded by the many discursive thoughts of desire, etc., because it is said, ‚Äúit is the movement of the many discursive thoughts of desire, hatred, and violence.‚Äù

original: gnod pa 'byung bar byed pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /üîΩngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa gnyis kyis khyim gyi gnas las mi 'phags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnod pa 'byung bar byed pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste / ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa gnyis kyis khyim gyi gnas las mi 'phags pa'i phyir /
translated: The four kinds of harm are:

original: chu srin gyis zin pa ni gang gi phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i chu'i srin pos zin pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: chu srin gyis zin pa ni gang gi phyir 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i chu'i srin pos zin pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: 1) the harm of the cause of birth, because it is said, ‚Äúit is the cause of birth in the miserable states of existence‚Äù;

original: bor nas kyang 'dod pa rjes su dran pas 'dod pa rnams su skor ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bor nas kyang 'dod pa rjes su dran pas 'dod pa rnams su skor ba'i phyir /
translated: 2) the harm of the object, because it is said, ‚Äúit is the object of the many discursive thoughts of desire, hatred, and violence‚Äù;üîΩ3) the harm of the seizure, because it is said, ‚Äúit is seized by the sea-monster of the view of individuality‚Äù;

original: klong du chud pa ni gang gi phyir 'dod pa'i thibs po'i klong du zhugs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: klong du chud pa ni gang gi phyir 'dod pa'i thibs po'i klong du zhugs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: 4) the harm of the fall, because it is said, ‚Äúit is the fall into the abyss of the thicket of craving.‚Äù

original: yongs su spyod pa'i dus na dga' ba can dang / 'dod chags kyis bde ba'i 'dam du thogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yongs su spyod pa'i dus na dga' ba can dang / 'dod chags kyis bde ba'i 'dam du thogs pa'i phyir /
translated: At the time of enjoyment, they are like those who are attached, because they are stuck in the mud of pleasure and passion.

original: dkyil du thogs pa ni gang gi phyir dga' ba can dang / 'dod chags kyi dkyil du kun du thogs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil du thogs pa ni gang gi phyir dga' ba can dang / 'dod chags kyi dkyil du kun du thogs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: They are stuck in the middle, because they are stuck in the middle of pleasure and passion.

original: tha snyad kyi dus na nga drag go snyam pa la sogs pa nga rgyal rnam pa gsum gyis khengs par gyur pa'i phyir /üîΩgling gi thang la thon pa ni gang gi @166a * //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi dus na nga drag go snyam pa la sogs pa nga rgyal rnam pa gsum gyis khengs par gyur pa'i phyir / gling gi thang la thon pa ni gang gi @166a * //
translated: At the time of convention, they are like those who are puffed up by the three kinds of pride, thinking ‚ÄúI am great,‚Äù etc.

original: phyir nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi thang la 'thon pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: phyir nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal gyi thang la 'thon pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: They are like those who have come out onto the plain of pride, because they have come out onto the plain of pride, thinking ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

original: chud za ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: chud za ba yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of loss:

original: ngan song rnams na skyabs med pa'i phyir 'chi bas chud za ba ni gang gi phyir dpung gnyen med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ngan song rnams na skyabs med pa'i phyir 'chi bas chud za ba ni gang gi phyir dpung gnyen med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Loss through death, because there is no refuge in the miserable realms, as is said: ‚Äúwithout a protector.‚Äù

original: bde 'gror mi 'phags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bde 'gror mi 'phags pa'i phyir /
translated: Loss through not being exalted in the happy realms, because one is not exalted in the happy realms, as is said: ‚Äúwithout a friend.‚Äù

original: mi 'gro bas chud za ba ni gang gi phyir skye mched kyi grong nas ma 'phags pa zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩmi khom par skyes te sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi 'gro bas chud za ba ni gang gi phyir skye mched kyi grong nas ma 'phags pa zhes gsungs pa'o // mi khom par skyes te sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: The waste of not going is referred to by the statement, because they have not departed from the city of the sense-faculties.

original: gzhan du 'gro bas chud za ba ni gang gi phyir sgrol ba mkhas pa dang bral ba yin gyi zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gro bas chud za ba ni gang gi phyir sgrol ba mkhas pa dang bral ba yin gyi zhes gsungs pa'o //
