original: de la 'dod chags dang bral bar sbyor ba 'byung par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang bral bar sbyor ba 'byung par byed pa ni /
translated: The origination of the application to freedom from passion is

original: sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa bcu pa dag go //
analyzed: sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa bcu pa dag go //
translated: the ten mental orientations.

original: 'dod chags dang 'bral bar sbyor ba ni bsam gtan bsgrubs te gnas par ma gyur gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang 'bral bar sbyor ba ni bsam gtan bsgrubs te gnas par ma gyur gyi bar du'o //
translated: The application to freedom from passion is the attainment of the meditative concentration, but not the abiding in it.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms bar 'jug pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms bar 'jug pa rnams so //
translated: Freedom from passion is the meditative concentrations and the formless absorptions.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'bras bu ni tshad med pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'bras bu ni tshad med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The result of freedom from passion is the immeasurables, etc.

original: de la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems kyi bsam pa ni dag pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems kyi bsam pa ni dag pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The mental orientation of freedom from passion is to be known as the pure mental orientation.

original: de'i rgyu yid la byed pa ni dag pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa ste ;
analyzed: de'i rgyu yid la byed pa ni dag pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa ste ;
translated: The cause of that is the attention of the intention of pure mind.

original: gang gi phyir gyi rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa gnyis pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa shin tu yongs su sbyangs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum pa gnon te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gyi rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa gnyis pa la lhag pa'i bsam pa shin tu yongs su sbyangs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum pa gnon te /
translated: For what reason? The bodhisattva who has purified the superior intention on the second bodhisattva stage, that bodhisattva ascends to the third bodhisattva stage.

original: des sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa rnam pa bcus gnon to //
analyzed: des sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa rnam pa bcus gnon to //
translated: He ascends by means of the ten kinds of attention of the intention of pure mind.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta @168a * //
analyzed: 'di lta @168a * //
translated: They are as follows:

original: ste dag pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ste dag pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The attention of the intention of pure mind.

original: dag pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yongs su mi nyams pa de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: dag pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yongs su mi nyams pa de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas gnyis pa ste /
translated: In terms of that very non-degeneration of the intention of pure mind, there is a second:

original: gang gi phyir brtan pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir brtan pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The attention of the intention of stable mind.

original: thob par bya ba'i thabs ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma 'ongs pa'i 'dod pa sun 'byin pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i 'dod pa la ma chags pa'i dbang du byas nas gsum pa dang bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i thabs ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma 'ongs pa'i 'dod pa sun 'byin pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i 'dod pa la ma chags pa'i dbang du byas nas gsum pa dang bzhi pa ste /
translated: The means of attaining it is the third and fourth, in terms of the future desire to eliminate its counteragents and the present desire to be unattached.

original: gang gi phyir skyo ba'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyo ba'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because it is said that one should keep in mind the attitude of a disenchanted mind and the attitude of a mind free from attachment.

original: rang gi theg pa mi 'dor ba'i dbang du byas nas lnga pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi theg pa mi 'dor ba'i dbang du byas nas lnga pa ste /
translated: The fifth is in terms of not abandoning one's own vehicle.

original: gang gi phyir phyir mi ldog pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyir mi ldog pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because it is said that one should keep in mind the attitude of an irreversible mind.

original: rang gi sa pa'i nyon mongs pas mi shigs pa'i dbang du byas nas drug pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi sa pa'i nyon mongs pas mi shigs pa'i dbang du byas nas drug pa ste /
translated: The sixth is in terms of being indestructible by afflictions of one's own level.

original: gang gi phyir sra ba'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sra ba'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because it is said that one should keep in mind the attitude of a firm mind.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa la dbang ba'i dbang du byas nas bdun pa ste /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa la dbang ba'i dbang du byas nas bdun pa ste /
translated: The seventh is in terms of mastery over meditative equipoise.

original: gang gi phyir sbyangs pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩ'og mar skye ba dang yongs su mi nyams pa gnyis kyis /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sbyangs pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa zhes gsungs pa'o // 'og mar skye ba dang yongs su mi nyams pa gnyis kyis /
translated: Because it is said to be the mental attention of the thought of a purified mind.

original: bsam gtan bzlog nus pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzlog nus pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas brgyad pa ste /
translated: The eighth is from the point of view of the ability to turn away from the absorptions by means of two factors: being born in lower realms and not degenerating.

original: gang gi phyir rang dbang gi sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang dbang gi sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because it is said to be the mental attention of the thought of an independent mind.

original: der skyes kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas dgu pa ste /
analyzed: der skyes kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas dgu pa ste /
translated: The ninth is from the point of view of being born there but being free of defilement.

original: gang gi phyir rlabs po che'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩsems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rlabs po che'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa zhes gsungs pa'o // sems can gyi don bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is said to be the mental attention of the thought of a vast mind.

original: srid pa'i rgyun gcod pa'i dbang du byas nas sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa bcu par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i rgyun gcod pa'i dbang du byas nas sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa bcu par rig par bya ste /
translated: The tenth mental attention should be known from the point of view of the activity for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: gang gi phyir che ba nyid ni sems kyi bsam pa la byed pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir che ba nyid ni sems kyi bsam pa la byed pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because it is said to be the mental attention of the thought of greatness.

original: 'dod chags dang bral bar sbyor ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bar sbyor ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of application to freedom from passion:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa las bsrung ba'i sbyor ba dang / theg pa dman pa las kun du bsrung ba'i sbyor ba dang / thabs yongs su bzung ba'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa las bsrung ba'i sbyor ba dang / theg pa dman pa las kun du bsrung ba'i sbyor ba dang / thabs yongs su bzung ba'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: application to protection from the addictions, application to protection from the Individual Vehicle, and application to the thorough understanding of means.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa las kun du bsrung ba'i sbyor ba ni 'du byed du gyur pa thams cad la mi rtag pa nyid dang / mngon du bstan par bya ba ma yin par bcu pa gnyis kyi yongs su brtag pa ste /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa las kun du bsrung ba'i sbyor ba ni 'du byed du gyur pa thams cad la mi rtag pa nyid dang / mngon du bstan par bya ba ma yin par bcu pa gnyis kyi yongs su brtag pa ste /
translated: Among them, application to protection from the addictions is the thorough investigation of all compounded things as impermanent and as not to be relied upon.

original: de la mdor na tshe'i 'du byed @168b mi gnas pa nyid yin pas mi rtag par yongs su rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la mdor na tshe'i 'du byed @168b mi gnas pa nyid yin pas mi rtag par yongs su rtogs pa ste /
translated: In brief, it is the thorough investigation of impermanence, because the conditioning of life is impermanent.

original: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de 'du byed du gyur pa thams cad la mi rtag par so sor rtog ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de 'du byed du gyur pa thams cad la mi rtag par so sor rtog ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú O sons of the victors, the bodhisattva who is on the third bodhisattva stage thoroughly investigates all compounded things as impermanent.‚Äù

original: de'i 'og tu mi rtag pa nyid de ji lta bu yin pa dang / gang yin pa de yongs su rtog ste mi rtag pa nyid de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mi rtag pa nyid de ji lta bu yin pa dang / gang yin pa de yongs su rtog ste mi rtag pa nyid de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is impermanence?

original: lus kyi gnas skabs 'gyur ba'i dbang gis sdug bsngal nyid rnam par gsum dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: lus kyi gnas skabs 'gyur ba'i dbang gis sdug bsngal nyid rnam par gsum dang ldan pa ste /
translated: It is the body‚Äôs condition of being subject to change, and it is associated with the three kinds of suffering.

original: gang gi phyir sdug bsngal ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sdug bsngal ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is why the S≈´tra says that it is suffering.

original: zas kyi sa gnas pa'i dbang gis mdog mi sdug pa la sogs par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: zas kyi sa gnas pa'i dbang gis mdog mi sdug pa la sogs par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: The body‚Äôs condition of being subject to change is also the reason why the body is ugly, etc.

original: gang gi phyir mi sdug pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi sdug pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is why the S≈´tra says that it is ugly.

original: mi mthun pa yongs su ma spangs pa'i dbang gis dus ma yin par 'chi ba ni /
analyzed: mi mthun pa yongs su ma spangs pa'i dbang gis dus ma yin par 'chi ba ni /
translated: The body‚Äôs condition of being subject to change is also the reason why death comes at the wrong time.

original: gang gi phyir yid brtan du mi rung ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yid brtan du mi rung ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is why the S≈´tra says that it is undependable.

original: snod rnams 'jig pa'i dbang gis 'jig pa ni gang gi phyir rnam par 'jig pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: snod rnams 'jig pa'i dbang gis 'jig pa ni gang gi phyir rnam par 'jig pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The body‚Äôs condition of being subject to change is also the reason why the body is destroyed at the time of the destruction of the world.üîΩThis is why the S≈´tra says that it is perishable.

original: longs spyod rnams kyi bdag po nges pa med pa'i dbang gis gcig dang mi gnas pa ni gang gi phyir ring du mi gnas pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rnams kyi bdag po nges pa med pa'i dbang gis gcig dang mi gnas pa ni gang gi phyir ring du mi gnas pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The master of enjoyments is uncertain, and because of that, they are not one and not stable. Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThey do not last long.‚Äù

original: mi rtag pa de gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa de gang zhe na /
translated: What is impermanence?

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis te myur ba'i dus ni gang gi phyir skye ba dang 'gag pa nyid skad cig pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis te myur ba'i dus ni gang gi phyir skye ba dang 'gag pa nyid skad cig pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is twofold: the time of swiftness, because of birth and cessation, it is said, ‚Äúmomentary.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin yongs su grub ba med de /
analyzed: rang bzhin yongs su grub ba med de /
translated: There is no inherent establishment.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus rnams su ma byung ba dang / mi 'pho ba dang / 'gag pa ni gang gi phyir sngon gyi mthar ma byung ba dang / phyi ma'i mthar 'pho ba med pa dang /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus rnams su ma byung ba dang / mi 'pho ba dang / 'gag pa ni gang gi phyir sngon gyi mthar ma byung ba dang / phyi ma'i mthar 'pho ba med pa dang /
translated: It is not arisen in the past, future, and present times, does not transfer, and ceases. Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúOne should discern that it does not arise in the beginning, does not transfer in the end,

original: da ltar byung ba la mi gnas par so sor rtog go zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba la mi gnas par so sor rtog go zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and does not remain in the present.‚Äù

original: de ltar 'du byed du gyur pa mi rtag pa la ci 'du byed du gyur pa la brten par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar 'du byed du gyur pa mi rtag pa la ci 'du byed du gyur pa la brten par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, in regard to impermanent formations, one should discern that formations are not to be relied upon.

original: mngon du rten du rung ba 'ga' zhig yod dam snyam na /
analyzed: mngon du rten du rung ba 'ga' zhig yod dam snyam na /
translated: If one thinks that there are some that are suitable to be relied upon as manifest,

original: thams cad mngon du bsten par bya ba ma yin par mthong ste /
analyzed: thams cad mngon du bsten par bya ba ma yin par mthong ste /
translated: one sees that all are not to be relied upon as manifest.

original: gang gi phyir de 'du byed du gyur ba de lta bu thams cad la yang dag par rtog pa'i cho mngon du bsten par bya ba ma yin pa zhes bcu pa gnyis pa las gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de 'du byed du gyur ba de lta bu thams cad la yang dag par rtog pa'i cho mngon du bsten par bya ba ma yin pa zhes bcu pa gnyis pa las gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because of that, it is said in the second chapter of the Ten that ‚Äúall such things that are conditioned are not to be relied upon as manifest.‚Äù

original: mngon du bsten par bya ba ma yin pa de yang rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mngon du bsten par bya ba ma yin pa de yang rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
translated: That which is not to be relied upon as manifest should be understood as having nine aspects.

original: mi rtag pa nyid du ma gyur pa ston pa ma yin pa ni gang gi phyir gsol 'dru'i gnas med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid du ma gyur pa ston pa ma yin pa ni gang gi phyir gsol 'dru'i gnas med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The non-manifestation of impermanence is that ‚Äúthere is no place of rest,‚Äù as it is said.

original: gyur pa ni dpung gnyen med pas de gyur pa'i @169a * //
analyzed: gyur pa ni dpung gnyen med pas de gyur pa'i @169a * //
translated: The manifest is that ‚Äúthere is no protector,‚Äù because of that.

original: phyir ; thog mar sdug bsngal bar gyur pas mya ngan dang bcas pa ni gang gi phyir mya ngan dang bcas pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: phyir ; thog mar sdug bsngal bar gyur pas mya ngan dang bcas pa ni gang gi phyir mya ngan dang bcas pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The initial suffering is that ‚Äúthere is sorrow,‚Äù because of that.

original: bar du smre ba dang bcas pa ni gang gi phyir smre sngags 'don pa dang bcas pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bar du smre ba dang bcas pa ni gang gi phyir smre sngags 'don pa dang bcas pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: In the middle, it is accompanied by lamentation, because of the lamenting.

original: chung bar gyur pa na 'khrug pa dang bcas pas dman pa tsam rjes su 'brang ba ni gang gi phyir 'khrug pa dang bcas pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: chung bar gyur pa na 'khrug pa dang bcas pas dman pa tsam rjes su 'brang ba ni gang gi phyir 'khrug pa dang bcas pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: In the end, it is accompanied by agitation, because of the mere following of the inferior.

original: longs spyod rnams yongs su tshol ba'i dus na bdag la sdug par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: longs spyod rnams yongs su tshol ba'i dus na bdag la sdug par 'gyur gyi /
translated: At the time of seeking enjoyments, one thinks, ‚ÄúMay I be happy,

original: mi sdug par mi 'gyur grang snyam du /
analyzed: mi sdug par mi 'gyur grang snyam du /
translated: may I not be unhappy.‚Äù

original: tsher ma rnams kyi sdug pa dang / mi sdug par 'brel pa ni gang gi phyir sdug pa dang mi sdug par 'brel pa zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩyongs su spyod pa'i dus na bde ba chung la sdug bsngal mang ba ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: tsher ma rnams kyi sdug pa dang / mi sdug par 'brel pa ni gang gi phyir sdug pa dang mi sdug par 'brel pa zhes gsungs pa'o // yongs su spyod pa'i dus na bde ba chung la sdug bsngal mang ba ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The connection with the pleasant and unpleasant of the thorns is because of the connection with the pleasant and unpleasant.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa mang po mang ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa mang po mang ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: At the time of enjoyment, there is little happiness and much suffering, because of the much suffering, unhappiness, and agitation.

original: lus rgas pa'i gnas skabs na byis pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs snga ma gnas pa ni gang gi phyir bsags pa med par gyur pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: lus rgas pa'i gnas skabs na byis pa la sogs pa'i gnas skabs snga ma gnas pa ni gang gi phyir bsags pa med par gyur pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: When the body is in the stage of old age, the previous stages of childhood and so on are not present, and so it is said, ‚Äúwithout any accumulation.‚Äù

original: lang tsho la bab pa'i gnas skabs na tshor ba rnam pa gsum dang ldan pas /
analyzed: lang tsho la bab pa'i gnas skabs na tshor ba rnam pa gsum dang ldan pas /
translated: When the body is in the stage of youth, the three kinds of feelings

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i me rab tu 'bar ba ni gang gi phyir 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi me rab tu 'bar ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i me rab tu 'bar ba ni gang gi phyir 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi me rab tu 'bar ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: are present, and so it is said, ‚Äúthe fire of passion is burning,‚Äù because of the presence of the fires of passion, aversion, and delusion.

original: ches 'gras kyi gnas skabs na nad du ma rnam par 'phel ba ni gang gi phyir nad du ma rnam par 'phel ba'i lus mthong nas zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ches 'gras kyi gnas skabs na nad du ma rnam par 'phel ba ni gang gi phyir nad du ma rnam par 'phel ba'i lus mthong nas zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: When the body is in the stage of old age, many diseases increase, and so it is said, ‚Äúseeing the body with many diseases increasing.‚Äù

original: lus ni 'das ma thag pa'i tshig gsum char dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: lus ni 'das ma thag pa'i tshig gsum char dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúbody‚Äù should be supplied with each of the three phrases.

original: thog mnar ma smos pa ni lus de yang dang yang bstan par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thog mnar ma smos pa ni lus de yang dang yang bstan par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The first stage is not mentioned because the body is repeatedly referred to.

original: de la theg pa dman pa las kun du bsrung ba'i sbyor ba ni 'du byed du gyur pa las sems bskyod nas /
analyzed: de la theg pa dman pa las kun du bsrung ba'i sbyor ba ni 'du byed du gyur pa las sems bskyod nas /
translated: The application of guarding against the Lesser Vehicle is the generation of the mind that moves from conditioned states.

original: che ba nyid rnam pa gnyis kun du bstan pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la yang dag par gtong ba dang / sems can rnams la sems kyi bsam pa bcu nye bar 'jog pa dang / de dag yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pa ste /üîΩ'dis ni gang la brten nas gang gi phyir /
analyzed: che ba nyid rnam pa gnyis kun du bstan pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la yang dag par gtong ba dang / sems can rnams la sems kyi bsam pa bcu nye bar 'jog pa dang / de dag yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom pa ste / 'dis ni gang la brten nas gang gi phyir /
translated: The greatness is twofold: the correct orientation toward the wisdom of the Tathagata and the correct orientation toward sentient beings.

original: ji ltar rab tu sbyor bar byed pa de yongs su bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar rab tu sbyor bar byed pa de yongs su bstan pa yin te /
translated: This shows what it is based on, what it is for, and how it is applied.

original: gang gi phyir de 'du byed du gyur pa thams cad las de bas kyang shas cher sems bskyod cing de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la yang dag par gtong ngo zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de 'du byed du gyur pa thams cad las de bas kyang shas cher sems bskyod cing de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la yang dag par gtong ngo zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is said that the correct orientation toward the wisdom of the Tathagata is the generation of the mind that moves from conditioned states, and that it is the correct orientation toward sentient beings.

original: de @169b bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi che ba nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de @169b bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi che ba nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The greatness of the wisdom of the Tathagata is twofold:

original: yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa che ba nyid dang / rnam par dag pa che ba nyid do //
analyzed: yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa che ba nyid dang / rnam par dag pa che ba nyid do //
translated: the greatness of the possession of good qualities, and the greatness of purification.

original: yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa yang rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa yang rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: The possession of good qualities should be understood as fivefold:

original: brtag mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brtag mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: because it cannot be conceived,

original: mthu'i yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa ni gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid du yang dag par mthong ste zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mthu'i yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa ni gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid du yang dag par mthong ste zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: the possession of the good quality of power, because it is seen that the wisdom of the Tathagata is inconceivable.

original: zla med pa'i phyir mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa ni gang gi phyir mtshungs pa med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //üîΩsems can dpag tu med pa'i don bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zla med pa'i phyir mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa ni gang gi phyir mtshungs pa med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o // sems can dpag tu med pa'i don bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The possession of the good quality of complete enlightenment, because it is said to be incomparable.

original: don chen po'i yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa ni gang gi phyir dpag tu med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: don chen po'i yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa ni gang gi phyir dpag tu med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: The possession of the good quality of great meaning, because it is for the sake of immeasurable beings.üîΩThe possession of the good quality of inexhaustibility, because it is said to be inexhaustible.

original: dkon pa'i phyir tshad gzung du med pa'i yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa ni gang gi phyir rnyed dka' ba nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dkon pa'i phyir tshad gzung du med pa'i yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa ni gang gi phyir rnyed dka' ba nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is the possession of qualities that are beyond measure because they are rare.

original: mu stegs can dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa ni gang gi phyir ma 'dres pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa'i yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa ni gang gi phyir ma 'dres pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is the possession of uncommon qualities because it is not mixed with the heterodox.

original: rnam par dag pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal dang bral ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal dang bral ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that purification is the attainment of nirvana, which is the freedom from the afflictions and from suffering.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bral ba ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang ma 'dres par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bral ba ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang ma 'dres par rig par bya ste /
translated: Freedom from the afflictions is the absence of the afflictions together with their traces.

original: gang gi phyir gnod pa med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnod pa med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is the absence of harm.

original: sdug bsngal dang bral ba ni sdug bsngal dang / de'i gzhi las byung ba mya ngan zad pa rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bral ba ni sdug bsngal dang / de'i gzhi las byung ba mya ngan zad pa rig par bya ste /
translated: Freedom from suffering is the exhaustion of sorrow, which arises from suffering and its basis.

original: gang gi phyir 'khrug pa med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'khrug pa med pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: It is the absence of disturbance.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i 'jigs pa thams cad med par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i 'jigs pa thams cad med par rig par bya ste /
translated: The attainment of nirvana should be understood as the absence of all the fears of the passions and the secondary passions.

original: gang gi phyir 'jigs pa med pa'i grong khyer du 'gro ba nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jigs pa med pa'i grong khyer du 'gro ba nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: For it is said, It is the very going to the city of fearlessness.

original: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i phyir 'ong ba med pa dang / sems can gyi don byed pa gnyis kyis 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa la khyad par du 'phags par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang byang chub sems dpa'i phyir 'ong ba med pa dang / sems can gyi don byed pa gnyis kyis 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa la khyad par du 'phags par rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, it should be understood that the bodhisattva's attainment of mundane and supramundane nirvana is superior by reason of his non-returning and his performance of benefit for sentient beings.

original: gang gi phyir phyir mi ldog pa nyid dang skye bo mang po yongs su skyob pa nyid du yang dag par mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyir mi ldog pa nyid dang skye bo mang po yongs su skyob pa nyid du yang dag par mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: For it is said, He is seen to be irreversible and a protector of the multitude.

original: sems kyi bsam pa bcu ni sems can mgon med pa rnams las brtsams pa ste /
analyzed: sems kyi bsam pa bcu ni sems can mgon med pa rnams las brtsams pa ste /
translated: The ten mental contemplations begin with the helpless sentient beings.

original: des de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes de ltar tshang ba yang dag par mthong ste /
analyzed: des de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes de ltar tshang ba yang dag par mthong ste /
translated: He sees the Tathagata's wisdom as complete in that way.

original: 'du byed du gyur pa de ltar gnod pa mang po dang ldan par yongs su rtog pa na sems can rnams la de @170a * //
analyzed: 'du byed du gyur pa de ltar gnod pa mang po dang ldan par yongs su rtog pa na sems can rnams la de @170a * //
translated: When they fully understand that conditioned states are thus replete with many kinds of harm, they generate compassion for sentient beings.

original: bas kyang shas cher sems kyi bsam pa bcu nye bar 'jog ste /
analyzed: bas kyang shas cher sems kyi bsam pa bcu nye bar 'jog ste /
translated: When he thoroughly understands that conditioned states are thus full of many kinds of injury, he establishes the ten kinds of mental attitudes toward sentient beings even more strongly than before.üîΩWhat are the ten?

original: bcu gang zhe na /'di lta ste /üîΩmgon med cing rton pa med pa'i sems kyi bsam pa nyid ces rgya cher gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /'di lta ste / mgon med cing rton pa med pa'i sems kyi bsam pa nyid ces rgya cher gsungs pa'o //
translated: They are the mental attitudes of:üîΩno protector, no refuge, no haven, no friend, no kinsman, no relative, no companion, no companion in life, no companion in death, and no companion in the interval between life and death.

original: de la rton pa med pa nyid ni mgon med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la rton pa med pa nyid ni mgon med pa nyid do //
translated: The absence of a refuge is the same as the absence of a protector.

original: de yang rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa dgur rig par bya ste /
translated: That is understood in nine ways:

original: rtag tu dbul te mgon med pa nyid dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug gi me rab tu 'bar te mgon med pa nyid dang / srid pa'i btson rar chud de mgon med pa nyid dang / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par nyon mongs pa thibs pos bsgribs te mgon med pa nyid dang /
analyzed: rtag tu dbul te mgon med pa nyid dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug gi me rab tu 'bar te mgon med pa nyid dang / srid pa'i btson rar chud de mgon med pa nyid dang / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par nyon mongs pa thibs pos bsgribs te mgon med pa nyid dang /
translated: the absence of a protector in the sense of being always poor; the absence of a protector in the sense of being burned by the fires of passion, hatred, and delusion; the absence of a protector in the sense of being imprisoned in the prison of the life-cycle; the absence of a protector in the sense of being constantly and uninterruptedly obscured by the thickets of the reactive emotions; the absence of a protector in the sense of being lost in the wilderness of the life-cycle; the absence of a protector in the sense of being lost in the wilderness of the six realms of existence; the absence of a protector in the sense of being lost in the wilderness of the eight adversities; the absence of a protector in the sense of being lost in the wilderness of the wrong paths of spiritual ways; and the absence of a protector in the sense of being lost in the wilderness of the wrong paths of spiritual ways.

original: lta ba'i mthu med de mgon med pa nyid dang / dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa dang bral te mgon med pa nyid dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos chud zos te mngon med pa nyid dang / 'khor ba'i rgyun gyis bdas te mgon med pa nyid dang /
analyzed: lta ba'i mthu med de mgon med pa nyid dang / dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa dang bral te mgon med pa nyid dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos chud zos te mngon med pa nyid dang / 'khor ba'i rgyun gyis bdas te mgon med pa nyid dang /
translated: They are helpless because they have no power of view, they are helpless because they are devoid of the aspiration for virtuous dharmas, they are helpless because they waste the Buddha‚Äôs teachings, they are helpless because they are carried away by the stream of cyclic existence,

original: thar pa'i thabs chud zos te mgon med pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: thar pa'i thabs chud zos te mgon med pa nyid du'o //
translated: and they are helpless because they waste the means of liberation.

original: de la 'dod pa tshol ba'i dbang du byas nas ngoms mi myong ba dang / rab tu ma zhib yongs su spyod pa gnyis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa tshol ba'i dbang du byas nas ngoms mi myong ba dang / rab tu ma zhib yongs su spyod pa gnyis rig par bya ste /
translated: In this regard, the two, insatiable and not fully pacified, should be understood in terms of the pursuit of sensual desires.

original: gang gi phyir rtag tu 'bul ba'i sems kyi bsam pa nyid dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi me rab tu 'bar ba'i sems kyi bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtag tu 'bul ba'i sems kyi bsam pa nyid dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi me rab tu 'bar ba'i sems kyi bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because it is said that they are the constant thought of poverty and the thought of the blazing fire of passion, hatred, and folly.

original: srid pa tshol ba'i dbang du byas nas 'gro ba drug gi 'khor ba na yongs su 'phyan pa nyid dang / de'i rgyu nyon mongs pas khebs pa nyid dang / mi dal bar skye ba ni gsum dang go rims bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: srid pa tshol ba'i dbang du byas nas 'gro ba drug gi 'khor ba na yongs su 'phyan pa nyid dang / de'i rgyu nyon mongs pas khebs pa nyid dang / mi dal bar skye ba ni gsum dang go rims bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: The three remaining types of beings are to be known as the three types of beings who are not free from samsara, who are not free from the afflictions, and who are not free from the unfavorable states.üîΩThe three types of beings who are not free from samsara are those who are in samsara, those who are seeking samsaric existence, and those who are wandering in samsara. The three types of beings who are not free from the afflictions are those whose minds are bound by the afflictions, those whose minds are obscured by the afflictions, and those whose minds are covered by the afflictions. The three types of beings who are not free from the unfavorable states are those who are not free from the unfavorable states of the lower realms, those who are not free from the unfavorable states of the human realm, and those who are not free from the unfavorable states of the higher realms.

original: gang gi phyir srid pa'i btson rar chud pa'i sems kyi bsam pa nyid dang / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par nyon mongs pa thibs pos bsgribs pa'i sems kyi bsam pa nyid dang / lta ba'i mthu med pa'i sems kyi bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //üîΩtshangs par spyod pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir srid pa'i btson rar chud pa'i sems kyi bsam pa nyid dang / rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par nyon mongs pa thibs pos bsgribs pa'i sems kyi bsam pa nyid dang / lta ba'i mthu med pa'i sems kyi bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o // tshangs par spyod pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: The three types of beings who are not free from samsara are those who are in samsara, those who are seeking samsaric existence, and those who are wandering in samsara. The three types of beings who are not free from the afflictions are those whose minds are bound by the afflictions, those whose minds are obscured by the afflictions, and those whose minds are covered by the afflictions. The three types of beings who are not free from the unfavorable states are those who are not free from the unfavorable states of the lower realms, those who are not free from the unfavorable states of the human realm, and those who are not free from the unfavorable states of the higher realms.

original: mi brtson pa rnams dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal can rnams dang / yongs su mya ngan ldas mi 'da' ba'i chos can rnams dang / log pa la brtson pa gzhan mu stegs can rnams ni bzhi dang go rims bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mi brtson pa rnams dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal can rnams dang / yongs su mya ngan ldas mi 'da' ba'i chos can rnams dang / log pa la brtson pa gzhan mu stegs can rnams ni bzhi dang go rims bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: The four types of beings who are not free from the unfavorable states of the lower realms are those who are not free from the unfavorable states of the hells, those who are not free from the unfavorable states of the animal realm, those who are not free from the unfavorable states of the ghost realm, and those who are not free from the unfavorable states of the asura realm.üîΩThe four types of beings who are not free from the unfavorable states of the human realm are those who are not free from the unfavorable states of the eastern continent of Videha, those who are not free from the unfavorable states of the western continent of Godaniya, those who are not free from the unfavorable states of the northern continent of Kuru, and those who are not free from the unfavorable states of the southern continent of Jambudvipa.üîΩThe four types of beings who are not free from the unfavorable states of the higher realms are those who are not

original: gang gi phyir dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa dang bral ba'i sems kyi bsam pa nyid dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos chud zos pa'i sems kyi bsam pa nyid dang / 'khor ba'i rgyun gyis bdas pa'i sems kyi bsam pa nyid dang / thar pa'i thabs @170b chud zos pa'i sems kyi bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa dang bral ba'i sems kyi bsam pa nyid dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos chud zos pa'i sems kyi bsam pa nyid dang / 'khor ba'i rgyun gyis bdas pa'i sems kyi bsam pa nyid dang / thar pa'i thabs @170b chud zos pa'i sems kyi bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because of the absence of aspiration for virtuous qualities, the mind is intent on the loss of the Buddha-qualities, the mind is intent on being carried away by the stream of cyclic existence, and the mind is intent on the loss of the means of liberation.

original: sems can yongs su skyob pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can yongs su skyob pa'i phyir /
translated: The bodhisattva's striving is for the protection of sentient beings.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom pa ni gang gi phyir des de ltar sems can gyi khams gnod pa mang po can mthong nas brtson 'grus 'di ltar rtsom ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom pa ni gang gi phyir des de ltar sems can gyi khams gnod pa mang po can mthong nas brtson 'grus 'di ltar rtsom ste /
translated: Because of that, having seen the realm of sentient beings as having many misfortunes, he strives with this kind of striving:

original: sems can 'di dag ni bdag gis yongs su bskyab par bya zhes rgya cher gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni bdag gis yongs su bskyab par bya zhes rgya cher gsungs pa'o //
translated: I will protect these sentient beings.

original: de la gang las ji ltar yongs su bskyab par bya ba dang / ji ltar na yongs su bskyab pa por 'gyur ba de'i rab tu dbye bas yongs su skyob pa'i rab tu dbye ba ston te /
analyzed: de la gang las ji ltar yongs su bskyab par bya ba dang / ji ltar na yongs su bskyab pa por 'gyur ba de'i rab tu dbye bas yongs su skyob pa'i rab tu dbye ba ston te /
translated: The classification of protection is shown by the classification of what is to be protected and how it is to be protected.

original: gang las yongs su bskyab par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang las yongs su bskyab par bya zhe na /
translated: What is to be protected?

original: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las te /
analyzed: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las te /
translated: From the defilement of action, from the defilement of the passions, and from the defilement of birth.

original: gang gi phyir yongs su dgrol bar bya /üîΩyongs su sbyang bar bya /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yongs su dgrol bar bya / yongs su sbyang bar bya /
translated: For what purpose is it to be protected?

original: yongs su gdon par bya zhes gsungs pa ste go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: yongs su gdon par bya zhes gsungs pa ste go rims bzhin no //
translated: For the sake of liberation, purification, and rescue.

original: ji ltar yongs su bskyab par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar yongs su bskyab par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it to be protected?

original: tshul khrims la gzhag pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab la dgod pas bslab pa gsum gyis bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims la gzhag pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab la dgod pas bslab pa gsum gyis bsdu ba ste /
translated: By the three educations, through establishing in morality, through establishing in trance, and through establishing in wisdom.

original: gang gi phyir gnas par bya /üîΩdgod par bya zhes gsungs pa ste go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnas par bya /üîΩdgod par bya zhes gsungs pa ste go rims bzhin no //
translated: For what purpose is it to be protected?üîΩFor the sake of abiding, for the sake of being led, and for the sake of being established.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa yin pas ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab ni gcig tu bstan to //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa yin pas ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab ni gcig tu bstan to //
translated: And concentration and wisdom are taught as one, because they are the stage of meditative equipoise.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyis tshul khrims la gnas par bya ste ;
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyis tshul khrims la gnas par bya ste ;
translated: One should observe morality in two ways:

original: the tshom sel bas 'jug par bya ba ni /
analyzed: the tshom sel bas 'jug par bya ba ni /
translated: One should engage in it by eliminating doubt,

original: gang gi phyir yongs su tshim par bya zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yongs su tshim par bya zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: because one should be satisfied with it.

original: zhugs pa rnams mngon par dga' ba 'dzin du 'jug pas mi g-yo ba nyid kyis gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: zhugs pa rnams mngon par dga' ba 'dzin du 'jug pas mi g-yo ba nyid kyis gzhag pa ni /
translated: One should establish it with unwavering faith by causing those who have entered to take up delight,

original: gang gi phyir yang dag par gzhag par bya zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang dag par gzhag par bya zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: because one should establish it correctly.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab la dgod pa ni ;
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab la dgod pa ni ;
translated: One should establish it in concentration and wisdom,

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhum pa dang rgod pa 'dul ba ste /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa zhum pa dang rgod pa 'dul ba ste /
translated: taming the secondary mental afflictions of laziness and agitation,

original: gang gi phyir gdul bar bya zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gdul bar bya zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: because one should tame them.

original: ji ltar na yongs su skyob pa bor 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na yongs su skyob pa bor 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one become a protector?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings rnam pa gnyis thob par byed pa ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings rnam pa gnyis thob par byed pa ste /
translated: One causes the attainment of the two aspects of the realm of nirvana,

original: gang gi phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya'o snyam nas zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya'o snyam nas zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because he thinks, ‚ÄúI must attain complete nirvana.‚Äù

original: de de ltar 'du byed du gyur pa thams cad la yid 'byung ba dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: de de ltar 'du byed du gyur pa thams cad la yid 'byung ba dang ldan zhing /
translated: Thus, he becomes disenchanted with all conditioned things,

original: sems can thams cad la lta ba dang ldan la thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la phan yon dang ldan par rab tu gnas shing de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la rton pas sems can yongs su bskyab par bya ba la brtson @171a * //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la lta ba dang ldan la thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la phan yon dang ldan par rab tu gnas shing de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la rton pas sems can yongs su bskyab par bya ba la brtson @171a * //
translated: and he is endowed with the view of all sentient beings. He is established in the benefit of the wisdom of omniscience. He is devoted to the wisdom of the tathƒÅgatas. He is diligent in protecting sentient beings.

original: zhing 'di ltar yongs su rtog ste /
analyzed: zhing 'di ltar yongs su rtog ste /
translated: He thinks in this way:

original: lam gang gis 'di ltar sdug bsngal ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mang phor lhung ba'i sems can 'di dag mngon par gdon pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa shin tu bde ba la dgod par nus sam snyam nas zhes bya ba 'di la yid byung ba dang /
analyzed: lam gang gis 'di ltar sdug bsngal ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mang phor lhung ba'i sems can 'di dag mngon par gdon pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa shin tu bde ba la dgod par nus sam snyam nas zhes bya ba 'di la yid byung ba dang /
translated: ‚ÄúBy what path can I liberate these sentient beings who are suffering like this, who have fallen into a great mass of afflictions, and establish them in the happiness of nirvana?‚Äù

original: lta ba dang / phan yon dang ldan pa gnyis kyis ni rgyu rnam pa gsum dang ldan pa nyid du yongs su ston te /
analyzed: lta ba dang / phan yon dang ldan pa gnyis kyis ni rgyu rnam pa gsum dang ldan pa nyid du yongs su ston te /
translated: The two, endowed with view and benefit, reveal the three causes.

original: rgyu rnam pa gsum la kun nas nyon mongs pa las ldog pa'i rgyu ni yid byung ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu rnam pa gsum la kun nas nyon mongs pa las ldog pa'i rgyu ni yid byung ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The three causes are: the cause of turning away from the defilement, because of being endowed with disgust;

original: 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ba'i rgyu ni sems can thams cad la lta ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ba'i rgyu ni sems can thams cad la lta ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the cause of not forsaking the life-cycle, because of being endowed with the view of all beings;

original: brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i rgyu ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la phan yon du shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i rgyu ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la phan yon du shes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the cause of undertaking striving, because of being endowed with the knowledge of the benefit of omniscient knowledge.

original: des na gang la phan yon dang ldan pa de'i lam sgom par byed cing gang dag la lta ba dang ldan pa de dag yongs su smin par byed de /
analyzed: des na gang la phan yon dang ldan pa de'i lam sgom par byed cing gang dag la lta ba dang ldan pa de dag yongs su smin par byed de /
translated: Thus, one who is endowed with benefit cultivates the path, and one who is endowed with the view brings beings to maturity.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la rton pas sems can yongs su bskyab pa la brtson pa zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la rton pas sems can yongs su bskyab pa la brtson pa zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said, He is intent on protecting beings by relying on the knowledge of the Tathagata.

original: thabs yongs su bzung ba'i sbyor ba las brtsams te /
analyzed: thabs yongs su bzung ba'i sbyor ba las brtsams te /
translated: Beginning with the application of the thorough comprehension of means,

original: gang gi phyir thabs kyi lam gang gis 'di ltar sdug bsngal ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mang por lhung ba'i sems can 'di dag mngon par gdon pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa shin tu bde ba la dgod par nus snyam nas zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir thabs kyi lam gang gis 'di ltar sdug bsngal ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mang por lhung ba'i sems can 'di dag mngon par gdon pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa shin tu bde ba la dgod par nus snyam nas zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: it is said, ‚Äúbecause of the thought, ‚ÄòBy means of which path of means can I rescue these sentient beings who have fallen into such suffering and many secondary afflictions, and establish them in the very blissful nirvana?‚Äô‚Äù

original: de la sdug bsngal dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mang por lhung ba zhes bya ba la sdug bsngal ni skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mang por lhung ba zhes bya ba la sdug bsngal ni skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: There, ‚Äúfallen into suffering and many secondary afflictions‚Äù means that suffering is the affliction of birth.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: Secondary afflictions are the afflictions and the affliction of karma.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa shin tu bde ba ni theg pa rnam pa gsum gyis so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa shin tu bde ba ni theg pa rnam pa gsum gyis so //
translated: Very blissful nirvana is by means of the three vehicles.

original: de la thabs yongs su bzung ba'i sbyor ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la thabs yongs su bzung ba'i sbyor ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: There, the application of the thorough comprehension of means should be understood in brief as threefold:

original: mthar phyin pa rtogs pa dang / mthar phyin pa sgrub pa'i gong nas gong ma rtogs pa dang / de sgrub pa'i gnas la sbyor ba rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthar phyin pa rtogs pa dang / mthar phyin pa sgrub pa'i gong nas gong ma rtogs pa dang / de sgrub pa'i gnas la sbyor ba rtogs pa'o //
translated: The realization of the culmination is the realization of the higher and higher stages of the culmination, and the application to the stages of the accomplishment of those.

original: de la mthar phyin pa ni sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyi rnam par thar pa la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de la mthar phyin pa ni sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyi rnam par thar pa la gnas pa ste /
translated: The culmination is the abode of the liberation of unobstructed intuition.

original: gang gi phyir de byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: For what reason? Because the bodhisattva thinks thus:

original: sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyi rnam par thar pa la gnas pa ma gtogs par gzhan gyis ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyi rnam par thar pa la gnas pa ma gtogs par gzhan gyis ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not by any other means than by abiding in the liberation of unobstructed intuition.‚Äù

original: mthar phyin pa de ni khong du chud pas mthar phyin pa sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mthar phyin pa de ni khong du chud pas mthar phyin pa sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: That culmination is the accomplishment of the culmination by means of comprehension.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par @171b gzhag pa'i chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pas sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas rnam par @171b gzhag pa'i chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pas sgrub pa ste /
translated: It is the accomplishment by means of the correct comprehension of all the dharmas which are established by the Tathagata.

original: gang gi phyir sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyi rnam par thar pa la gnas pa de yang chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa ma gtogs par gzhan gyis ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyi rnam par thar pa la gnas pa de yang chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa ma gtogs par gzhan gyis ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because that abiding in the liberation of unobstructed intuition is not due to anything other than the thorough understanding of all phenomena just as they are.

original: khong du chud pa de'i ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes su rgyu ba'i shes rab ste /
analyzed: khong du chud pa de'i ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid la rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes su rgyu ba'i shes rab ste /
translated: That thorough understanding is the wisdom that moves in the non-conceptualization of particular and universal characteristics.

original: gang gi phyir chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa de yang shes rab rgyu ba med cing skye ba med pa'i rgyu ba can ma gtogs par gzhan gyis ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud pa de yang shes rab rgyu ba med cing skye ba med pa'i rgyu ba can ma gtogs par gzhan gyis ma yin no //
translated: Because that thorough understanding of all phenomena just as they are is not due to anything other than the movement of non-moving, non-arisen wisdom.

original: shes rab kyi snang ba de yang bsam gtan la mkhas pa la rnam par nges pa blos so sor rtog pa ma gtogs par gzhan gyis ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi snang ba de yang bsam gtan la mkhas pa la rnam par nges pa blos so sor rtog pa ma gtogs par gzhan gyis ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: And that illumination of wisdom is not due to anything other than the discernment by the mind of the expertise in meditative concentration.

original: 'dir shes rab kyi snang ba de gsungs pa ni de gnas yin pa'i phyir sa 'di 'od byed pa'o zhes nges pa'i tshig yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde rtogs pa ni bsam gtan la mkhas pa la rnam par nges pa blos so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir shes rab kyi snang ba de gsungs pa ni de gnas yin pa'i phyir sa 'di 'od byed pa'o zhes nges pa'i tshig yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro // de rtogs pa ni bsam gtan la mkhas pa la rnam par nges pa blos so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: The light of wisdom is mentioned here because it is the basis of that light, in order to teach the verbal definition of this stage as the Luminous.üîΩThe realization of that is the discernment by the mind of the expertise in meditation.

original: bsam gtan la mkhas pa la rnam par nges pa'i blos so sor rtog pa de yang /
analyzed: bsam gtan la mkhas pa la rnam par nges pa'i blos so sor rtog pa de yang /
translated: That discernment by the mind of the expertise in meditationüîΩis not by any other means than expertise in listening.

original: thos pa la mkhas pa ma gtogs pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin no snyam mo zhes bya ba la bsam gtan la mkhas pa de ni khyad par can gyi bsam gtan thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos pa la mkhas pa ma gtogs pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin no snyam mo zhes bya ba la bsam gtan la mkhas pa de ni khyad par can gyi bsam gtan thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That expertise in meditation is for the sake of attaining special meditation.

original: rnam par nges pa ni gzhan las so //
analyzed: rnam par nges pa ni gzhan las so //
translated: Discernment is from others.

original: blos so sor rtog pa ni rang gis so //
analyzed: blos so sor rtog pa ni rang gis so //
translated: Discernment by the mind is by oneself.

original: 'di ni mthar phyin pa sgrub pa'i gong nas gong ma rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mthar phyin pa sgrub pa'i gong nas gong ma rtogs pa'o //
translated: This is the realization of the higher and higher from the accomplishment of perfection.

original: de ltar blos so sor rtog pa de yang thos pa la mkhas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar blos so sor rtog pa de yang thos pa la mkhas par 'gyur te /
translated: That discernment by the mind also becomes expertise in listening.

original: 'di ni rtogs pa sgrub pa'i gnas la sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni rtogs pa sgrub pa'i gnas la sbyor ba ste /
translated: This is the application to the place of realization.

original: thos pa la mkhas pa ni de bsgrub pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: thos pa la mkhas pa ni de bsgrub pa'i gnas so //
translated: Skill in listening is the place of its realization.

original: de'i phyir sbyor ba ni de sgrub pa'i gnas la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyor ba ni de sgrub pa'i gnas la sbyor ba'o //
translated: Therefore, application is the application to the place of its realization.

original: de la tshig dang don gyi dbang du byas nas dam pa'i chos yongs su tshol ba la brtson pa dang / nyin mtshan du chos nyan pa don du gnyer ba'i go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de la tshig dang don gyi dbang du byas nas dam pa'i chos yongs su tshol ba la brtson pa dang / nyin mtshan du chos nyan pa don du gnyer ba'i go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: In this regard, one should connect the striving for the quest of the holy Dharma and the pursuit of listening to the Dharma day and night, respectively, in terms of the power of words and meaning.

original: gang gi phyir de de ltar so sor rtog pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa de bas kyang shes cher dam pa'i chos yongs su tshol ba la mngon par brtson par gnas pa dang / nyin mtshan du chos nyan pa don du gnyer ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de de ltar so sor rtog pa'i shes pa dang ldan pa de bas kyang shes cher dam pa'i chos yongs su tshol ba la mngon par brtson par gnas pa dang / nyin mtshan du chos nyan pa don du gnyer ba zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because he is endowed with the knowledge of discernment in this way, he is said to abide in the quest of the holy Dharma with even greater effort and to pursue listening to the Dharma day and night.

original: tshig dang don de dag nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: tshig dang don de dag nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: In terms of just those words and their meanings,

original: chos 'dod pa dang / chos la dga' ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: chos 'dod pa dang / chos la dga' ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: he is said to desire the Dharma and to delight in the Dharma.

original: klan ka btsal ba dang / de skad smra ba las thar pa'i phan yon gyi bsam pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩchen @172a * //
analyzed: klan ka btsal ba dang / de skad smra ba las thar pa'i phan yon gyi bsam pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // chen @172a * //
translated: It is not the thought of seeking out faults or of escaping from what is said.üîΩThe great teacher taught this in order to destroy the pride of those who think their own views are supreme.

original: po bstan pa la ston pas rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir /üîΩchos la ston pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //üîΩlung nod cing kha ton bya ba dang / gzhan la yang dag par bshad par bya ba dang / dben par 'dug ste don sems pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: po bstan pa la ston pas rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir / chos la ston pa zhes bya ba gsungs so // lung nod cing kha ton bya ba dang / gzhan la yang dag par bshad par bya ba dang / dben par 'dug ste don sems pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: He taught this in order to destroy the pride of those who think their own views are supreme.üîΩHe taught this in order to destroy the pride of those who think their own views are supreme.üîΩHe taught this in order to destroy the pride of those who think their own views are supreme.üîΩHe taught this in order to destroy the pride of those who think their own views are supreme.

original: chos la gzhol ba dang / chos la 'bab pa dang / chos la bab pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: chos la gzhol ba dang / chos la 'bab pa dang / chos la bab pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: He taught this in order to destroy the pride of those who think their own views are supreme.

analyzed: mnyam par gzhag ste bsgom pa'i dbang du byas nas / chos la phyogs pa zhes bya ba gsungs so // 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: He taught this in order to destroy the pride of those who think their own views are supreme.üîΩHe taught this in order to destroy the pride of those who think their own views are supreme.üîΩHe taught this in order to destroy the pride of those who think their own views are supreme.üîΩHe taught this in order to destroy the pride of those who think their own views are supreme.üîΩHe taught this in order to destroy the pride of those who think their own views are supreme.üîΩHe taught this in order to destroy the pride of those who think their own views are supreme.

original: chos la gnas su 'dzin pa dang / chos la skyabs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: chos la gnas su 'dzin pa dang / chos la skyabs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: He taught this in order to destroy the pride of those who think their own views are supreme.

original: rnam par grol ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: From the perspective of liberation,

original: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos spyod pa yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos spyod pa yin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rnam par grol ba'i chos gang yin pa de'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi rnam par grol ba'i chos gang yin pa de'i rjes su mthun pa'i chos spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he practices the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma of liberation of the Tathagatas.

original: de la dam pa'i chos yongs su tshol ba la brtson pa dang / nyin mtshan du chos mnyan pa don du gnyer ba zhes bya ba'i tshig dang po gnyis kyis ni rtag tu sbyor ba ston to //
analyzed: de la dam pa'i chos yongs su tshol ba la brtson pa dang / nyin mtshan du chos mnyan pa don du gnyer ba zhes bya ba'i tshig dang po gnyis kyis ni rtag tu sbyor ba ston to //
translated: Here, the first two phrases, ‚Äústriving in the quest for the sublime Dharma‚Äù and ‚Äúaspiring to hear the Dharma day and night,‚Äù show constant application.

original: chos 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig lhag ma dgu po dag gis ni yang dag par sbyor ba ston to //
analyzed: chos 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshig lhag ma dgu po dag gis ni yang dag par sbyor ba ston to //
translated: The remaining nine phrases, beginning with ‚Äúdesiring the Dharma,‚Äù show correct application.

original: de ni rtag tu sbyor ba de'i rgyu gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ni rtag tu sbyor ba de'i rgyu gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of that constant application?

original: chos la rim gro byed pa khyad zhugs pa yin par yongs su ston te /
analyzed: chos la rim gro byed pa khyad zhugs pa yin par yongs su ston te /
translated: It shows that it is the special service to the Dharma.

original: de ni nor dang / rgyal srid dang / mtho ris su skye ba dang / 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa dang / lus pas kyang chos la rim gro cher byed de /
analyzed: de ni nor dang / rgyal srid dang / mtho ris su skye ba dang / 'jig rten pa'i rnam par dag pa dang / lus pas kyang chos la rim gro cher byed de /
translated: He serves the Dharma even more than his own body, with wealth, with his kingdom, with rebirth in the heavens, with mundane purification, and with his life.

original: ji ltar nor bas kyang rim gro byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar nor bas kyang rim gro byed ce na /
translated: How does he serve with wealth?

original: de ni chos kyi phyir nor yang thams cad yongs su gtong ste /
analyzed: de ni chos kyi phyir nor yang thams cad yongs su gtong ste /
translated: He gives up all his wealth for the sake of the Dharma.

original: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su tshol ba la mngon par brtson pa de rdzas kyi rnam pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su tshol ba la mngon par brtson pa de rdzas kyi rnam pa'am /
translated: For the sake of seeking the Buddha-Dharma, there is nothing that he will not give up.

original: nor dang / 'bru dang / bang mdzod kyi rnam pa gang yongs su mi gtong ba de gang yang med de /
analyzed: nor dang / 'bru dang / bang mdzod kyi rnam pa gang yongs su mi gtong ba de gang yang med de /
translated: Whether it is his own body, or wealth, or grain, or his treasury, there is nothing that he will not give up.

original: de la bya dka' bar 'du shes pa ma yin gyi gzhan du na chos smra ba'i gang zag de la bya dka' ba'i 'du shes su 'gyur ba de ni ma gtogs so zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de la bya dka' bar 'du shes pa ma yin gyi gzhan du na chos smra ba'i gang zag de la bya dka' ba'i 'du shes su 'gyur ba de ni ma gtogs so zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: He does not think it difficult to do, except for the thought that it is difficult to serve the Dharma teacher.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po zhing la sogs pa gang las nor rnyed par 'gyur ba de yang yongs su gtong ste gang gi phyir /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po zhing la sogs pa gang las nor rnyed par 'gyur ba de yang yongs su gtong ste gang gi phyir /
translated: He also gives up external things, such as fields, from which wealth is acquired.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po nye bar gzung ba gang yongs su mi gtong ba de gang yang med do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po nye bar gzung ba gang yongs su mi gtong ba de gang yang med do zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because there is nothing at all that is an external thing that he does not give up.

original: nor gang gi dngos po gang gi phyir yin pa de yang yongs su @172b gtong ste gang gi phyir nang gi dngos po gang yongs su mi gtong ba de gang yang med do zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nor gang gi dngos po gang gi phyir yin pa de yang yongs su @172b gtong ste gang gi phyir nang gi dngos po gang yongs su mi gtong ba de gang yang med do zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: He also gives up the wealth itself, because there is nothing at all that is an internal thing that he does not give up.

original: gang gi phyir nor yongs su gtong ba lus kyi bsnyen bkur bya ba de dag kyang nyams su len te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nor yongs su gtong ba lus kyi bsnyen bkur bya ba de dag kyang nyams su len te /
translated: He also practices the service to the guru that is the giving of wealth.

original: gang gi phyir bla ma la bsnyen bkur bya ba dang rim gro bya ba gang nyams su mi len pa de gang yang med do zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bla ma la bsnyen bkur bya ba dang rim gro bya ba gang nyams su mi len pa de gang yang med do zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because there is nothing at all that is a service to the guru that he does not practice.

original: nor rnyed pa de gang gis yongs su gtong ba'i snyems pa de yang yongs su gtong ste /
analyzed: nor rnyed pa de gang gis yongs su gtong ba'i snyems pa de yang yongs su gtong ste /
translated: He also gives up the pride of giving wealth.

original: gang gi phyir nga rgyal dang lhag pa'i nga rgyal spangs te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir nga rgyal dang lhag pa'i nga rgyal spangs te /
translated: Because there is nothing at all that I should not practice, having abandoned pride and excessive pride,

original: nga rgyal med par nye bar spyad par bya ba gang nyams su mi len pa de gang yang med do zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal med par nye bar spyad par bya ba gang nyams su mi len pa de gang yang med do zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and having practiced without pride.

original: gang yongs su spong pa'i phyir nor yongs su gtong ba lus kyi gnod pa de dag kyang nyams su len te /
analyzed: gang yongs su spong pa'i phyir nor yongs su gtong ba lus kyi gnod pa de dag kyang nyams su len te /
translated: And he practices those bodily injuries for the sake of giving away wealth, in order to abandon them.

original: gang gi phyir lus kyi gnod pa gang nyams su mi len pa de gang yang med do zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir lus kyi gnod pa gang nyams su mi len pa de gang yang med do zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because there is nothing at all that I should not practice, in terms of bodily injuries.

original: nor mang zhing gces pa rnyed pa bas kyang des ches dga' bar 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: nor mang zhing gces pa rnyed pa bas kyang des ches dga' bar 'gyur ba ni /
translated: He is even more pleased by the acquisition of a single verse of the Dharma that he has not heard before,

original: gang gi phyir de ma thos pa'i chos kyi tshig gcig thos pa nor che bar 'dzin gyi stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams snyed kyi rin po che'i phung po rnyed pa ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ma thos pa'i chos kyi tshig gcig thos pa nor che bar 'dzin gyi stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams snyed kyi rin po che'i phung po rnyed pa ni ma yin no zhes gsungs pa ste /
translated: than by the acquisition of much-prized wealth. Because he regards the acquisition of a single verse of the Dharma that he has not heard before as greater wealth, not the acquisition of a mass of jewels equal to the three-thousand-great-thousand world-realms.

original: de ltar nor bas kyang rim gro cher byed do //
analyzed: de ltar nor bas kyang rim gro cher byed do //
translated: Thus, he serves with wealth.

original: rgyal srid la sogs pa bas kyang ji ltar rim gro cher byed ce na /
analyzed: rgyal srid la sogs pa bas kyang ji ltar rim gro cher byed ce na /
translated: How is it that they are honored more than a kingdom and so on?

original: de ni chos kyis rab tu dga' ba yin gyi 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid dang / brgya byin dang tshangs pa rnams kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni chos kyis rab tu dga' ba yin gyi 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid dang / brgya byin dang tshangs pa rnams kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: They are delighted by the Dharma, not by the kingdom of a wheel-turning king, nor by the status of Indra or Brahma.
