original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa can yin pas /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa can yin pas /
translated: Because mental consciousness is conceptual.

original: sna tshogs nyid kyi 'du shes rnams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs nyid kyi 'du shes rnams zhes bya ste /
translated: The perception of variety is the perception of form, etc.

original: 'di ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams pa'o //
translated: This is the weakening of the counteragent.

original: tha dad du dbye ba'i tshul gyis gzugs la sogs pa'i yul bdag med par mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: tha dad du dbye ba'i tshul gyis gzugs la sogs pa'i yul bdag med par mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Because of the seeing of the object, form, etc., as selfless by way of the division into different aspects,

original: gnyen po gang gi gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das pa de ni /
analyzed: gnyen po gang gi gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gyi 'du shes las yang dag par 'das pa de ni /
translated: the perception of the object, form, etc., as a counteragent is completely transcended.

original: gnyen po bsgom pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyen po bsgom pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be known as the cultivation of the counteragent.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pa'i phan yon no //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas so snyam nas zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pa'i phan yon no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving the thought ‚Äòspace is infinite‚Äô‚Äù is the benefit of cultivation.

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba la nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyis de gnyis ka'i gnas kyi ting nge 'dzin yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba la nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyis de gnyis ka'i gnas kyi ting nge 'dzin yongs su bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe achieves and remains in the sphere of infinite space‚Äù indicates the samƒÅdhi that is the basis of both of those.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das nas zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams pa bstan to //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das nas zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving completely transcended the sphere of infinite space‚Äù indicates the weakening of the counteragent.

original: phyi rol gyi dmigs pa la rags pa nyid du yongs su rtog pas nyes par mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dmigs pa la rags pa nyid du yongs su rtog pas nyes par mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is seen as a fault to conceive of the external object as coarse.

original: gnyen po gang gis de las yang dag par 'das pa de ni gnyen po bsgom pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyen po gang gis de las yang dag par 'das pa de ni gnyen po bsgom pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the cultivation of the counteragent is that by which one completely transcends that.

original: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam nas zhes bya bas ni bsgoms pa'i phan yon yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa mtha' yas so snyam nas zhes bya bas ni bsgoms pa'i phan yon yongs su bstan to //
translated: The phrase having the perception that space is infinite indicates the benefit of cultivation.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya bas ni de gnyi ga'i gnas kyi ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya bas ni de gnyi ga'i gnas kyi ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
translated: The phrase he achieves and remains in the sphere of infinite consciousness indicates the concentration that is the basis of both.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams pa bstan to //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las yang dag par 'das zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase in all ways completely transcending the sphere of infinite consciousness indicates the degeneration of the adverse elements.

original: rnam par shes pa @176b mtha' yas so snyam zhes bya ba ni 'dir rags pa nyid du yongs su rtog pas nyes par mthong ba'i phyir gnyen po gang gi de las yang dag par de ni gnyen po bsgom pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa @176b mtha' yas so snyam zhes bya ba ni 'dir rags pa nyid du yongs su rtog pas nyes par mthong ba'i phyir gnyen po gang gi de las yang dag par de ni gnyen po bsgom pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The phrase one perceives the infinity of consciousness refers to the meditative development of the counteragent that is the antidote to the error of conceiving the infinity of consciousness as a gross object.

original: ci yang med do snyam zhes bya ba 'dis ni bsgoms pa'i phan yon yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: ci yang med do snyam zhes bya ba 'dis ni bsgoms pa'i phan yon yongs su bstan to //
translated: The phrase one perceives nothing whatsoever indicates the benefit of meditative development.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba 'dis ni gnyis ka'i gnas kyi ting nge 'dzin yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba 'dis ni gnyis ka'i gnas kyi ting nge 'dzin yongs su bstan to //
translated: The phrase one achieves and remains in the sphere of nothingness indicates the meditative concentration of the domain of both.

original: de rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams pa bstan to //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las yang dag par 'das zhes bya ba 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase one completely surmounts the sphere of nothingness indicates the degeneration of the counteragent.

original: ci yang med do snyam zhes bya ba 'dis ni rags pa nyid yongs su rtog pas nyes par mthong ba'i phyir gnyen po gang gis de las yang dag par 'das pa de ni gnyen po bsgom pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ci yang med do snyam zhes bya ba 'dis ni rags pa nyid yongs su rtog pas nyes par mthong ba'i phyir gnyen po gang gis de las yang dag par 'das pa de ni gnyen po bsgom pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The phrase it is nothing at all indicates that one should understand that the meditative development of the counteragent is the transcendence of that [notion of] grossness by means of the counteragent, because it is seen to be a fault.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med pa ma yin no snyam zhes bya bas ni bsgoms pa'i phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med pa ma yin no snyam zhes bya bas ni bsgoms pa'i phan yon bstan to //
translated: The phrase it is neither with ideation nor without ideation indicates the benefit of meditative development.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba la 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyis ni de gnyi ga'i gnas kyi ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched bsgrubs te gnas so zhes bya ba la 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyis ni de gnyi ga'i gnas kyi ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
translated: The phrase he attains and remains in the sphere of neither ideation nor non-ideation indicates the meditative concentration of the sphere of neither ideation nor non-ideation, which is the basis of both.

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams pa dang / gnyen po bsgom pa dang / de'i phan yon dang / de gnyi ga'i gnas rnams ni ci rigs su sbyar zin to //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams la yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyams pa dang / gnyen po bsgom pa dang / de'i phan yon dang / de gnyi ga'i gnas rnams ni ci rigs su sbyar zin to //
translated: The degeneration of the adverse elements, the meditative development of the counteragent, the benefit of meditative development and the basis of both should be connected with the formless [absorptions] in the appropriate manner.

original: tshad med pa rnams ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: tshad med pa rnams ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The Immeasurables are threefold:

original: sems can la dmigs pa dang / chos la dmigs pa dang dmigs pa med pa rnams so //
analyzed: sems can la dmigs pa dang / chos la dmigs pa dang dmigs pa med pa rnams so //
translated: The object is threefold: sentient beings, phenomena, and the absence of an object.

original: de la sems can la dmigs pa ni rnam pa bzhis rnam par gzhag ste nye bar sgrub pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po dang / rnam par dag pa dang 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sems can la dmigs pa ni rnam pa bzhis rnam par gzhag ste nye bar sgrub pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po dang / rnam par dag pa dang 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The object of sentient beings is established as fourfold: the basis, the antidote to the adverse factors, purification, and the result.

original: nye bar sgrub pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar sgrub pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the basis?

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa dga' ba dang bcas pa dang / dga' ba med pa'i bde ba rnam pa gsum sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa dga' ba dang bcas pa dang / dga' ba med pa'i bde ba rnam pa gsum sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the basis for accomplishing the three kinds of happiness: the happiness of the desire realm, the happiness of the form realm, and the happiness of the formless realm.

original: de ni sdug bsngal dang dga' ba dang bral ba'i phyir gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal dang dga' ba dang bral ba'i phyir gnyis su med pa'o //
translated: It is nondual because it is free from suffering and joy.

original: de nyid tshad med pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid tshad med pa yin te /
translated: It is immeasurable.

original: gang gi phyir de la byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems yangs pa rgya chen por gyur pa mi gnyis pa tshad med pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de la byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems yangs pa rgya chen por gyur pa mi gnyis pa tshad med pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Because it is a vast and extensive mind endowed with love, it is called the immeasurable mind of nonduality.

original: snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa'i bar du'o //üîΩmi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi @177a * //
analyzed: snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang ldan pa zhes gsungs pa'i bar du'o // mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi @177a * //
translated: and with compassion, sympathetic joy, and equanimity.

original: gnyen po ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gnyen po ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the remedy for the resistances?

original: mi 'dod pa nye bar sgrub pa dang / 'dod pa nye bar sgrub pa'i gegs byed pa gnod par sems pa'i gnyen po ni gang gi phyir khon med pa 'gran zla med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa nye bar sgrub pa dang / 'dod pa nye bar sgrub pa'i gegs byed pa gnod par sems pa'i gnyen po ni gang gi phyir khon med pa 'gran zla med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The remedy for the malice that consists in the wish to harm someone who is inflicting harm or who is creating an obstacle to obtaining a benefit; and the remedy for the malice that consists in the wish to harm someone who is not giving what one wants, are the absence of resentment and the absence of rivalry.üîΩWhat is the purity?

original: rnam par dag pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: The purity is the complete removal of the obscurations of torpor, sleep, excitation, and regret.

original: sgrib pa rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang 'gyod pa gnyis yang dag par shin tu bsal ba'i phyir te /üîΩgang gi phyir sgrib pa med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang 'gyod pa gnyis yang dag par shin tu bsal ba'i phyir te / gang gi phyir sgrib pa med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The absence of obscuration is the remedy for the obscurations of torpor, sleep, excitation, and regret.

original: 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the function of the powers?

original: gang gi phyir gnod pa med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gnod pa med pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: because it is said to be non-erroneous.

original: chos la dmigs pa ni thams cad du khyab pa'o //
analyzed: chos la dmigs pa ni thams cad du khyab pa'o //
translated: The objective support that is the object-field is all-pervading.

original: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo dang / slob pa'i so so'i skye bo'i sems can ji snyed pa ni chos rnams te /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo dang / slob pa'i so so'i skye bo'i sems can ji snyed pa ni chos rnams te /
translated: All sentient beings who are ordinary folk, and the ordinary folk who are trainees, in the desire, form and formless realms, are the object-fields.

original: gang dag la sems can du 'dogs pa med pa de la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: gang dag la sems can du 'dogs pa med pa de la dmigs pa ste /
translated: The objective support that is the object-field is that which is not designated as a sentient being.

original: gang gi phyir thams cad du khyab pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir thams cad du khyab pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: because it is said to be all-pervading.

original: dmigs pa med pa ni rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa ni rnam pa gnyis kyis bstan te /
translated: The objective support that is the object of engagement is taught in two ways:

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la mi dmigs pa ni chos la bdag med pa mchog tu gyur pa'i 'jig rten la ste /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la mi dmigs pa ni chos la bdag med pa mchog tu gyur pa'i 'jig rten la ste /
translated: The objective support that is the object of engagement in the individual characteristic is the supreme objective support for the selflessness of phenomena, i.e.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten chos kyi dbyings dam pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten chos kyi dbyings dam pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: because it is said to be the supreme element of the Dharma.üîΩThe objective support that is the object of engagement in the universal characteristic is the objective support for the emptiness of the unlimited, i.e.

original: mtha' yongs su ma chad pa ni gang gi phyir nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' yongs su ma chad pa ni gang gi phyir nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: because it is said to be the element of space.

original: 'jig rten thams cad ces bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad de /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad ces bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad de /
translated: The entire world is the entire world-realm.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten thams cad khyab par byas nas bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten thams cad khyab par byas nas bsgrubs te gnas so zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because it is said, having pervaded the entire world, he abides having accomplished it.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams las bzhi ni shes par rab tu phye ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams las bzhi ni shes par rab tu phye ba'o //
translated: Among the superknowledges, four are distinguished by knowledge.

original: lnga pa ni mthong bas rab tu phye ba'o //
analyzed: lnga pa ni mthong bas rab tu phye ba'o //
translated: The fifth is distinguished by seeing.

original: rdzu 'phrul mngon par shes pa gcig gis ni /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul mngon par shes pa gcig gis ni /
translated: By one superknowledge,

original: lus kyi las yongs su dag go //
analyzed: lus kyi las yongs su dag go //
translated: the action of the body is purified.

original: lha'i rna ba dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par zhen pa gnyis kyis ni ngag gi las yongs su dag go //
analyzed: lha'i rna ba dang / pha rol gyi sems shes pa'i mngon par zhen pa gnyis kyis ni ngag gi las yongs su dag go //
translated: By two, the action of speech is purified: the divine ear and the knowledge of the minds of others.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba mngon par shes pa gnyis kyis ni yid kyi las yongs su dag go //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba mngon par shes pa gnyis kyis ni yid kyi las yongs su dag go //
translated: By two, the action of mind is purified: the recollection of former abodes and the superknowledge of death, transition, and rebirth.

original: gcig gis ni sems can gyi gan du 'gro'o //
analyzed: gcig gis ni sems can gyi gan du 'gro'o //
translated: By one, one goes to the presence of sentient beings.

original: gnyis kyis ni chos ston te /
analyzed: gnyis kyis ni chos ston te /
translated: By two, one teaches the Dharma.

original: sgra dang don so sor yang dag par rig cing sems shes la @177b skad gzhan gyi don shes te /
analyzed: sgra dang don so sor yang dag par rig cing sems shes la @177b skad gzhan gyi don shes te /
translated: He knows the languages and meanings, knows the minds, and knows the languages of other beings.

original: don de'i dbang du byas nas de dag gis tshig 'di brjod do snyam pa'o //
analyzed: don de'i dbang du byas nas de dag gis tshig 'di brjod do snyam pa'o //
translated: He knows that the words of those beings are spoken in accordance with their own interests.

original: gnyis kyis ni 'ong ba dang 'gro ba shes te /
analyzed: gnyis kyis ni 'ong ba dang 'gro ba shes te /
translated: By means of the other two, he knows coming and going.

original: sems can rnams kyi sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su smin pa shes so //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' yongs su smin pa shes so //
translated: He knows the previous and subsequent ends of beings, that is, their previous and subsequent lives.

original: de la rdzu 'phrul mngon par shes pa ni dbang nyid thob par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la rdzu 'phrul mngon par shes pa ni dbang nyid thob par rig par bya'o //
translated: Among these, the superknowledge of magical power should be understood as mastery.

original: dbang nyid kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dbang nyid kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Mastery is threefold:

original: zhing la dbang ba nyid ni 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sa g-yo bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: zhing la dbang ba nyid ni 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sa g-yo bar byed pa ste /
translated: Mastery over the field is the shaking of the earth,

original: gang gi phyir rdzu 'phrul bya ba rnams pa du ma myong bar byed de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rdzu 'phrul bya ba rnams pa du ma myong bar byed de /
translated: because he experiences many kinds of magical creations.

original: sa yang g-yo bar byed do zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sa yang g-yo bar byed do zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: He shakes the earth.

original: lus la dbang ba nyid ni de bsdus pa dang / spros pa dang / snang ba dang mi snang bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: lus la dbang ba nyid ni de bsdus pa dang / spros pa dang / snang ba dang mi snang bar byed pa ste /
translated: Mastery over the body is the ability to make the body subtle, light, and able to penetrate things.

original: gang gi phyir gcig tu gyur nas mang por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gcig tu gyur nas mang por 'gyur ro //
translated: because having become one, they become many;

original: mang por gyur nas gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mang por gyur nas gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: having become many, they become one;

original: snang bar gyur cing mi snang bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: snang bar gyur cing mi snang bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: they become visible, they become invisible.

original: byed pa la dbang ba nyid ni rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: byed pa la dbang ba nyid ni rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: The mastery of action is eightfold.

original: rtsig pa la sogs pa la thad kar 'gro ba ni gang gi phyir /üîΩrtsig pa la thad kar 'gro /
analyzed: rtsig pa la sogs pa la thad kar 'gro ba ni gang gi phyir / rtsig pa la thad kar 'gro /
translated: Going directly into walls and so on, becauseüîΩhe goes directly into walls,

original: ra ba la yang thad kar 'gro //
analyzed: ra ba la yang thad kar 'gro //
translated: he goes directly into ramparts,

original: ri la yang mi thogs par thad kar 'gro ste /
analyzed: ri la yang mi thogs par thad kar 'gro ste /
translated: he goes directly into mountains without impediment,

original: dper na nam mkha' la bya ba bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' la bya ba bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: as if through space.

original: steng du nam mkha' la yang 'gro ba ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: steng du nam mkha' la yang 'gro ba ni gang gi phyir /
translated: Going above in the sky, because

original: nam mkha' la yang skyil mo krung gis 'gro ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' la yang skyil mo krung gis 'gro ste /
translated: he goes in the sky cross-legged,

original: dper na 'dab chags bya bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩsa la yang steng dang 'og tu 'gro ba ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: dper na 'dab chags bya bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'o // sa la yang steng dang 'og tu 'gro ba ni gang gi phyir /
translated: as if through space.üîΩGoing below in the earth, because

original: sa la yang steng du 'byung ba dang bye'u zul byed de /
analyzed: sa la yang steng du 'byung ba dang bye'u zul byed de /
translated: he goes below the earth cross-legged,üîΩas if in water.

original: dper na chu la bya ba bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: dper na chu la bya ba bzhin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: For example, it is like water.

original: chu la'ang 'og tu mi 'bying ba ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: chu la'ang 'og tu mi 'bying ba ni gang gi phyir /
translated: It does not sink in water, because

original: chu la'ang mi nub par 'gro ste /
analyzed: chu la'ang mi nub par 'gro ste /

analyzed: rags pa ma yin par rab tu dbye bar shes par bya'o //

analyzed: bag la nyal ni nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa ste /

analyzed: gang gi phyir mnyam par bzhag pa dang mnyam par ma bzhag pa zhes gsungs pa'o //

translated: The rest is as in the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle, and is not distinguished here.

original: de bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa 'di dag la snyoms par 'jug cing rnam par ldang yang gang du byang chub kyi yan lag yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bar mthong ba der ched du bsams te /
analyzed: de bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa 'di dag la snyoms par 'jug cing rnam par ldang yang gang du byang chub kyi yan lag yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bar mthong ba der ched du bsams te /
translated: He enters and emerges from these meditative concentrations, liberations, meditative stabilizations, and absorptions, and he intentionally manifests wherever he sees that the factors for Awakening will be completed.

original: smon lam btab pa'i dbang gis skye ba ma gtogs par de dag gi dbang gis mi skye'o zhes bya ba de la bsam gtan rnams ni ji skad bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: smon lam btab pa'i dbang gis skye ba ma gtogs par de dag gi dbang gis mi skye'o zhes bya ba de la bsam gtan rnams ni ji skad bstan pa rnams so //
translated: Except for the case of rebirth due to the power of a vow, one is not reborn there due to the power of those meditative states, etc.üîΩThe meditative states are as previously described.

original: rnam par thar pa ni gzugs med pa dag go //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa ni gzugs med pa dag go //
translated: The liberations are the formless meditative attainments.

original: ting nge 'dzin dag ni tshad med pa rnams so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dag ni tshad med pa rnams so //
translated: The concentrations are the immeasurables.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa rnams ni mngon par shes pa rnams te byung ba dang dus mnyam du ji ltar bsam pa'i bya ba sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa rnams ni mngon par shes pa rnams te byung ba dang dus mnyam du ji ltar bsam pa'i bya ba sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meditative attainments are the superknowledges, because they accomplish the intended action simultaneously with their occurrence.üîΩOne is not reborn due to the power of those meditative states, etc.

original: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa de dag gi dbang gis mi skye zhes bya ba ni rang dbang gi sems kyi bsam pa de yang dag par sgrub bo //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa de dag gi dbang gis mi skye zhes bya ba ni rang dbang gi sems kyi bsam pa de yang dag par sgrub bo //
translated: One accomplishes the intended action of the mind with independence.

original: gang du byang chub kyi yan lag yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bar mthong ba zhes bya ba ni gang na sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams dang 'grogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang du byang chub kyi yan lag yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bar mthong ba zhes bya ba ni gang na sangs rgyas rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams dang 'grogs pa'o //
translated: One sees where the factors of enlightenment are perfected, i.e., where the Buddhas and the great bodhisattvas are.

original: chos thams cad rnam par dag par 'pho ba med pa nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs par rnam par 'jig pa med pa nyid du mthong ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam par dag par 'pho ba med pa nyid dang / kun nas nyon mongs par rnam par 'jig pa med pa nyid du mthong ste /
translated: He sees all phenomena as pure, without transition, and as the destruction of the afflictions.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are dependently arisen.

original: rnam par dag pa der yang ci yang gzhag pa med la /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa der yang ci yang gzhag pa med la /
translated: And in that purity, nothing is established.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa las kyang ci yang bsal ba med de /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa las kyang ci yang bsal ba med de /
translated: And from the afflictions, nothing is removed.

original: gnyen po la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par ldog cing /
analyzed: gnyen po la brten nas kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par ldog cing /
translated: In dependence on the antidotes, the afflictions are reversed.

original: rnam par dag pa yang mngon te /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa yang mngon te /
translated: And purity is manifested.

original: gang gi phyir chos thams cad rkyen la brten pa nyid yin pas 'pho ba med pa nyid dang / rnam par 'jig pa med pa nyid du rtogs pas zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos thams cad rkyen la brten pa nyid yin pas 'pho ba med pa nyid dang / rnam par 'jig pa med pa nyid du rtogs pas zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because all phenomena are dependent on conditions, they are understood to be without transition and without destruction.

original: de'i kun 'byung ba ring du gyur pas /
analyzed: de'i kun 'byung ba ring du gyur pas /
translated: Its origin is far away.

original: de bas kyang shas cher 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba thams cad de'i rgyur gyur pa ma rig pa dang bcas par bsrabs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas kyang shas cher 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba thams cad de'i rgyur gyur pa ma rig pa dang bcas par bsrabs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, all the afflictions associated with the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm that are to be abandoned by cultivation, together with the ignorance that is their cause, are reduced.

original: lta ba rnams ni sa dang po nyid du mthong ba'i lam gyis spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: lta ba rnams ni sa dang po nyid du mthong ba'i lam gyis spangs pa yin te /
translated: The views are abandoned by the path of seeing on the first spiritual level.

original: gang gi phyir de de bas kyang shas cher 'dod pa'i 'ching ba thams cad bsrabs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de de bas kyang shas cher 'dod pa'i 'ching ba thams cad bsrabs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of that, all the fetters of the desire realm are reduced.

original: gzugs kyi 'ching ba thams cad dang / srid pa'i 'ching ba thams cad dang / ma rig pa'i 'ching ba thams cad spangs par 'gyur ro //üîΩde'i lta bar gyur @180a * //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'ching ba thams cad dang / srid pa'i 'ching ba thams cad dang / ma rig pa'i 'ching ba thams cad spangs par 'gyur ro // de'i lta bar gyur @180a * //
translated: All the fetters of the form realm, all the fetters of the formless realm, and all the fetters of ignorance are abandoned.

original: pa'i 'ching ba rnams ni snga nas kyang spangs pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i 'ching ba rnams ni snga nas kyang spangs pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The fetters that are views were previously abandoned.

original: log pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa 'grib par bya ba ma yin par spong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba la mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi bag la nyal spong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: log pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa 'grib par bya ba ma yin par spong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba la mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi bag la nyal spong ba yin gyi /
translated: He eliminates the latent states of the roots of unwholesomeness,

original: sngar bsal ba'i phyir kun du 'byung ba sel bar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sngar bsal ba'i phyir kun du 'byung ba sel bar ni ma yin te /
translated: but not their appearance, because they have already been eliminated.

original: gnag gi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od byed pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni bskal pa brgya phrag du ma nas /
analyzed: gnag gi phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od byed pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni bskal pa brgya phrag du ma nas /
translated: The bodhisattva who is on this Radiant bodhisattva-stage, for many hundreds of eons,

original: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du mar log pa'i 'dod chags 'grib par bya ba ma yin par spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du mar log pa'i 'dod chags 'grib par bya ba ma yin par spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: for many thousands of eons, for many hundreds of thousands of eons, for many millions of eons, for many tens of millions of eons, for many billions of eons, for many tens of billions of eons, for many trillions of eons, for many quintillions of eons, does not eliminate wrong desire, etc. to be diminished.

original: log pa'i zhe sdang 'grib par bya ba ma yin pa dang / log pa'i gti mug 'grib par bya ba ma yin par spong bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: log pa'i zhe sdang 'grib par bya ba ma yin pa dang / log pa'i gti mug 'grib par bya ba ma yin par spong bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: He does not eliminate wrong hatred, etc. to be diminished. He does not eliminate wrong delusion, etc. to be diminished.

original: gser gyi sa le sbram gyi dpes ni gron med de srang ka thub pas sa 'og ma la dbang byed de /
analyzed: gser gyi sa le sbram gyi dpes ni gron med de srang ka thub pas sa 'og ma la dbang byed de /
translated: The example of refined gold shows that it is inexhaustible, and that it is used for ornaments.

original: sa 'di la 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gro ba nyams pa med par yongs su ston te /
analyzed: sa 'di la 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gro ba nyams pa med par yongs su ston te /
translated: He shows that he is free of attachment to this level.

original: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di lta ste /
translated: O sons of the Conqueror, it is like this:

original: dper na gser gyi sa le sbram de nyid mgar ba mkhas pa'i lag na bsrel na srang grangs kyi tshad bzhin du 'dug go //
analyzed: dper na gser gyi sa le sbram de nyid mgar ba mkhas pa'i lag na bsrel na srang grangs kyi tshad bzhin du 'dug go //
translated: For example, when that same refined gold is heated by a skilled goldsmith, it remains the same weight, whether measured by the ounce or any other standard.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od byed pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'od byed pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang /
translated: O sons of the Conqueror, in the same way, the bodhisattva on this Radiant bodhisattva level,

original: bskal pa brgya phrag du ma nas bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma'i bar du log pa'i 'dod chags 'grib par bya ba ma yin par spong bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bskal pa brgya phrag du ma nas bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du ma'i bar du log pa'i 'dod chags 'grib par bya ba ma yin par spong bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: for many hundreds of eons, up to many quintillions of eons, abandons the nonvirtuous factors that are not to be abandoned, such as the wrong kinds of desire.

original: de gnod pa byed pa la mi 'khrugs pa dang / gzhan gyi sems rjes su srung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de gnod pa byed pa la mi 'khrugs pa dang / gzhan gyi sems rjes su srung ba'i phyir /
translated: He is not disturbed by harm-doers, and in order to protect the minds of others,

original: bzod pa dang des pa'i bsam pa shas cher yongs su dag pa yin te /
analyzed: bzod pa dang des pa'i bsam pa shas cher yongs su dag pa yin te /
translated: he has a very pure attitude of patience and gentleness.

original: gang gi phyir de'i bzod pa dang des pa'i bsam pa yang de bas shas cher yongs su dag par 'gyur zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i bzod pa dang des pa'i bsam pa yang de bas shas cher yongs su dag par 'gyur zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because his patience and gentle attitude become even more purified.

original: de ni gnod pa byed pa'i bye brag gis tha dad par yongs su ston te /
analyzed: de ni gnod pa byed pa'i bye brag gis tha dad par yongs su ston te /
translated: This shows the differences in patience due to the differences in the offenders.

original: gnod pa byed du dogs pa la ni bshes pa nyid snyan pa'i tshig gis sbyor te gang gi phyir bshes shing 'jam pa'i bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa byed du dogs pa la ni bshes pa nyid snyan pa'i tshig gis sbyor te gang gi phyir bshes shing 'jam pa'i bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: When he fears that the offender will not be reconciled, he is gentle, using pleasing words, because he has a gentle attitude.

original: gnod pa byed pa la ni mi 'khrugs pa dang / phyir mi gshe ba la sogs pa dang yid mi bde ba mi bskyed pa ni gnag gi phyir mi g-yo ba'i bsam pa nyid dang mi 'khrugs @180b pa'i bsam pa nyid dang g-yo ba med pa'i bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa la ni mi 'khrugs pa dang / phyir mi gshe ba la sogs pa dang yid mi bde ba mi bskyed pa ni gnag gi phyir mi g-yo ba'i bsam pa nyid dang mi 'khrugs @180b pa'i bsam pa nyid dang g-yo ba med pa'i bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: When the offender is not reconciled, he is not agitated, does not get angry, etc., and does not generate mental unhappiness, because he has an unperturbed attitude, an unshakable attitude, and an unagitated attitude.

original: 'das pa la nga rgyal med pas bdag gis bshad kyis 'chags pa ni gnag gi phyir /
analyzed: 'das pa la nga rgyal med pas bdag gis bshad kyis 'chags pa ni gnag gi phyir /
translated: Since he is not proud about his own forbearance, he confesses his own faults, because he has a humble attitude.

original: mtho dman med pa'i bsam pa nyid //üîΩces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mtho dman med pa'i bsam pa nyid //üîΩces gsungs pa'o //
translated: He is not haughty or contemptuous toward others, because he has no high or low attitude.

original: gzhan las 'dud pa'i bya ba la mi smon pa ni gang gi phyir sems can gyis byas pa la 'dod pa med pa'i bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan las 'dud pa'i bya ba la mi smon pa ni gang gi phyir sems can gyis byas pa la 'dod pa med pa'i bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: Not hoping for a return favor from others is explained as ‚Äúthe very attitude of not wanting anything done by sentient beings.‚Äù

original: lan du phan 'dogs par byed par smon pa ni gnag gi phyir byas pa la phyir byed par re ba med pa'i bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: lan du phan 'dogs par byed par smon pa ni gnag gi phyir byas pa la phyir byed par re ba med pa'i bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //
translated: Hoping for a return favor is explained as ‚Äúthe very attitude of not expecting a return for what is done for others.‚Äù

original: bcos pa ma yin par phan gdags par spyod pa sbyor ba dang / nye mgon med de mnyam par phan 'dogs par 'jug pa ni gang gi phyir g-yo med cing sgyu med pa'i bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //üîΩmi dga' ba chung du dang yang 'brel pa med pa ni gnag gi phyir /üîΩthibs po med pa'i bsam pa nyid //
analyzed: bcos pa ma yin par phan gdags par spyod pa sbyor ba dang / nye mgon med de mnyam par phan 'dogs par 'jug pa ni gang gi phyir g-yo med cing sgyu med pa'i bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o // mi dga' ba chung du dang yang 'brel pa med pa ni gnag gi phyir / thibs po med pa'i bsam pa nyid //
translated: The practice of helping without pretense, the application of helping without partiality, is explained as ‚Äúthe very attitude of being without deceit and guile.‚Äù

original: ces gsungs pa'o //üîΩsa 'di'i lhag ma ni snga ma'i tshul bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa'o // sa 'di'i lhag ma ni snga ma'i tshul bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Not being associated with even the slightest displeasure is explained as ‚Äúthe very attitude of being without thickets.‚Äù

original: 'phags pa sa bcu pa las /
analyzed: 'phags pa sa bcu pa las /
translated: The rest of this stage should be understood according to the previous explanations.

original: sa gsum pa'i rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: sa gsum pa'i rnam par bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the explanation of the third ground of the buddhas-to-be.

original: // / bam po bdun pa /
analyzed: // / bam po bdun pa /
translated: 7.üîΩ

original: sa bzhi pa ni ting nge 'dzin rnam par dag pa la brten nas /
analyzed: sa bzhi pa ni ting nge 'dzin rnam par dag pa la brten nas /
translated: The fourth stage is distinguished by the purification of meditative concentration,

original: thos pa gzung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba'o //
analyzed: thos pa gzung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba'o //
translated: and by the purification of the knowledge of the correct retention of what one has heard.

original: de yang rnam pa bzhis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bzhis rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: This stage is to be understood as being established in four ways:

original: rnam par dag pa dang gnyen po bsgom pa 'phel ba'i rgyu rnam par gzhag pa dang / rnam par dag pa 'phel ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / gnyen po bsgom pa 'phel ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pas so //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa dang gnyen po bsgom pa 'phel ba'i rgyu rnam par gzhag pa dang / rnam par dag pa 'phel ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / gnyen po bsgom pa 'phel ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pas so //
translated: by the establishment of the cause of the increase of the cultivation of purification, by the establishment of the increase of purification, by the establishment of the increase of the cultivation of the counteragent, and by the establishment of its result.

original: de la rnam par dag pa dang gnyen po bsgom pa 'phel ba'i rgyu ni chos la snang bas 'jug pa bcu ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par dag pa dang gnyen po bsgom pa 'phel ba'i rgyu ni chos la snang bas 'jug pa bcu ste /
translated: The cause of the increase of the cultivation of purification and the counteragent is the tenfold entry into the light of the Dharma.

original: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum pa la snang ba shin tu yongs su dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa bzhi pa non te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum pa la snang ba shin tu yongs su dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa bzhi pa non te /
translated: O sons of the victors, when the bodhisattva, on the third bodhisattva stage, whose illumination is very pure, has ascended to the fourth bodhisattva stage,

original: des chos la snang ba'i 'jug pa bcus gnon to zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: des chos la snang ba'i 'jug pa bcus gnon to zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: he ascends by means of ten illuminations of the Dharma.

original: snang ba na rtogs pa'i ye shes te des der rtogs pa la de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i chos rnams la 'jug pas ye shes de ni chos la snang bas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba na rtogs pa'i ye shes te des der rtogs pa la de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i chos rnams la 'jug pas ye shes de ni chos la snang bas 'jug pa'o //
translated: Illumination is the gnosis of realization, and by it he enters into the teachings of the Tathagata. Thus, this gnosis is the entry into the illumination of the Dharma.

original: de dag dang de mtshungs par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de dag dang de mtshungs par rtog pa ste /
translated: They are similar to that, i.e., to the entry into the illumination of the Dharma.

original: shes bya ji lta ba bzhin du gnyi ga 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde ni rnam par dpyad pa'i bye brag @181a * //
analyzed: shes bya ji lta ba bzhin du gnyi ga 'byung ba'i phyir ro // de ni rnam par dpyad pa'i bye brag @181a * //
translated: They arise in the same way as the knowable, i.e., both arise in the same way.üîΩThat is to be known by means of ten kinds of analysis.

original: rnam pa bcus rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bcus rig par bya ste /
translated: The analysis is into ten kinds of distinctions.

original: rnam par dpyad pa'i bye brag la sems can rnams gdags pa'i bye brag ni /
analyzed: rnam par dpyad pa'i bye brag la sems can rnams gdags pa'i bye brag ni /
translated: The analysis into distinctions of sentient beings is as follows.

original: gang gi phyir sems can gyi khams rnam par dpyad pa la snang bas 'jug pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems can gyi khams rnam par dpyad pa la snang bas 'jug pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because of the realm of sentient beings, the engagement through appearance in the investigation of the world is mentioned.

original: gnas kyi bye brag ni gnag gi phyir 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par dpyad pa la snang bas 'jug pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas kyi bye brag ni gnag gi phyir 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par dpyad pa la snang bas 'jug pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because of the specific location, the engagement through appearance in the investigation of the world is mentioned.

original: rang bzhin gyi bye brag ni gnag gi phyir chos kyi dbyings rnam par dpyad pa la snang bas 'jug pa shes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi bye brag ni gnag gi phyir chos kyi dbyings rnam par dpyad pa la snang bas 'jug pa shes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because of the specific nature, the engagement through appearance in the investigation of the dharmadhatu is mentioned.

original: mtha'i bye brag ni gang gi phyir nam mkha' rnam par dpyad pa la snang bas 'jug pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: mtha'i bye brag ni gang gi phyir nam mkha' rnam par dpyad pa la snang bas 'jug pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because of the specific limit, the engagement through appearance in the investigation of space is mentioned.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i gnas kyi bye brag ni gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa'i khams rnam par dpyad pa la snang bas 'jug pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i gnas kyi bye brag ni gang gi phyir rnam par shes pa'i khams rnam par dpyad pa la snang bas 'jug pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Because of the specific location of defilement and purification, the engagement through appearance in the investigation of the consciousness element is mentioned.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bye brag ni gnag gi phyir 'dod pa'i khams rnam par dpyad pa la snang bas 'jug pa dang / gzugs kyi khams rnam par dpyad pa la snang bas 'jug pa dang / gzugs med pa'i khams rnam par dpyad pa la snang bas 'jug pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bye brag ni gnag gi phyir 'dod pa'i khams rnam par dpyad pa la snang bas 'jug pa dang / gzugs kyi khams rnam par dpyad pa la snang bas 'jug pa dang / gzugs med pa'i khams rnam par dpyad pa la snang bas 'jug pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The specific afflictions are stated as: engaging in the analysis of the desire realm through the appearance of darkness, engaging in the analysis of the form realm through the appearance of light, and engaging in the analysis of the formless realm through the appearance of light.

original: rnam par byang ba'i bye brag ni gang gi phyir bsam pa rlabs po che'i mos pa'i rnam par dpyad pa la snang bas 'jug pa dang / che ba nyid kyi bsam pa mos pa'i khams rnam par dpyad pa la snang bas 'jug pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i bye brag ni gang gi phyir bsam pa rlabs po che'i mos pa'i rnam par dpyad pa la snang bas 'jug pa dang / che ba nyid kyi bsam pa mos pa'i khams rnam par dpyad pa la snang bas 'jug pa zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The specific purities are stated as: engaging in the analysis of the interest of vast aspiration and engaging in the analysis of the element of interest of greatness.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa ni khams gsum po dag go //
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa ni khams gsum po dag go //
translated: Therein, the afflictions are the three realms.

original: rnam par byang ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Purities are twofold:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang sems can yongs su mi gtong ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang sems can yongs su mi gtong ba'i dbang du byas nas /

translated: The qualities that are of the very essence of the Tathagata are those that are revealed by the Tathagata.üîΩThe ten qualities that bring about the full maturation of wisdom are the full maturation of wisdom because they bring about the full maturation of wisdom through four kinds of wisdom.üîΩThe four kinds of wisdom are: the wisdom that is based on oneself, the wisdom that is based on others, the wisdom that is based on causes, and the wisdom that is based on conditions.

original: ye shes yongs su smin par byed pa'i chos bcus zhes bya ba ni chos la snang bas 'jug pa dang / dus mnyam du thos pa dag gis zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //

original: de dag ni ye shes rnam pa bzhis yongs su smin par byed pas ye shes yongs su smin par byed pa ste /

translated: The full maturation of wisdom is described as the full maturation of wisdom because it brings about the full maturation of wisdom through four kinds of wisdom.

original: ye shes rnam pa bzhi la rang gi gnas la gnas pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: ye shes rnam pa bzhi la rang gi gnas la gnas pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The four kinds of wisdom are: the wisdom that is based on oneself, the wisdom that is based on others, the wisdom that is based on causes, and the wisdom that is based on conditions.üîΩThe wisdom that is based on oneself is the wisdom that is based on the Dharma.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //üîΩdkon mchog gsum la dad pa dang ldan pa ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i bsam pa nyid ces gsungs pa'o //üîΩdkon mchog gsum la dad pa dang ldan pa ni gang gi phyir /
translated: The wisdom that is based on others is the wisdom that is based on the meaning.üîΩThe wisdom that is based on causes is the wisdom that is based on the teaching of the Dharma.üîΩThe wisdom that is based on conditions is the wisdom that is based on the teaching of the meaning.

original: dkon mchog gsum la dad pa mi phyed pa'i mthar thug par 'gro ba zhes gsungs pa'o //üîΩde bzhin nyid shes pa ni gnag gi phyir /
